column7: Title
column8: Description
column9: Notes

column7: Gameplay - User's character is able to break collistion if the user presses the PS button right as the user's character jumps.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, any level, if the user's character goes up to a snake bunker, jumps, immediately user presses the PS button, lets the game sit idle momentarily, notice that the user's character is not at his location from when he jumped. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1)Start any match
2)Move to a snake bunker so that the user's character is prompted to jump
3)Press the X button to jump
4)User's character moves towards the bunker and right as he jumps press the PS button to bring up the XMB 
6)Let the game sit idle at the XMB for at least 1 min.
7)Press the PS button to resume into gameplay
8)Notice that the user's character is outside the level and the user's character no longer has collision detection 

Expected Results:
There must be collision detection at all times.

NOTE: This bug is similar to 6477. If the user does not get this bug to occur, bug 6477 occurs.
NOTE: This occurs on the following maps; 
San Diego, CA
Jacksonville, FL
Huntington Beach, CA
Charlotte, NC
Malaga, Spain
London, England
Paris, France
Nurburgring, Germany
Bakersfield, CA
Miami, FL

NOTE: Video Capture available.

column7: Gameplay - User's character is not in his current location if the user presses the PS button right as the user's character jumps.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, any level, if the user's character goes up to a snake bunker, jumps, immediately user presses the PS button, lets the game sit idle momentarily, notice that the user's character is not at his location from when he jumped. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1)Start any match
2)Move to a snake bunker so that the user's character is prompted to jump
3)Jump and immediately press the PS button
4)Let the game sit idle momentarily
5)Press the PS button to resume into gameplay
6)Notice that the user's character is not at his location from when he jumped 

Expected Results:
The user's character must be in his current location when pressing the PS button.

NOTE: It appears as though the user's character continues to float from where he had jumped. If the user sits idle in the XMB screen long enough, resumes gameplay, the user's character will be hundreds of feet in the air.

column7: Video/Graphic - Tournament Selection Screen: In a save with the Career Mode completed Tournaments with Two selections have the wrong corresponding graphic and tournament name
column8:
Summary:
Tournament Selection Screen: In a save with the Career Mode completed Tournaments with Two selections have the wrong corresponding graphic and tournament name.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) With a Completion save from the Main Menu select Career Mode.
2) Select Play Tournament.
3) Proceed to any tournament that has 2 choices.
4) Notice that the Text lists the second tournament while the title card is for the first tournament.

Expected Results:
Title cards must appear with the appropriate Title.

Note: This happens on the following tournaments: 
12 Malaga, Spain Shows Florida Invitational
16 London, England Shows SoCal Invitational
19Toulouse, France Shows Texas Invitational
22 Nurburging, Germany Shows Tempe Invitational

Note: Pressing the Down Button will change the Title Text, while Pressing the Up Button will change the Title Card.

column7: Crash - Multiplayer: If the user disconnects the network cable from the PS3 just after the Create Room "Please Wait" screen, the user crashes on the Create Game screen.
column8:
Summary:
In Multiplayer, if the user disconnects the network cable from the PS3 just after the Create Room "Please Wait" screen, the user crashes on the Create Game screen.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User selects Multiplayer
2) Selects Selects Playstation Network
3) Selects Player Match
4) Selects create game
5) Selects any map
6) Selects continue
7) User observes the Create Room "Please Wait" screen
8) (Very timing specific) As soon as the Create Room "Please Wait" screen disappears, the user disconnects the network cable from the PS3
9) The user observes a crash on the Create Game screen

Expected Results:
Users must not crash.

NOTE: Crash dump is on the FTP.
NOTE: This bug is VERY timing specific, the user must disconnect the network cable as the Create Game screen flashes after the "Please Wait" screen disappears.

column7: Once - Technical Check - Leaderboards: The Scoreboards did not update after the user completed Career Mode while signed out of the Playstation Network and then signed in after Career was completed
column8:
Summary:
Once, in the Scoreboard, if the user completed completed Career Mode while signed off of the Playstation Network, signed in after completing Career, the Scoreboards did not update to show the user's progress

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User booted the game while signed out of the Playstation Network
2) Selected Career Mode on the Main Menu
3) Completed Career Mode
4) Pushed the Playstation button to open the Playstation XMB
5) Signed into the Playstation Network
6) Returned to the Main Menu
7) Selected Multiplayer
8) Selected PlayStationNetwork
9) Selected Scoreboard
10) Selected the Career scoreboards
11) Once, the Scoreboards were not updated to reflect the user's progress while not signed into the Playstation Network

Expected Results:
The Scoreboards must update properly when the user signs into the Playstation Network

column7: Occasionally - Gameplay - Exhibition (Custom Field): If bunkers are arranged with a small gap between bunkers, occasionally AI will pick a path to run that the NPC is unable to fit though.
column8:
Summary:
Occasionally, during gameplay in a an Exhibition Match on a Custom Field, if bunkers are arranged with gaps between them the Enemy NPCs will continue to run at the gap that is too small, and become stuck and unable to retrieve the flag.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main menu enter the filed creator,
2) Create a field with many bunkers place just close enough so that the NPCs can not pass though the gap,
3) Save the field,
4) Enter the newly created filed in Exhibition Mode,
5) Occasionally during gameplay the user observed that NPCs became stuck in the gaps because they the AI had picked a path that was to narrow for the NPC to pass through.

Expected Results:
NPCs must always be able to retrieve the flag.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: Hand appears floating when reloading while wearing both smart parts defender & Quick Grip Glove.
column8:
Summary:
In game-play, with both the Smart Parts Defender jersey and the Quick Grip Gloves equipped, the user's character's hand appears floating when reloading hopper.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu user selects Career Mode.
2) Selects Gear Store.
3) Purchases the Smart Parts Defender jersey and the Quick Grip Gloves.
4) Exits Gears store and selects Team Outfit.
5) Equips the Smart Parts Defender jersey and the Quick Grip Gloves.
6) Enters any mode of game-play.
7) Reloads hopper.
8) Observe that the user's character's hand appears floating.

Expected Results:
User's character's hand must not appear floating.

Note():
Image attached.

column7: Gameplay - Career Mode: The Ramping during gameplay does not function properly
column8:
Summary:
The user is not informed that Ramping is not allowed in Career Mode, and therefore does not function.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User selects Career Mode on the Main Menu
2) Selects Team Manager
3) Upgrades the user's player's Marker Handling skill to level 3 or higher
4) Selects Play Tournament on the Career menu
5) Proceeds into gameplay on any level
6) Pushes the START button to enter the Pause Menu
7) Selects Options
8) Selects Gameplay
9) Sets the Ramping option to ON
10) Returns to gameplay
11) Pushes the R1 button or R2 button repeatedly at a fast pace
12) Notice that the user's character is not ramping

Expected Results:
The following text must be displayed when "Ramping" is highlighted in the Options -> Gameplay menu:

"Ramping is not available for use in NPPL, XPSL, and Millennium Series tournaments."

Note: This change must be applied to the Options -> Gameplay menu on the Main Menu, as well as in Career Mode gameplay.

column7: Once - Video/Graphic - Multiplayer: One client observed a flashing HUD, and sporadic screen tearing while in a Player Match with 14 users.
column8:
Summary: One client observed a flashing HUD, and sporadic screen tearing while in a Player Match with 14 users.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates a Default, Player Match.
2) Users 2-14 join User 1's match.
3) Users begin gameplay.
4) Once, a client observed their HUD was flashing, and the screen was tearing sporadically. (After the in-game countdown)

Expected Results: Users must not observe video/graphic corruptions.

NOTE(1): This issue occured after the countdown during the first round, and continued throughout the rest of the match.
NOTE(2): The screen tearing was small, but occured very frequently.

column7: Twice - Crash - Multiplayer : During 14 player gameplay, one client soft locked on the round results screen with corrupt audio.
column8:
Summary:
During ranked or player match multiplayer gameplay with 14 players, one client soft locked on the round results screen with corrupt aduo.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) The host created a default player or ranked match
2) 13 clients join the match
3) Gameplay begins
4) On the first round results screen, one client soft locked on the round results screen with corrupt audio 

Expected Results:
The game must not soft lock on the round results screen during 14 player gameplay.

NOTE(1): The user will eventually recover and recieve the diconnected from host message. After selecting OK on the message, the client will recieve an infinite load screen when attempting to join a newly hosted match.

column7: Frequently - Crash - Multiplayer: When 14 Clients attempt to join simultaneously to a Host using a simulated connection speed of 1.544 mbps/256KBps, the Host crashes.
column8:
Summary:
In Multiplayer, when 14 Clients attempt to join simultaneously to a Host using a simulated connection speed of 1.544 mbps/256kbps, the Host crashes in the Game Lobby.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Host using a simulated connection speed of 1.544 mbps/256KBps hosts a default Player Match
2) 14 Clients join the Host's game simultaneously 
3) Frequently the Host crashes in the Game Lobby

Expected Results:
Users must not crash.

NOTE: During this bug, the Host encounters severe lag when Client's are joining.
NOTE: Frequently some Clients encounter 45 second loading screens into the Game Lobby.
NOTE: Crash dump uploaded to the FTP under the following location: /Paintball/AMP QA Bug Captures and Dumps/Crash Dumps/PS3/Paintball_PS3_10.21.08_#6455
NOTE: 2 TTYs are attached .
NOTE: The throttled connection is set up using the NEW UI PC tool.

column7: Once - Video/Graphic - Gameplay: Camera clipped through the ground during Autosave after losing a Match.
column8:
Summary:
Once - Gameplay: Camera clipped through the ground during Autosave after losing a Match.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, selected Career Mode,
2) Selected Tournament 16a - Millennium SPL Campaign Cup,
3) Lost a Preliminary Match,
4) Pressed the X Button to skip the Opponent's Flag run,
5) Observed Camera clip through the ground during Autosave.

Expected Results:
Camera must not clip through the ground.

NOTE(1): Screen shot attached.
NOTE(2): Similar to bug 6281.
NOTE(3): This problem may occur more often when losing a Match. If the User presses the X Button to skip the Opponent's run to grab the User's Team's Flag, the Camera will focus on the Flag Runner Opponent where that Opponent was positioned when the User pressed the X Button. This enables the final Camera view to be located absolutely anywhere on the course and increases the chances of the Camera being placed under the ground or inside of a bunker.

column7: Options - If the user sets the Master Volume to 0, the live-action videos will still play at normal volume.
column8:
Summary:
If the user goes into Options, Audio, and sets the Master Volume to 0, it is noticed that the music in all of the live-action videos play at its normal volume. NOTE: this also includes the videos that play in Career Mode that play after the user completes a division.

1) On a new profile got to Options, Audio.
2) Set the Master Volume to 0.
3) Enter Career Mode for the first time.
4) Observe that the live-action introduction video of the professional paintball players has its normal music volume.

Expected Results:
The Master Volume that the user sets in Options must be reflected throughout all areas of the game.

column7: Options - If the user sets the music volume to 0, the live-action videos will still play at normal volume.
column8:
Summary:
If the user goes into Options, Audio, and sets the Music Volume to 0, it is noticed that the music in all of the live-action videos play at its normal volume. NOTE: this also includes the videos that play in Career Mode that play after the user completes a division.

1) On a new profile got to Options, Audio.
2) Set the Music Volume to 0.
3) Enter Career Mode for the first time.
4) Observe that the live-action introduction video of the professional paintball players has normal music volume.

Expected Results:
The Music Volume that the user sets in Options must be reflected throughout all areas of the game.

column7: Crash - Multiplayer: If the Host has a simulated PPPoE connection, and exits the game lobby, when the first of 10 Clients attempting to join the game enters the lobby, the Host observes their game crash on an empty game lobby.
column8:
Summary:
While in a Player Match, Game lobby, if the Host has a simulated PPPoE connection, and exits the game lobby, when the first of 10 Clients attempting to join the game enters the lobby, the Host observes their game crash on an empty game lobby.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 Hosts a default Player Match game lobby.
2) Users 2 - 11 navigate to a default Player Match Games List.
3) Users observe and highlight User 1's game.
4) Users join User 1's game consecutively (one after another).
5) Immediately after User 1 observes a Client enter the game lobby, User 1 presses the CIRCLE button to access the exit confirm screen and selects "Yes".
6) User 1 observes their game crash on a blank game lobby.

Expected Results:
User must not observe the game crash when exiting a game lobby.

Note: The PPPoE setting used for the Host, is set in the Network connection settings menu in the System software screen.
Note: This issue was reproduced during an at home test, the connection used during the at home test is the following: 6194kbps down / 753 up
Note: Console did not produce a full crash dump.
Note: TTY attached.
Note: Once, a client that attempted to join remained on a loading screen indefinetly.

column7: Scoring - Results: Round Results show a single Survivor on the Losing Team in Elimination Matches.
column8:
Summary:
Results: Round Results show a single Survivor on the Losing Team in Elimination Matches.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Start any Elimination Match (either in Career Mode Tournaments, Quickplay, or in Exhibition) with more than one Round,
2) Complete a Round,
3) Observe the Results Screen shows a single Survivor on the Losing Team.

Expected Results:
The Results Screen must display the correct scores.

NOTE(1): This bug ONLY occurs on the Round Results Screen. The final Match Results Screen displays the correct number of Survivors.

column7: Gameplay - During gameplay, the window of opportunity to jump over a bunker is too short.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, if the user is running at a snake bunker, while holding down L1 to sprint, the prompt to press X button to jump appears and then disappears too quickly for the user to notice it and perform the jump. It becomes too difficult to anticipate when the prompt will appear so the user will run into the bunker instead of jumping over it.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter gameplay in any speedball arena.
2) While sprinting, run toward a snake bunker.
3) Observe that the prompt to press X button to jump appears and then disappears too quickly for the user to see it and react to it.

Expected Results:
The user must be given enough time to see the prompt and react to it.

column7: Twice - Gameplay - Field Creator: When User entered fly mode in CPC French Open, camera was stuck and would not move around field
column8:
Summary: During gameplay, when User entered fly mode in Paris, France or CPC French Open in Field Creator, the camera would not move around the field and was stuck in place. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Selected Field Creator from Main Menu,
2) Selected CPC French Open,
3) Removed all bunkers,
4) Changed bunker color to yellow and black,
5) Placed several large Hamburger bunkers in top half of field,
6) Pressed Triangle to enter fly mode,
7) Observed that camera was stuck in place and L stick would not move camera around field. 

Expected Results: Camera must not be stuck during fly mode. 

Note: Video footage is Available on the FTP. 

Note: This also happened in Nurburgring, Germany with different bunker set up and color scheme.

column7: Occasionally - Gamplay - Exhibition (Custom Field): Enemy NPC becomes stuck on bunker when attempting to return the flag.
column8:
Summary:
Occasionally, during gameplay on a custom field, when an enemy NPC has the flag and moved back to the NPCs flag station the NPC will became stuck and be unable to return the flag.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Load save with custom field or create the field from the layout photo attached,
2) Enter the custom field in a 1v1 capture the flag match,
3) Observe that when the enemy NPC is returning the flag it will become stuck on the bunker closest to its teams flag station, after moving toward the center of the filed from the bunker restricted zone.

Expected Results:
Enemy NPCs must not become stuck on bunkers when returning the flag.

column7: Occasionally - Video/Graphic - Career Mode - Breakout Planner: The camera view appears to be overlooking a flag station for a brief moment
column8:
Summary: 
Occasionally, during Career Mode, before the Breakout Planner, the camera view appears to be overlooking a flag station for a brief moment before entering into the Breakout Planner

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Entered Career Mode
2) Proceed through the tournaments and into the Breakout Planner
3) Occasionally, observed that the camera view appears to be overlooking a flag station for a brief moment before entering into the Breakout Planner

Expected Results:
The camera view must transition smoothly from the loading screen to the Breakout Planner

column7: Video/Graphic - NPPL Commanders Cup: There is no final FMV after completing the tournament
column8:
Summary: 
During Career Mode, NPPL Commanders Cup, there is no final FMV after completing the tournament

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter Career Mode, in NPPL Commanders Cup
2) Complete the tournament
3) Observe that there is no final FMV for completing the career mode

Expected Results:
FMV must play after completing the career mode
column9:
[Kyle Kleven (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/30/2008 03:25:53 AM]
Still occurs in 10/29/08 PS3 build.

column7: Technical Check - Multiplayer: The Ranked Match Game Lobby restrictive text appears for the Client within a Player Match Game Lobby, when that Client accepts an invite from the Play Online menu after backing out of the Ranked Match menu system.
column8:
Summary:
If the Client receives a game invite from a Player Match game and proceeds to navigate anywhere within the Ranked Match menu system, returns to the Play Online menu, and then accepts the game invite into the Player Match, the Client observes that the Ranked Match Game Lobby text will appear within that Player Match Game Lobby.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 and User 2 are PlayStation Network friends.
2) From the Main menu, User 1 (HOST) hosts a Multiplayer, PlayStation Network, Player Match game with any settings.
3) From the Main menu, User 2 (CLIENT) navigates to the Play Online menu.
4) Within their game lobby, User 1 presses the "TRIANGLE" button to bring up the Friends screen.
5) User 1 proceeds to invite User 2 to their game.
6) Within the Play Online menu, User 2 observes the game invite.
7) User 2 selects Ranked Match, there-by entering the Ranked Match menu system.
8) User 2 then presses the "CIRCLE" (Back) button once to return to the Play Online menu.
9) User 2 presses the "SQUARE" button to bring up the Messages XMB screen, and accepts User 1's game invite.
10) User 2 enters User 1's game lobby.
11) User 2 observes the Ranked Match Game Lobby texts, "Waiting for X More Players" and "The game cannot start with uneven teams", appear within User 1's Player Match Game Lobby.

Expected Results:
Ranked Match Game Lobby text must not appear within Player Match Game Lobbies.

NOTE: This only occurs through invites. If the Client was to join the game via the Games List, this bug does not occur.

column7: Video/Graphic - Multiplayer: The camera shakes when the User's character slides.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in any Multiplayer mode, if the User's is moving, "Press (A) to slide" appears, if the User slides the camera shakes. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select Multiplayer.
2) Select any mode of play.
3) Select and enter gameplay in any level.
4) During gameplay, move the User's player forward, press the (A) button to make the player slide.
5) Observes the User's camera shakes.

Expected Results:
The screen must not shake when the User is sliding.

column7: Video/Graphic - Multiplayer: The camera shakes when the User's character jump over a bunker.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in any Multiplayer mode, if the User's position the player near a short bunker, "Press (A) to Jump" appears, if the User jump over the bunker the camera shakes. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select Multiplayer.
2) Select any mode of play.
3) Select and enter gameplay in any level.
4) During gameplay, position the player near a short bunker, press the (A) button to make the player jump over the bunker.
5) Observes the User's camera shakes.

Expected Results:
The screen must not shake when the User is jumping over a bunker.

column7: Gameplay - In gameplay, if the user is running up against a wall, the prompt to perform a dive appears, but the user cannot actually perform the dive.
column8:
Summary:
In gameplay, if the user is running up against a wall, the prompt to perform a dive appears, but the user cannot actually perform the dive.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter gameplay in any arena.
2) Using a sprint, run up against the border of the arena, or in Woodsball, run up against a wooden wall.
3) User observes that the prompt to press X for a dive appears.
4) Press X button as prompted.
5) Observe that the user's character does not dive despite the prompt appearing on the screen.

Expected Results:
The prompt to perform a dive must not appear on screen if the user in fact cannot perform a dive.

column7: Technical Check - Multiplayer: Equipment goes back to default after the match is over.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, if the User selects custom equipment from the lobby and finishes the match the custom equipment does not carry over to the next match.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select Multiplayer,
2) Select Xbox LIVE, 
3) Select Ranked Match,
4) Create a game,
5) Select custom equipment,
6) At the end of the Match, quit and select a new match,
7) Observe the custom equipment selected does not carry over to the next match. 

Expected Results:
All settings must save between Xbox LIVE matches.

column7: Menu/GUI - Multiplayer: The controls for adding and removing bots are not display in the game lobby
column8:
Summary: If the User joins a game lobby, the user can press the LB or RB (left or right bumper) buttons to add bots to the lobby, the user can press left and right triggers to remove the bots, no graphic or information is displayed informing the user of this in the game lobby.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates a default Player Match game lobby.
2) Observe no graphic or information, informing the user about the ability to add and remove of bots from the game is displayed 

Expected Results: Adding and removing bots controls must be displayed in the mutiplayer game lobby.

Note: This issue also occurs in Local Network.

column7: Technical Check - Leaderboards: The Career Team Efficiency Leaderboard does not function
column8:
Summary:
The Career Team Efficiency Leaderboard does not function

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Xbox LIVE Menu, with a Xbox LIVE enabled Gamer Profile signed in.
2) The Player selects Leaderboards.
3) The Leaderboards Menu appears.
4) The Player selects Career Team Efficiency, and no scores are listed. 

Expected Results:
The Career Team Efficiency Leaderboard must be properly updated with Career stats.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: The framerate drops when the cheat meter appears after the Users Character is hit by a paintball.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, any game mode, any level, the User observe the framerate drops to less than 30 frames per second when the cheat meter appears after the Users Character is hit by a paintball.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select any Game Mode,
2) Select any level,
3) From the initial match start get hit by a paintball from the other team,
4) Observe the framerate drops to less than 30 frames per second when the cheat meter appears.

Expected Results:
The framerate must not drop below 30 frames per second.

column7: Occasionally - Collision Detection - Gameplay:The fly-by camera clips into the User's Character.
column8:
Summary:
Occasionally, during gameplay, in any level, the User observes that the fly-by camera clips through the User's Character at the end of the match when the User wins the match.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select any Game Mode,
2) Select any level,
3) Win the match,
4) Observe, occasionally the flyby camera clips through the User's Character at the end of the match. 


Expected Results:
The fly-by camera must not clip through objects.

column7: TCR 029 - Multiplayer System Link: When the Player disconnects the Ethernet cable during the loading screen, the Player receives 2 disconnect messages
column8:
Summary:
In Multiplayer System Link, when the Player disconnects the Ethernet cable from the back of the Xbox 360 console during the loading screen into the match, the Player is given two disconnect messages.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Multiplayer System Link Menu,
2) The Player selects Create Game.
3) The Player creates a default match.
4) The Match Lobby appears.
5) The Player presses the RB (Add Bots) button to add 1 bot.
6) The Player presses A (start) button to Start the match.
7) The loading screen appears.
8) The Player disconnects the Ethernet cable from the back of the Xbox 360 console.
9) The Player receives the "Disconnected From System Link" message.
10) A loading screen appears.
11) The Player receives the "Disconnected From System Link" message again.

Expected Results:
The Player must not receive the Disconnect message more than once.

When an error prevents a game from performing a task dictated by the player or expected under normal gameplay, the game must display a user-friendly message that addresses the error. The game must transparently handle software errors that are not relevant to gameplay. This is a violation of TCR 029.

column7: Gameplay - Career Mode: If the User quits out of Dynasty training mode, enter the Tournament mode and Pauses the match, the training menu will display with the name of the Users last training exercise.
column8:
Summary: Gameplay, Single Player, Career Mode, if the User quits out of Dynasty training mode, enter the Tournament mode and Pauses the match, the training menu will display with the name of the Users last training exercise.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select Career mode and Dynasty Training Drills.
2) Engage any type and stage of training.
3) Before the stage ends Pause the game and select the exit option.
4) Back out to the main selection screen for Career mode and select Play Tournament.
5) Select any Tournament, engage gameplay, and at any point in the match press the Pause button.
7) Observe the Pause menu is that of the Training Menu and has the heading of the last exited Training exercise. 

Expected Results: The Pause Menu must display the proper menu for Tournament.

A crash dump of the bug is included in the ftp.

A picture of the bug is included.

Note(1) - If the User selects the Restart option in the match it will restart with no other players on the field and the User unable to move or fire.

Note(2) - If the User selects the Restart option in the breakout manger the game will crash.

column7: Gameplay - Gameplay: User is able to press START and accept the size of the team even though there is not enough or too many players on the field in the team manager between rounds.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, any tournament where the User is able to switch out team mates between rounds, during the team manager, if the User benches all players, observe that the user is able to press the START button and continue into gameplay.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) With a full roster of players (9 players plus user's character) start any tournament (Charlotte, North Carolina)
2) Proceed to the quarter or semi finals
3) Complete the first round
4) Between the rounds, the team manager appears
5) Have all team mates either benched or in play
6) Observe that the User is able to press START and continue into gameplay

Expected Results:
The user must not be able to continue into gameplay without having the correct number of players in play.

NOTE(1): May be related to bug 5520

column7: Video/Graphic - Speedball - Toronto, Ontario: A group of audience members appears to be floating
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, in Toronto, Ontario, a section of audience members appears to be floating above the ground on the left side of the map.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select Quick Play,
2) Select Toronto, Ontario,
3) When gameplay begins, run over to the left side of the field (towards the gray scoreboard,)
4) Once in front of the scoreboard, turn to the right and move forward, all the while keeping the mesh netting on the character's immediate left,
5) Pass to the right of two groups of audience members,
6) Stop next to the second group and turn to the left,
7) Observe that this group of audience members appears to be floating above the ground.

Expected Results:
All audience members must appear properly.

NOTE(1): Screenshot attached.

column7: Menu/GUI - Menu System - Multiplayer: The Player is unable to select Speedball Marker gear after exiting the Match Lobby of a Woodsball Match.
column8:
Summary:
The Player is unable to select Speedball Marker gear after exiting the Match Lobby of a Woodsball Match.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Multiplayer Menu,
2) The Player selects Player Match.
3) The Player creates a Woodsball match, any level.
4) The Player enters the Match Lobby.
5) The Player presses the LB (Your Gear) button.
6) The Player selects a Woodsball Marker.
7) The Hopper, Barrel, and Air Tank become unselectable.
8) The Player presses the B (back) button to exit.
9) The Player then creates a default Speedball Match.
10) The Player enters the Match Lobby.
11) The Player presses the LB (Your Gear) button.
12) The Hopper, Barrel, and Air tank remain unselectable.

Expected Results:
When a Player creates a Speedball match, the proper equipment must be selectable.

Notes:
1) If the Player selects another Speedball Marker, the equipment becomes selectable again.

column7: Menu/GUI - Multiplayer: The camera does not reset from the position it was in, when closing the Your Gear menu and then re-opening it.
column8:
Summary: The Players camera does not reset from the position it was in, when closing the Your Gear menu and then re-opening it. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1) The Player creates a default Player match.
2) The Player presses LS (Your Gear) button to select gear.
3) The Player scrolls over to Harnesses.
4) The Player presses the B (Back) button.
5) The Player presses the LS (Your Gear) button to select gear again.
6) The Player observes their camera position is still focused on harnesses.

Expected Results: Camera position must reset to markers after re-opening the gear menu.

Notes:
1) This issue occurs when selecting any equipment and backing out and re-entering.

column7: Text - Dynasty Training Drills - Fitness Stage 2: There is missing punctuation on the Instructions Screen
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in Dynasty Training Drills, in the Fitness Training Drills, Stage 2, there is missing punctuation that appears on the Instructions Screen.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select Career Mode.
2) Select Dynasty Training Drills.
3) Select Fitness.
4) Select Stage 2.
5) When the stage appears, observe that the following text appears with missing punctuation:

".... The problem with the snake bunker is its low profile which makes it extremely difficult to capture...."

Change to:
".... The problem with the snake bunker is its low profile, which makes it extremely difficult to capture...."

By adding a ","(comma) after "profile"

NOTE(1): Text must also be changed in the Help Menu when accessed from the Pause Menu.

column7: TCR 022 - New Game Menu: The Xbox Guide Blade cannot be accessed until the FMV starts after selecting Continue
column8:
Summary:
The Xbox Guide Blade cannot be accessed until the FMV starts after selecting Continue

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the New Game Menu, with a Gamer Profile signed in, a Saved Game present and the Continue option available.
2) The Player selects Continue.
3) The Player quickly presses the Xbox Guide button, and the Xbox Guide Blade does not appear for ~3 seconds.

Expected Results:
There must be no delay between when the Xbox Guide button is pressed and when the Xbox Guide Blade appears.

Games must ensure that system UI can be rendered at least every 66 milliseconds in all areas of the game for any display mode. This is a violation of TCR 022.

column7: Gameplay - Career Mode: Upon completing an uncompleted Tournament the User is able to press the Start Button at the Tournament Unlock screen bringing the User back into the match.
column8:
Summary:
Career Mode: Upon completing an uncompleted Tournament the User is able to press the Start Button at the Tournament Unlock screen bringing the User back into the match.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu Select Career Mode.
2) Select Play Tournament.
3) Select an uncompleted tournament.
4) Play through the tournament normally.
5) Upon completing the tournament Press the X Button at the Results Screen.
6) At the Tournament Unlock screen Press the Start Button.
7) Notice the User will then be brought back to the Match where the User's Character and Team will be going through the victory animations.

Expected Results:
The Start Button must not have functionality during the Tournament Unlock Screen.

Note: The User is able to press the Start Button and Quit the Match this will cause the User to skip the Gear Unlock screen and causes the game not to save.
Note: The user is also able to press the Start Button to enter the Match again during the Gear Unlock Screen.

column7: Menu/GUI - Dynasty Training Drills: The B button accesses the Help Menu when pressed at the Pause Menu
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in Dynasty Training Drills, if the user presses the START button to access the Pause Menu, selects "Help," then presses the A button to return to the Pause Menu, if the user presses the B button, the Help Menu reappears.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select Dynasty Training Drills.
2) Select Accuracy, Fitness, or Leaning and Snapping.
3) Select any stage.
4) When the training drill appears, after "Go," press the START button to access the Pause Menu.
5) Select "Help" and press the A button.
6) When the Help Menu appears, press the A button to return to the Pause Menu.
7) When the Pause Menu appears again, press the B button, and observe that the Help Menu appears.

Expected Results:
Pressing the B button while in the Pause Menu must not perform any actions.

NOTE(1): If the User repeats steps 6 and 7, the Help Menu continuously appears.

column7: Video/Graphic - Field Creator: When applying the red and blue color scheme to the Small Cube bunker, the color scheme does not appear correctly
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in Field Creator, if the user applies the red and blue color scheme to the Small Cube bunker, the color pattern appears as the blue and red color scheme.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select Field Creator.
2) Select any pre-made map.
3) Set the bunker type to the Small Cube (3X3X3 ft).
4) Press right on the Directional Pad, and select the red and blue color scheme (the red square should appear in front of the blue square), and press the B button to apply.
5) Observe that when the color scheme loads, the color pattern on the Small Cube bunker appears as the blue and red color scheme.

Expected Results:
When applying the red and blue color scheme to the Small Cube bunker, the color pattern must appear properly.

NOTE(1): Screenshot attached.

column7: Video/Graphic - Field Creator: When applying a 4-way mirror to the Giant Brick bunker, the two bunkers appear offset from one another
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in Field Creator, if the user applies a 4-way mirror to the Giant Brick bunker, the four bunkers appear offset from one another vertically.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select Field Creator.
2) Select any pre-made map.
3) Select the Giant Brick bunker (5X5X10 ft).
4) Press right on the Directional Pad twice, and set the mirror to 4-way.
5) Observe that the four bunkers that appear do not line up vertically, and appear offset from one another.

Expected Results:
When applying a 4-way mirror to the Giant Brick bunker, they must line up properly.

NOTE(1): Screenshot attached.

column7: Video/Graphic - Field Creator: When applying a vertical mirror to the Giant Brick bunker, the two bunkers appear offset from one another
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in Field Creator, if the user applies a vertical mirror to the Giant Brick bunker, the two bunkers appear offset from one another.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select Field Creator.
2) Select any pre-made map.
3) Select the Giant Brick bunker (5X5X10 ft).
4) Press right on the Directional Pad twice, and set the mirror to vertical.
5) Observe that the two bunkers that appear do not line up properly, and appear offset from one another.

Expected Results:
When applying a vertical mirror to the Giant Brick bunker, they must line up properly.

NOTE(1): Screenshot attached.

column7: Video/Graphic - Field Creator: With the blue and black color scheme selected, the black color appears gray
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in Field Creator, if the user applies the blue and black color scheme to the bunkers, the black color appears gray in color.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select Field Creator.
2) Select any pre-made map.
3) When the level editor appears, press right on the Directional Pad, and then press down on the Directional Pad until the blue and black color scheme appears (the blue square should appear in front of the black one).
4) Press the B button to apply the color scheme.
5) Press the Y button to go into flyby mode, and observe that the areas of the bunker that are supposed to be black in color appear gray in color.

Expected Results:
With the blue and black color scheme selected, the black color must appear black.

column7: Video/Graphic - Field Creator: With the green and black color scheme selected, the black color appears gray
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in Field Creator, if the user applies the green and black color scheme to the bunkers, the black color appears gray in color.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select Field Creator.
2) Select any pre-made map.
3) When the level editor appears, press right on the Directional Pad, and then press down on the Directional Pad until the green and black color scheme appears (the green square should appear in front of the black one).
4) Press the B button to apply the color scheme.
5) Press the Y button to go into flyby mode, and observe that the areas of the bunker that are supposed to be black in color appear gray in color.

Expected Results:
With the green and black color scheme selected, the black color must appear black.

column7: Video/Graphic - Field Creator: Bunker colors apply to Millenium bunker inconsistently
column8:
Summary:
In the Field Editor, applying colors swatches to the Millenium bunker yields inconsistent results.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu user selects Field Creator
2) Loads any Map.
3) Places a millenium bunker on the field,
3) Highlights Color Swatch Tool.
4) Scrolls until color tool displays selection with blue swatch in front of black swatch.
5) Presses Circle button to load bunker colors.
6) Observe that the majority of the millenium bunker is blue with the remaining edge colored black.
7) Scrolls through colors until color tool displays selection with black swatch in front of yellow swatch.
8) Presses circle button to load bunker colors.
9) Observe that now the majority of the millenium bunker is yellow with the remaining edge colored black.

Expected Results:
The application of the Color swatch choices must have consistent results.
column9:
[Kyle Kleven (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/29/2008 07:11:03 AM]
Still occurs in the 10/28/08 PS3 build.

column7: Gameplay: The speed difference between 'running' and 'sprinting' is not noticeable.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, the speed difference between 'running' and 'sprinting' is not noticeable enough.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Proceed into any mode of gameplay
2) When the match begins, move the left stick forward to begin 'running'
3) Notice the movement speed of the user's character
4) Now, move the left stick forward and press and hold the L1 button to begin 'sprinting'
5) Observe that the speed difference between 'running' and 'sprinting' is barely noticeable.

Expected Results:
The user's character must move slower when 'running'.
column9:
[Kyle Kleven (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/29/2008 07:11:03 AM]
Still occurs in the 10/28/08 PS3 build.

column7: TCR 043 - Menu System - Field Creator: Text Input devices are not recognized when entering a name to store a custom field
column8:
Summary:
Text Input devices are not recognized when entering a name to store a custom field

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, with a Text Input Device connected.
2) The Player selects Field Creator.
3) The Field Creator appears.
4) The Player presses START (pause) button.
5) The Player selects Store Custom Field.
6) The Player selects a slot to store the custom field to.
7) The naming a Custom Field screen appears.
8) The Player uses the Text Input Device and nothing is recognized.

Expected Results:
The TID must be recognized on all keyboard input screens.

Games that allow a player to use a virtual keyboard in their game must also accept input from a physical text input device (TID). This is a violation of TCR 043.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay - Woodsball San Diego Field: The world shakes continuously when the Player moves along the windows of the Tippmann house
column8:
Summary:
In Woodsball San Diego Field, the world will shake continuously when the Player slides along the windows under the awning of the Tippmann house.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, in Woodsball San Diego Field,
2) The Player proceeds to the Tippmann house.
3) The Player moves against the wall with the windows under the awning.
4) The Player moves left/right along the wall and the world starts shaking continuously.

Expected Results:
The world must not shake continuously when the Player moves against the Tippmann house.

Notes:
1) The issue can be resolved by crouching and standing again.

column7: Frequently - Crash - Multiplayer: If the Host ejects their game disc via the XMB during the countdown to loading into gameplay, the Host crashes on a black screen.
column8:
Summary:
In the Multiplayer Game Lobby, if the Host ejects their game disc via the XMB during the countdown to loading into gameplay, the Host crashes on a black screen, their PS3 beeps three times and the green indicator light remains on.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select Multiplayer,
2) Select Playstation Network,
3) Select Player Match,
4) User 1 creates a game,
5) Users 2-3 join User 1's game and ready-up,
6) User 1 presses the X button to begin the countdown,
7) User 1 immediately presses the PS button to bring up the XMB,
8) User 1 highlights the game disc and presses the triangle button,
9) User 1 selects Eject Disc,
10) User 1 observes a black screen, their console beeps three times and the green indicator light remains on as their system crashes.

Expected Results:
The game must not crash when the disc is ejected.

Note(1): TM Log Files attached (unable to retrieve a PS3 Core Dump; no Core Dump available after this crash occurs).
Note(2): This issue may be related to issues #3756, 4131, 4218, 4627, 6072.
Note(3): If the Host is on the Loading into gameplay screen when the game disc is ejected, the Clients are returned to the Player Match Menu, but if the Host ejects the game disc while still in the Game Lobby Countdown the Clients are returned to the Filters Menu.
Note(4): After the PS3 crashes, it takes a User approximately 10-12 seconds of holding the power button to power down the console.

column7: Text - Career Mode - Results: The credits text appears the same after completing a tournament a 2nd time.
column8:
Summary:
During Career gameplay, when the user completes a tournament that has previously been completed, the results screen appears with the same credit text as the first time it was completed, i.e. 800 Credits for completing National Shootout Challenge.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu select Career Mode
2) Select Play Tournament
3) Select any tournament
4) Complete the tournament in 1st place
5) Complete the same tournament a second time in 1st place
6) The results screen appears with the same amount of credits awarded to the user the second time completing the tournament as the first time completing the tournament

Expected Results:
The results screen must appear properly at all times.

Note(1): Although the results screen shows that the user is being credited again for completing a tournament a second time, the credits are not added to the total credits appearing in the Gear Store or Team Manager menus.

column7: Menu/GUI - Exhibition: Left and Right navigation is unresponsive.
column8:
Summary:
In the Exhibition menu, if the user presses the 2 (Woodsball) Button, selects the Train Depot Field, presses Left or Right on the + Control Pad 1 or more times, presses the B (Back) Button, and attempts to navigate Left or Right through the Woodsball fields, the menu remains unresponsive.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu navigate to the exhibition menu,
2) Press the 2 (Woodsball) Button and navigate to the field selection menu for woodsball tournaments,
3) Highlight Train Depot Field,
4) Press the A Button to go to the Match Summary,
5) Press and hold Right on the Control Stick,
6) Press the B (Back) Button to go back to the field selection menu,
7) Observe that the menu has lost right and left functionality with the Control Stick and the + Control Pad.

Expected Results:
Menus must function properly.

column7: Collision Detection - Woodsball - Gold Mine Field: The user's character becomes stuck on top of the table in the small shed
column8:
Summary:
During Exhibition, in Woodsball - Gold Mine Field, if the user's character enters the small shed to the right of the user's flag station, sprints and dives towards the table in the corner, the user's character is able to dive on top of the table and becomes stuck when standing or crouching

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User selects Exhibition on the Main Menu
2) Selects a Woodsball match
3) Selects Gold Mine Field
4) Proceeds into gameplay
5) Moves into the small shed to the right of the spawn point
6) Sprints and dives towards the table
7) The user's character is able to get on top of the table while diving, and becomes stuck if the user's character stands or crouches while on the table

Expected Results:
The user's character must not be able to dive onto the table

Note: The same shed appears in Woodsball - Jungle Park
Note: User's character is able to get off the table while in the prone stance

column7: Menu/GUI - Gear Store: When the User selects to buy something the prompt asking to buy the item is defaulted to Yes.
column8:
Summary:
After selecting to buy an item in the Gear Store, the User is prompted with the message, "Do you want to buy this item?", the default selection is Yes.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter the Gear Store,
2) Select to buy any item, 
3) Observe the prompt asking the User, "Do you want to buy this item?", the default selection is Yes.

Expected Results:
The default selection in the prompt must be No.

column7: Gameplay - Dynasty Training Drills - Leaning and Snapping Stage 2: The user's character fails an objective before time runs out when remaining in the snapping position
column8:
Summary:
During Dynasty Training Drills, in Leaning and Snapping Stage 2, if the user's character eliminates the opponents in the snapping position, remains in the snapping position as time runs out, the user's character fails the objective before time runs out

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User selects Dynasty Training Drills on the Main Menu
2) Progresses through the drills until the Leaning and Snapping drill is unlocked
3) Progresses through Stage 1 of Leaning and Snapping
4) Proceeds into Stage 2
5) The user's character eliminates the indicated opponent while in the snapping position as quickly as possible
6) Remains in the snapping position instead of returning to the normal position as the remaining time runs down
7) The user's character fails the objective before time has run out

Expected Results:
The user's character must not fail an objective until time is up

column7: Occasionally - Collision Detection - Train Depot Field: User is able to Dive into the wood stacks and become stuck inside
column8:
Summary:
Occasionally, during Gameplay, at Train Depot Field, the user Dove into the wood stacks and became stuck inside.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Entered Train Depot Field,
2) Navigated to a stack of wood,
6) Ran towards the center of the wood pile,
7) Dove just before reaching the wood stack,
8) Observed that by diving into the wood stack the user's character had becoming stuck inside.

Expected Results:
All objects must have proper collision.

column7: Occasionally - Technical Check - Multiplayer : When the user selects a match from the games list, the user is brought back to the games list instead of joining the game lobby.
column8:
Summary:
When the user joins a default multiplayer match by selecting the match from the games list, after the loading screen into the lobby has finished, the games list appears on the screen for the user instead of the game lobby.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User1 creates a default multiplayer match
2) User2 selects join game, default filters
3) User2 selects User1's match from the games list
4) The loading screen appears and finishes
5) Occasionally, after loading the user has the games list displayed on screen

Expected Results:
The user must load directly into the game lobby of a selected multiplayer match.

NOTE(1): If the user presses the circle button when the games list appears after loading, the user will receive an error message upon trying to join the match again and must back out to the main menu in order to join a new match.
NOTE(2): TTY attached.
NOTE(3): Has taken at least 30 ticks for this to occur.
NOTE(4): This issue seems to occur more frequently from a fresh boot on both user's consoles.
column9:
[John Hart (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/26/2008 09:38:31 PM]
TTY report added to the issue on 10/26/08 from the 10/23 build

[vDev13 Fun Labs (AMP Dev) -- 10/28/2008 01:12:38 PM]
could not reproduce it

[Dean Fingerholz (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/28/2008 01:58:12 PM]
Reproduced on 10.26.08 build. 2 new TTYs have been attached.

[John Hart (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/29/2008 04:19:02 AM]
Verified in the 10/28 build

column7: Audio/Sound - Gameplay: There is no buzzer sound when a character picks up a flag or returns it to the base.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, there is no buzzer sound when a character picks up the opponent's flag or when he returns it to the flag base.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, enter into any mode of gameplay with Capture the Flag.
2) When gameplay begins, retrieve the enemy's flag.
3) Return the flag to the flag station.
4) Observe that there is no buzzer when the user's character picks up the flag or returns it to the base.

Expected Results:
There must be a buzzer sound when a character (user's character or AI) picks up a flag and when it is returned to the base.

column7: Once - Crash - Speedball - Las Vegas, Nevada: The game crashed while spamming C and Z buttons on the load screen.
column8:
Summary:
Once, during gameplay, when the User was loading into Career Mode, Las Vegas, Nevada the User spammed the C and Z buttons on the loading screen and the User observed the game crash leaving a white dot on the left side of the screen and replaying the same 4 seconds of audio.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, selected Career Mode,
2) With Las Vegas, Nevada Unlocked, loaded into Las Vegas, Nevada,
3) On the load screen the User spammed the C and Z buttons,
4) The User observed the game crash on the loading screen leaving a white dot on the left side of the screen and replaying the same 4 seconds of audio. 

Expected Results:
The game must NOT crash.

column7: Occasionally (1%-9%) - Gameplay - Multiplayer: In System Link matches on two Woodsball maps, the users' characters did not spawn into the level correctly
column8:
Summary:
Occasionally, during System Link matches in the Tippmann and Train Depot Field Woodsball levels, the users' characters spawned in the air above the maps and constantly fell towards the ground.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, the user selected Multiplayer,
2) The user selected any kind of Woodsball game with any amount of players,
3) He then selected System Link,
4) He chose either Train Depot Field or Tippmann Field,
5) Finally, he selected any game type with any amount of players,
6) During gameplay, he observed that all the characters fell constantly towards the ground, making gameplay nearly impossible.

Expected Results:
Characters must spawn into the level properly during System Link Woodsball matches.

NOTE(1): This issue occurred with one human user and a team of bots, and also with three human users and no bots.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gear Store: The Empire Events mask appears with graphical corruption.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, Gear Store, the Empire Events mask appears with graphical corruption in the form of moving black lines below the visor.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select Career Mode.
2) Select Gear Store.
3) Move the cursor over to the Masks section (the user must complete the second tournament to unlock this mask).
4) Select the Empire Events mask.
4) Observe the moving black lines on the mask.

Expected Results:
All graphics must appear without corruption.

NOTE1: Video available.
NOTE2: Graphical corruption also occurs when displayed in Team Outfit.

column7: Gameplay - Breakout Planner: User plan resets between the first and second round of any Quickplay, or Exhibition match.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, Breakout Planner, in any quickplay or exhibition match, when the User completes the first round, and loads into the Breakout Planner for the second round, the planner resets the player positions back to the default settings.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu select Quickplay, or Exhibition,
2) Select any match with more then 1 player on each side, and more then one round,
3) Load the Breakout Planner and set custom positions for the User's Team, 
4) Begin gameplay, and complete the first round, 
5) Load into the Breakout Planner,
6) Observe the Breakout Planner no longer has the custom settings from step 3,

Expected Results:
Breakout Planner settings must carry over from round to round.

column7: Video/Graphic - Multiplayer: All barrels starting from the FL Firebird barrel appears as the previous barrel listed in system link gameplay.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in a System Link match, all barrels starting from the FL Firebird barrel appears as the previous barrel listed.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select Multiplayer.
2) Select System Link.
3) Host selects Create Match.
4) Host selects a Speedball or Woodsball match.
5) Host clicks the Left Stick in to edit the player gear.
6) Host sets any paintball marker, any hopper, any barrel starting from FL Firebird barrel, any air tank, any harness, any woodsball combo, any mask, any gloves, any pants, and any shoes.
7) Host continues to the Lobby and waits for clients.
8) Host begins game.
9) When gameplay begins, all users observe that the paintball marker barrel appears as the barrel listed before it,

Expected Results:
All paintball marker barrels must appear correctly.

NOTE: List of Barrels affected: 

FL Firebird shows as: JT Tetra
Insert Nightstick shows as:FL Firebird 
DLX Luxe shows as: Insert Nightstick
Spyder Pilot shows as: DLX Luxe
Smart Parts All American Barrel shows as: Spyder Pilot 
Bob Long Vice shows as: Smart Parts All American Barrel
Bob Long Rapper shows as: Bob Long Vice
Sly Diesel Black shows as: Bob Long Rapper
Sly Pro-Merc Black shows as: Sly Diesel Black

column7: Legal - Career Mode - All Millennium tournaments must implement the M7 rules (5 vs 5 Elimination).
column8:
Summary:
During Career Mode, all Millennium tournaments must implement the M7 rules (5 vs 5 Elimination). 

Steps to Reproduce:
1)Start Malaga Spain - Millennium Iberian Cup
2)Notice that the game is not a 5 on 5 Elimination type match and does not implement the M7 format

Expected Results:
All Millennium tournaments must implement the M7 format rules. 

NOTE: For each Millennium tournament, we should make it so that the user has a roster of 5 with no team switching out.

List of Millennium tournaments:
12a - Malaga, Spain - Millennium Iberian Cup
16a - London, England - Millennium SPL Campaign Cup
19a - Toulouse, France - Millennium SPL World Cup
22a - Nurburgring, Germany - Millennium MAXS CPL European Masters
25a - Paris, France - Millennium CPL French Open

column7: Crash - Multiplayer: In a System Link match the game crashes with one Woodsball marker and one Speedball marker equipped.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, Multiplayer, in a System Link match, with the Spyder MR2 Speedball marker equipped on any two players and the Tippman X7 MP5 SD equipped on two other players, the Host crashes on the loading screen.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select Multiplayer,
2) Select System Link,
3) Make the Spyder MR2 Speedball marker available,
4) Make the Tippman X7 MP5 SD Woodsball marker available,
5) Two Players from either team select the Spyder MR2 Speedball marker,
6) Two Players from either team select the Tippman X7 MP5 SD Woodsball marker,
7) Observe the host crash while loading in to gameplay.

Expected Results:
The game must not crash.

NOTE(1): Crash dump available.

column7: Legal - Career Mode: The User appears to be able to turn on ramping for Career Mode.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, Career Mode, if the User selects Career Mode, then selects any tournament, then during the round of gameplay accesses the options menu and goes to the gameplay options, the option to turn on ramping appears to be available.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select Career Mode,
2) Select Tournament Play,
3) Select any tournament,
4) Proceed through the screens that appear until the match starts,
5) Press the START Button,
6) Select Options,
7) Select Gameplay,
8) Observe that an option to turn on or turn off ramping appears.

Expected Results:
Ramping must not be available during tournament play.

NOTE(1): Both NPPL & ME rulebooks strictly prohibit the use of ramping in tournament speedball gameplay. It may; however, be left in woodsball.

column7: Technical Check - Gameplay: Xbwatson reports errors when in Gameplay
column8:
Summary:
Xbwatson reports XNET errors when in Gameplay

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, while monitoring the Xbox 360 console and the Player using Controller 1.
2) The following text appears in the XbWatson output:

"[XNET:1] Warning: recv failed: 10054"

Expected Results:
There must not be unexpected errors reported to XbWatson

Notes:
1) This also occurs in career mode. 
2) Other output has also been seen.

column7: Text - Menu System: The Post-earned text for the Achievement "Speedball Chief" is incorrectly displayed
column8:
Summary:
The Post-earned text for the Achievement "Speedball Chief" is incorrectly displayed.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, with a Gamer Profile signed in that has earned the "Speedball Chief" Achievement.
2) The Player presses the Xbox Guide button.
3) The Xbox Guide Blade appears.
4) The Player selects the Gamer Profile.
5) The Player selects View Games.
6) The Player selects Paintball 2009.
7) The Player selects the Achievement Speedball Chief, and the following Post-earned text appears: 

"Won at least 50 Speedball Ranked matches over Xbox LIVE"

Change to:

"Won at least 50 Speedball Ranked Matches over Xbox LIVE"

By changing the text "matches" to the text "Matches".

column7: Text - Menu System: The Pre-earned text for the Achievement "Woodsball Chief" is incorrectly displayed
column8:
Summary:
The Pre-earned text for the Achievement Woodsball Chief is incorrectly displayed.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, with a Gamer Profile signed in that has not earned the "Woodsball Chief" Achievement.
2) The Player presses the Xbox Guide button.
3) The Xbox Guide Blade appears.
4) The Player selects the Gamer Profile.
5) The Player selects View Games.
6) The Player selects Paintball 2009.
7) The Player selects the Achievement Woodsball Chief, and the following Pre-earned text appears: 

Win at least 50 Woodsball matches over Xbox LIVE

Change to:

Win at least 50 Woodsball Ranked Matches over Xbox LIVE

By changing the text "matches" to the text "Ranked Matches".

column7: TCR 029 - Field Creator: An unnecessary message appears after storing a Field Creator map.
column8:
Summary:
An unnecessary message appears after storing a Field Creator map.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Field Creator.
2) The Player presses the START (Pause) button.
3) The Pause Menu appears.
4) The Player selects Store Custom Field.
5) The Store Custom Field list appears.
6) The Player selects any slot.
7) The Map Name Menu appears.
8) The Player selects Done, and the following text appears:

"Custom field saved succesfully."

Change to:

"Custom field stored successfully."

by changing the text "saved succesfully." to the text "stored successfully."

When an error prevents a game from performing a task dictated by the player or expected under normal gameplay, the game must display a user-friendly message that addresses the error. The game must transparently handle software errors that are not relevant to gameplay. This is a violation of TCR 029.

column7: TCR 022 - Team Outfit: The Xbox Guide Blade cannot be accessed after selecting Team Outfit for ~3 seconds to ~5 seconds
column8:
Summary:
The Xbox Guide Blade cannot be accessed after selecting Team Outfit for ~3 seconds to ~5 seconds 

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Career Menu.
2) The Player selects Team Outfit.
3) The Player quickly presses the Xbox Guide button, and the Xbox Guide Blade does not appear for ~3 seconds to ~5 seconds.

Expected Results:
Games must ensure that system UI can be rendered at least every 66 milliseconds in all areas of the game for any display mode. This is a violation of TCR 022. 

Notes:
1) The time it takes until the Xbox Guide Blade appears seems to take longer when more items are unlocked.

column7: TCR 071 - Ranked Match: There is no way to access the Gamer Card of the listed Players on the in-game Stats Screen
column8:
Summary:
There is no way to access the Gamer Card of the listed Players on the in-game Stats Screen

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, Ranked Match.
2) The Player presses the BACK button.
3) The in-game Stats Screen appears, and there is no way to highlight or select any highlighted Gamertag.

Expected Results:
The Player must be able to highlight any in-game Gamertag, and view the Gamer Card of the selected Gamertag.

Games must provide the player the option to access another players gamer card wherever gamertags are enumerated. This is a violation of TCR 071.

column7: Gameplay - Gameplay: If the User's Character is sliding and gets hit to bring up the Cheat Meter, the User's Character continues to slide an extended distance.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, if the User's Character begins a slide and is hit by a paintball, the Cheat Meter is displayed, while the Cheat Meter is displayed the User's Character continues to slide for an extended distance.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Select any gameplay,
2) Proceed from the home base toward the opponents base,
3) While sprinting, press X to slide,
4) Allow the User's Character to get hit while sliding so the Cheat Meter is displayed,
5) Observe the User's Character continues to slide while the Cheat Meter is displayed.

Expected Results:
User's Character must slide the proper distance at all times.

column7: TCR 081 - Player Match: Clients are returned to the old Player Match menu when the game ends normally
column8:
Summary:
Clients are returned to the old Player Match menu when the game ends normally

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, Player Match, with the Player as a Client.
2) The match ends.
3) The End of Match Results Screen appears.
4) The Player presses the A (Continue) button.
5) A loading screen appears, and the old Player Match appears that has options "Join Game" and "Create Game".

Expected Results:
After a game ends, the clients must be returned to the correct Player Match Menu, with the options "Quick Match", "Custom Match" and "Create Game".

Games must have a Quick Match and a Custom Match option for both Standard and Ranked game session options. The Quick Match option must allow the player to enter the game session using a sequence of default button presses. This is a violation of TCR 081.

column7: Frequently (90% - 99%) - Menu/GUI - Multiplayer: In the Your Gear Menu in Xbox LIVE and System Link matches, the menu is extremely laggy and skips over items
column8:
Summary:
Frequently, in the Your Gear Menu in Xbox LIVE Player Match and System Link games, the menu is extremely laggy and skips over items when users scroll through the available gear options. Only menus with two available items do not have any skipping.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select Multiplayer,
2) Select either System Link or an Xbox LIVE Player Match and host a game,
3) Choose any location, game type, round limit, and available gear options,
4) In the Lobby, press the [Left Stick] to access the Your Gear Menu,
5) Scroll through all the available gear options by pressing up, down, left, and right on the [Directional Pad],
6) Observe that it takes a long time for gear to appear on the user's character; additionally, gear is often skipped over as the user scrolls through the menu.

Expected Results:
The Your Gear Menu in the pre-game Lobby must function correctly.

NOTE(1): Screenshot attached.

column7: Occasionally - Gameplay - Multiplayer: All User's experienced an infinite load screen after the Host spammed X from the Lobby until a minute after viewing the load screen.
column8:
Summary:
Occasionally, Host started a match, began spamming X to start the match and continued to spam X while the loading screen appeared, game was caught in an infinite load screen.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Selected Multiplayer,
2) Selected Local Network,
3) Selected to Create a match,
4) As another Client joined the match and pressed X to enter gameplay,
5) The Host began spamming X, and continued to do so until the Loading screen,
6) Observed the game was stuck on an infinite load screen.

Expected Results:
Game must load properly into multiplayer matches.
column9:
[John Hart (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/29/2008 04:19:02 AM]
Verified in the 10/28 build

column7: TCR 081 - Player Match: During Player Match Gameplay, the match still appears joinable on the Player Match Games List.
column8:
Summary:
During Player Match Gameplay, the match still appears joinable on the Player Match Games List.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Player Match Menu, with a Player Match game currently in gameplay.
2) The Player selects Custom Match.
3) The Custom Match Menu appears.
4) The Player changes the filters to a Player Match that is in gameplay.
5) The Player presses the A (Search) button.
6) The Games List appears, and the Player Match that is currently in gameplay appears on the Player Match Games List.

Expected Results:
A Custom Match game search must only return available Player Match games that are joinable.

Games must have a Quick Match and a Custom Match option for both Standard and Ranked game session options. The Quick Match option must allow the player to enter the game session using a sequence of default button presses. This is a violation of TCR 081.

Notes:
1) The Player's game also appears Joinable to Friends or Players that attempt to Join Session in Progress. The Join does not succeed (the game is not joinable once gameplay begins)
2) This is related to TCR 115. 
3) This is related to issue 6141.

column7: TCR 103 - System Link Games List: Only one System Link game is listed at a time
column8:
Summary:
Only one System Link game is listed at a time

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the System Link Menu, with at least two joinable System Link present.
2) The Player selects Join Game.
3) The Games List appears, and only one System Link game appears on the Games List.

Expected Results:
The game must list all joinable System Link games at the time of the search.

The game must discover sessions for system link play in no more than three seconds. This is a violation of TCR 103.

column7: TCR 014 - System Link Games List: The game name always appears as "SV_PAINTBALL"
column8:
Summary:
The game name always appears as "SV_PAINTBALL"

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the System Link Menu, with a joinable System Link present.
2) The Player selects Join Game.
3) The Games List appears, and the following text appears as the game name:

"SV_Paintball"

Expected Results:
The System Link game name must not contain debug text, and must appear as the Game Type; "Capture The Flag", "Center Flag", or "Elimination". 

Games must not output debug information via the network, on-screen messages, or a file on any storage device. This is a violation of TCR 014.

column7: Frequently - Video/Graphic - Gameplay: When the User's Character Slides or Jumps while running the arm holding the marker keeps moving as if the User's Character is running
column8:
Summary:
Frequently, during gameplay, if the User's Character Slides or Jumps while running the arm holding the marker keeps moving as if the User's Character is running, distorting the view of the User.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the initial start of any level,
2) During gameplay Press and hold the Left Bumper while tilting the Left Analogue Stick forward, 
3) Proceed to run towards a bunker until a the "Press A Button to slide or jump" prompt appears,
4) Press the A Button to slide or jump.
5) Observe the arm holding the marker is still moving as though the User's character is running.

Expected Results:
The Running animation must not appear while the User's Character is sliding or jumping.

NOTE(1): The animation distorts the Users aim wile in the air or sliding on the ground.

column7: Gameplay - Gameplay: When sprinting and jumping over a beam bunker, if the user relases the Left Bumper, the user continues to sprint
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in any Speedball match, if the user sprints towards a beam bunker, jumps over it, then releases the Left Bumper just as the user's character lands, the user's character continues to perform the sprint action.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select any mode of play.
2) Select any Speedball match in any location that has jumpable beam bunkers (e.g. the NPPL Buffalo Tournament in Career Mode).
3) When gameplay begins, eliminate all AI opponents and grab the flag before friendly AI characters do.
4) Find any beam bunker the user is able to jump over, and back away from it so that it will only take the user ~5 seconds to sprint towards the bunker and jump it.
5) Simultaneously press the Left Bumper and Left Stick forward to sprint towards the beam bunker, and immediately begin counting.
6) When the user's character is close enough to jump over the bunker, press the A button to jump.
7) Just as the user's character lands (~5 seconds after beginning the sprint), release ONLY the Left Bumper so that the user is only pressing the Left Stick forward, and observe that the user character continues to sprint.

Expected Results:
When the user releases the Left Bumper, the user's character must stop sprinting.

NOTE(1): Bug appears to be timing specific. When the user simultaneously presses the Left Bumper and Left Stick forward, the user should immediately begin counting seconds. It should only take ~5 seconds from the time the user starts running until the time the user's character lands.

NOTE(2): When the bug occurs, the user's character continues to sprint (the marker continues to pump up and down) until the user turns using the Right Stick at a sharp angle. The user is also able to shoot their marker while it is pumping up and down.

column7: Frequently - TRC [R021] - Multiplayer: The user experiences a Loading screen longer than 2 minutes when signing out and signing back in within the first 11 SECONDS of the Loading Screen from the Game Lobby into Gameplay
column8:
Summary:
The user experiences a Loading screen longer than 2 minutes when signing out and signing back in within the first 11 SECONDS of the Loading Screen from the Game Lobby into Gameplay.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates a default Player Match.
2) User 2 joins User 1's match.
3) User 1 begins the lobby countdown.
4) User 1 presses the PS Menu button, and prepares to sign-out by highlighting their Online ID.
5) User 1 signs-out as quickly as possible when the loading screen appears.
6) User 1 immediately signs-in to their Online ID after signing out. (Timing specific, needs to be done as quickly as possible)
7) Users observe a loading screen of 2 minutes or longer.

Expected Results:
Users must not experience a Loading Screen lasting longer than 30 seconds.

NOTE(1): Host and Client's connection times out and they are returned to the menu system.
NOTE(2): Also occurs during Ranked Match.
NOTE(3): Host recieves an incorrect "Connection with the host has been lost" message.

TRC [R021] - The title does not leave the User in an unplayable state for long periods of time.
column9:
