column7: Collision Detection - Woodsball - Train Depot Field: User's character is able to clip into and get stuck in side of the train cars.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in Woodsball- Train Depot Field, if the user's character moves to a train car, moves to the end without the hitch, when facing the end of the train car move just to the left of the right wheel, move into the prone position, on the way into the prone position press forward, move into the crouch position when one the ground, Observe that the user's character is clipping the train and is now stuck in the train. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter gameplay in Woodsball- Train Depot Field,
2) Moves to a train car
3) Move to the end without the hitch
4) Face the end of the train car,
5) Move just to the left of the right wheel, while pressing against the end of the train,
6) Move into the prone position,
7) On the way into the prone position move forward by pressing up on the left analog stick,
8) Move into the crouch position as quick as possible,
9) Observe that the user's character is clipping the train and is now stuck in the train.

Expected Results:
User's character must not become stuck.

Note(1)
Video Capture is available.

column7: Technical Check - Options: Options are not set to default settings when starting a new game
column8:
Summary:
In the Options menu, if the user changes the settings in the Options menu, exits to the New Game/Load Game screen from the Main Menu, selects New Game, proceeds to the Main Menu, selects Options, the settings are not set to the default setting and are instead the same settings as the previous save profile

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User selects Options on the Main Menu
2) Changes any of the settings in the Options Menu
3) Backs out to the Main Menu
4) Backs out from the Main Menu to the New Game/Load Game screen
5) Selects New Game
6) Proceeds to the Main Menu
7) Selects Options
8) Notice that the settings are from the previously exited save profile and are not set to the default settings

Expected Results:
All settings in the Options menu must be set to default settings when creating a New Game

column7: Scoring - Gameplay: The user is given an elimination point for eliminating the flag carrier as the flag is being hung.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, in a Center Flag or Capture the Flag match, if the user shoots the enemy teams flag carrier as the flag is being hung, the user will get the point for eliminating the flag carrier, and the enemy team will get the point for scoring the flag.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter gameplay in a center flag or capture the flag match,
2) Move to the right or left of the flag station 10 feet,
3) Press the up directional button to cause your team to charge and become eliminated,
4) Wait for the enemy teams flag carrier to get with in arms reach of the flag station,
5) Shoot the enemy team's flag carrier,
6) Observe that the paintballs do not reach the enemy team's flag carrier until after the flag has been hung.

Expected Results:
The user must not be given a point for eliminating the flag carrier as the flag is being hung on the flag station.

column7: Technical Check - Multiplayer: If all of the Clients on the enemy team, exit the game during gameplay, the Host remains in gameplay.
column8:
Summary:
During multiplayer gameplay, if all of the Clients on the enemy team, exit the game , the Host remains in gameplay.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates a default Player Match game lobby
2) User 2 joins User 1's game lobby
3) User 1 presses the Left Trigger button to add one bot to their team
4) Users progress to gameplay
5) Gameplay begins, User 2 presses the START button to access the pause menu
6) User 2 selects Quit Match and exits the game
7) User 1 observes they are still in gameplay with no opponents on the enemy team.

Expected Results:
User 1 must not stay in a game with no opponents on the enemy team.

Note: This issue also occurs in System Link.
Note: If this occurs during an elimination match, the Users must either exit via the pause menu or wait for the time limit expires.

column7: Text - Credits: In the credits, there is white text that appears as "Additional Music provided by" and the line below it is in yellow text that reads: "DeWolfe Music Library" which appears inconsistent with the rest of the credits.
column8:
Summary:
In the credits, there is white text that appears as "Additional Music provided by" and the line below it is in yellow text that reads: "DeWolfe Music Library" which appears inconsistent with the rest of the credits. This is located close to the very end of the credits.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Select Credits from the main menu
2) Watch the right side of the screen as the screen scrolls through the credits
3a) Observe, the white text appears as:
"Additional Music provided by"

Change to:
"Additional Music provided by" in yellow text 

By changing the text to the color yellow to remain consistent with the rest of the credits

3b) Observe, the yellow text appears as:
"DeWolfe Music Library"

Change to:
"DeWolfe Music Library" in white text

By changing the text to the color white to remain consistent with the rest of the credits

column7: Gameplay - Speedball - Bakersfield, California: The Jump locations for the "snake" bunkers are misaligned with the bunkers.
column8:
Summary:
During Multiplayer gameplay, Speedball, Bakersfield, California, the Jump locations for the "snake" bunkers are misaligned with the bunkers.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select Multiplayer,
2) Select Xbox Live,
3) Enter Speedball gameplay at Bakersfield, California,
4) Navigate the User's Avatar to just in front of any of the "snake" bunkers (especially the two near the center of the field),
5) Observe that the Jump distance is extremely far away from the actual bunker.

Expected Results:
Gameplay functions, such as Jump, must be consistent throughout gameplay.

column7: Occasionally - Crash - Loading Screens: Game crashes when loading into gameplay after hours of continuous play.
column8:
Summary:
Occasionally, the game will crash on the loading screen when entering gameplay after a few hours of continuous play.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Play various modes of gameplay for 2+ hours,
2) Loading into gameplay in any gameplay type,
3) Observe that the game crashes occasionally when loading into gameplay.

Expected Results:
Game must not crash.

Note (1) This has occurred when loading into the following locations:
- Once, after completing Fitness Stage 2, loading into Fitness Stage 3.
- Once, loading into Exhibition - Woodsball - San Diego Field.
- Once, loading into the 6th match of Career Mode - NPPL Houston (Pro).
- Once, loading into the first match of Career Mode - Tempe Invitational (Division 2).
- Twice, loading into Quick Play, San Diego, California.

column7: Technical Check - Multiplayer - Game Lobby: Clients are brought back to the Main Menu if the Host disconnects the Ethernet cord from the console.
column8:
Summary:
On the Multiplayer game lobby screen, if the Host disconnects the Ethernet cord from the console, the Clients are brought back to the Main Menu.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu signed into Xbox Live
2) The Host selects Multiplayer
3) The Host selects Xbox Live
4) The Host selects Player Match or Ranked Match
5) The Host selects Create Game and selects any game settings
6) The Host proceeds to the Game Lobby
7) The Client joins the Host's created game and enters the Game Lobby
8) The Host disconnects the Ethernet cord from the console 
9) The Client receives the message, "Disconnected from the Host."
10) The Client selects OK and observes they are brought back to the Main Menu.

Expected Results:
Clients must be returned to the Xbox Live screen if the Host disconnects on the Game Lobby.

Note: This also occurs if the Host manually quits out of the game lobby.

column7: Frequently - Video/Graphic - Multiplayer: Users load in floating above the ground with the camera bouncing uncontrollably.
column8:
Summary:
Frequently, Users load into gameplay floating above the ground with the camera bouncing uncontrollably. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 hosts a Ranked or PLayer Match in any game mode (Elimination,CTF,CF)
2) User 2 joins User 1's game
3) Users load into gameplay and observe they are floating in the air and the camera is bouncing up/down.

Expected Results:
Users must load into gameplay correctly.

NOTE(1): This bug is most prominent in Woodsball ranked matches.

column7: Technical Check - When a Host or Client disconnects out of a multiplayer game, they are not brought back to the Main Menu.
column8:
Summary:
When a Host or Client disconnects out of a multiplayer game, they are not brought back to the Main Menu.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 Creates a Rank Match or Player Match
2) User 2 joins User 1's game
3) User 2 sets Ready, User 1 Starts the Game
4) Gameplay Begins
5) If either user disconnects the ethernet cable from the console
6) The message "You have been disconnect from Xbox Live and will be returned to the Main Menu."
9) When User selects OK, the User is returned to the System Link Menu.

Expected Results:
When user selects OK on the "You have been disconnected from Xbox Live and will be returned to the Main Menu." message, the user must be returned to the Main Menu.

column7: Video/Graphic - Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania: The User observes floating benches, located behind the Red-team base.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, if the User navigates to the Red-team base, the User observes that there are 2 benches behind the base which appear floating a few feet off the ground.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User enters gameplay in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
2) From their starting position, the User navigates their character to the Red-team base.
3) User observes that there are two benches floating off the ground, located behind the Red base.

Expected Results:
The benches must not appear floating.

NOTE: This occurs in both Single Player and MultiPlayer.

column7: Gameplay - Multiplayer: Friendly fire is not turned on in Ranked matches.
column8:
Summary: Friendly fire is not turned on in Ranked matches. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates a Ranked, Eliminator match.
2) Users 2-4 join User 1's match.
3) Users begin gameplay.
4) User 1 attempts to shoot their teammate.
5) User 1 observes their teammate does not get eliminated.

Expected Results: Friendly fire must be turned on during Ranked matches.

column7: Menu/GUI - Multiplayer: Users are returned to a different Player Match menu after quitting out of a Player Match.
column8:
Summary: Users are returned to a different Player Match menu after quitting out of a Player Match. The default Player match menu lists three options: Quick Match, Custom Match, and Create Game. After quitting out of a player match, the user is returned to a menu that displays only two options: Create Game and Join Game.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates a default Player Match.
2) User 2 joins User 1's match.
3) Users begin gameplay.
4) User 1 manually quits out of the match, User 2 gets disconnected.
5) Users observe they are returned to a different Player Match menu, with only 2 options: Create Game and Join Game.

Expected Results: Menus must be consistent after quiting out of a match.

column7: Video/Graphic - Multiplayer: The camera shakes when the User's character enters the prone position.
column8:
Summary:
Frequently, during gameplay, if the User's character enters the prone position, the User observes the camera shakes.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User enters gameplay in any level.
2) During gameplay, User presses and holds the "B" button to make their character enter the prone position.
3) The User observes the camera shakes.

Expected Results:
The screen must not shake when the User is in the prone position.

NOTE: If the User attempts to crawl, the camera shakes even more violently.

column7: Technical Check - Multiplayer Ranked CF: The level Charlotte, North Carolina does not appear in the map rotations
column8:
Summary:
In Multiplayer Ranked Center Flag matches, the level Charlotte, North Carolina does not appear in the map rotations, preventing the Player from playing in the leve.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Multiplayer Menu,
2) The Player selects Ranked Match.
3) The Player selects Center Flag.
4) 3 clients join.
5) The Player starts the match.
6) The level Charlotte, North Carolina is never playable.

Expected Results:
Charlotte, North Carolina must be playable in Ranked Matches.

column7: Technical Check - Multiplayer Ranked CTF: The level Houston, Texas does not appear in the map rotations
column8:
Summary:
In Multiplayer Ranked CTF matches, the level Houston, Texas does not appear in the map rotations, preventing the Player from playing in Houston, Texas

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Multiplayer Menu,
2) The Player selects Ranked Match.
3) The Player selects Capture the Flag.
4) 3 clients join.
5) The Player starts the match.
6) The level Houston, Texas is never playable.

Expected Results:
Houston, Texas must be playable in Ranked Matches.

column7: Technical Check: Multiplayer menu system, is user disconnects their controller, then disconnects the network cable from their system connector, they are not returned to the Main Menu.
column8:
Summary: While in the multiplayer menu system, is user disconnects their controller, then disconnects the network cable from their system connector, they are not returned to the Main Menu after reconnecting their controller and clearing the disconnected message.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User enters the Xbox LIVE multiplayer menu system.
2) User disconnects their controller.
3) User disconnects the network cable from their system connector.
4) User reconnects their controller.
5) User clears the disconnected message.
6) User observes they are not automatically brought back to the Main Menu.

Expected Results: When user disconnects the network cable from their system connector while their controller is disconnected, they must be returned to the Main Menu system.

Note(1): This bug also occurs in the following menu systems and their respective sub-systems:
Ranked Match
- Quick Match
- Custom Match
Player Match
- Quick Match
- Custom Match
- Filters Screen
- Create Game
Leaderboards
- Personal Career Eliminations
- Career Team Efficiency
- Career Finish Time
- Ranked Woodsball Eliminations
- Ranked Speedball Eliminations
- Ranked Eliminator
System Link
- Create Game
- Join Game

Note(2): This issue does not occur in the following locations:
In a ranked match lobby(host or client)
In a player match lobby(host or client)

Note(3): This causes many TCR issues, with messaging and expected menu functionality.

column7: Video/Graphic - Career Mode - Tournament 19b, Texas Invitational: Banners do not appear on the team home bases
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in Career Mode, in Tournament 19b, Texas Invitational, the NPPL Championship Paintball banners do not appear on the team home bases, as they do in every other tournament.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select Career Mode.
2) Select Play Tournament.
3) Select the Semi-Pro Texas Invitational tournament in Houston, Texas.
4) When gameplay begins, observe that the NPPL Championship Paintball banners do not appear on the team home bases.

Expected Results:
NPPL Championship Paintball banners must appear on the team home bases so that it is consistant throughout gameplay.

column7: Video/Graphic - Career Mode - Tournament 16b, SoCal Invitational: Banners do not appear on the team home bases
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in Career Mode, in Tournament 16b, SoCal Invitational, the NPPL Championship Paintball banners do not appear on the team home bases, as they do in every other tournament.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select Career Mode.
2) Select Play Tournament.
3) Select the Semi-Pro SoCal Invitational tournament in San Diego, California.
4) When gameplay begins, observe that the NPPL Championship Paintball banners do not appear on the team home bases.

Expected Results:
NPPL Championship Paintball banners must appear on the team home bases so that it is consistant throughout gameplay.

column7: Video/Graphic - Career Mode - Tournament 11, California Exhibition: Banners do not appear on the team home bases
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in Career Mode, in Tournament 11, California Exhibition, the NPPL Championship Paintball banners do not appear on the team home bases, as they do in every other tournament.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select Career Mode.
2) Select Play Tournament.
3) Select the Division 1 California Exhibition tournament in Hungington Beach, California.
4) When gameplay begins, observe that the NPPL Championship Paintball banners do not appear on the team home bases.

Expected Results:
NPPL Championship Paintball banners must appear on the team home bases so that it is consistant throughout gameplay.

column7: Gameplay - Career: The Player is not able to proceed past the first round after doing Dynasty Training Drills before Tournament mode.
column8:
Summary:
If the Player completes a level in Dynasty Training and then proceeds to the tournament mode, the Player is only allowed to complete the first match, after completing that match, the Player is taken back to the Dynasty Training Menu of the level the Player last played, not allowing the Player to proceed through Career Mode.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu,
2) The Player selects Dynasty Training Drills,
2) The Player completes Accuracy Training 1,
3) The Player exits to the Career Mode Menu,
4) The Player selects Play Tournament,
5) The Player proceeds to complete the first semifinal match of the East Coast Invitational,
6) The Player observes that after the load screen the User is in the Dynasty Training Accuracy Menu. (If the User enters the Tournament again they will have to replay the semifinal match again.)

Expected Results:
The Player must be able to continue through tournament mode after completing training levels.

column7: Occasional - Gameplay - Dynasty Training Drills - Fitness Stage 3: After completing the training objective the game did not continue to the next stage and the level was failed after the timer reached zero.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, Dynasty Training Drills Fitness Stage 3, when the Player completed the training objective and, on the last bunker, turns back around to face the field during the slide, the game did not continue to the next stage and the Player remained in the level. After the timer counted to zero, the Player failed the level.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select Career,
2) Select Dynasty Training Drills,
3) Select Fitness,
4) Select Stage 3,
5) Complete the objectives of shooting the orange cones in front of the indicated bunker and running and sliding to the next indicated bunker,
6) While sliding towards the final bunker, press and hold the Right Control Stick to the right to turn the Player Character back towards the field,
7) Observe that the game does not continue to the next level, the Player remains in the level and then fails the level after the timer reaches zero.

Expected Results:
When the level objective is completed successfully, the game must continue to the next level.

column7: TCR 006 - Menu System: While loading into any match in career mode, the loading screen becomes static for over 5 seconds before entering gameplay.
column8:
Summary:
Loading into gameplay is static for more than 5 seconds at the end of the loading screen

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Career Menu.
2) The Player selects Play Tournament.
3) The Tournament Selection Menu appears.
4) The Player selects any available Tournament.
5) The Player presses the A (Continue) button, and a loading screen appears that has a ~5 second to ~8 seconds static screen before the load finishes.

Expected Results:
The Loading Screen must have a static screen at the end of the loading sequence.

Games must not pause without game-representative on-screen graphics. When the pause time is greater than five seconds, the game must indicate the reason and provide on-screen animation. This is a violation of TCR 006.

Notes:
1) This is PreCert TCR 006 Issue 1 of 1.

Notes:
1) This occurs for all loading screens into Gameplay. 
2) Now, occasionally, a static shot of gamplay appears instead of the loading screen.

column7: Occasionally - Gameplay - Speedball - Las Vegas, Nevada: The User starts 10 seconds before the opposing team in Tournament Mode.
column8:
Summary:
Occasionally, during gameplay, Las Vegas, Nevada, if the User loads into tournament mode, the User is able to start 10 seconds before the opposing team and run down to shoot all opponents after the 3 second countdown. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select Career Mode,
2) Select XPSL Las Vegas, Nevada,
3) After the the initial count down, observe the Users Character is able to run down to the opposing team's side before the opposing team starts.

Expected Results:
Both teams must start at the same time.

NOTE(1): The User can start shooting the opposing team and win the match before the opposing team even starts the match because the User starts 10 seconds before the opposing team.

column7: Video/Graphic - Exhibition: When disconnecting the active controller, the reconnect controller message text appears cut off
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in Exhibition, if the user disconnects the active controller at the Match Settings Screen, the reconnect controller message text appears cut off.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select Exhibition.
2) When the Match Settings Screen appears, disconnect the active controller.
3) Observe that when the reconnect controller message appears, the text is cut off.

Expected Results:
All in-game text must appear in full and must not be cut off.

NOTE(1): Screenshot attached.

column7: Video/Graphic - Exhibition: At the Load Map Screen, the text boundary, Left Bumper icon, and Right Bumper icon overlap white lines
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in Exhibition, at the Load Map Screen, the text boundary area containing the Left Bumper Icon, Right Bumper icon, "Speedball" text, and "Woodsball" text overlap a series of white lines.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select Exhibition.
2) When the Load Map Screen appears, observe that the text boundary area containing the Left Bumper Icon, Right Bumper icon, "Speedball" text, and "Woodsball" text overlap a series of white lines.

Expected Results:
The text boundary area containing the Left Bumper Icon, Right Bumper Icon, "Speedball" text, and "Woodsball" text must be moved up so they do not overlap the series of white lines that appear on the bottom of the screen.

NOTE(1): Screenshot attached.

column7: Video/Graphic - Field Creator: At the Load Map Screen, the text boundary, Left Bumper icon, and Right Bumper icon overlap white lines
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in Field Creator, at the Load Map Screen, the text boundary area containing the Left Bumper Icon, Right Bumper icon, "Pre-Made" text, and "Custom" text overlap a series of white lines.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select Field Creator.
2) When the Load Map Screen appears, observe that the text boundary area containing the Left Bumper Icon, Right Bumper icon, "Pre-Made" text, and "Custom" text overlap a series of white lines.

Expected Results:
The text boundary area containing the Left Bumper Icon, Right Bumper Icon, "Pre-Made" text, and "Custom" text must be moved up so they do not overlap the series of white lines that appear on the bottom of the screen.

NOTE(1): Screenshot attached.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay - Multiplayer: When on the Yellow Team, the misfire when firing yellow paintballs appears blue
column8:
Summary:
In Multiplayer gameplay, the misfire while using the yellow paintballs appears blue.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, in Multiplayer
2) The Player on the yellow team fires single yellow paintballs.
3) The marker misfires and it appears as a blue paintball.

Expected Results:
Yellow paintball misfires must appear yellow.

column7: Audio/Sound - Gameplay: The audio for hanging the flag plays a second time.
column8:
Summary:
During CTF gameplay, in a round that does not end the match, when a team hangs the flag the audio plays a second time in the results screen. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter a CTF match that is more then 1 round
2) When either team hangs the flag, the audio from hanging the flag plays a second time in the results screen

Expected Results:
The flag hang audio must not play in the results screen.

column7: Audio/Sound - Gameplay: Corrupt audio plays when the Results Screen appears
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, at the end of a round in a match with more than one round, when the Results Screen appears, corrupt audio that sounds like a voice being re winded or fast-forwarded plays.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select Career Mode.
2) Select Play Tournament.
3) Select any Tournament.
4) When gameplay begins, play through the round, either winning or losing.
5) Observe that when the Results Screen appears, corrupt audio that sounds like a voice being re winded or fast forwarded plays.

Expected Results:
All audio must play correctly and not sound corrupt.

NOTE(1): Video with the corrupt audio attached.
NOTE(2): The audio issue also occurs when the flag is hanged at a teams home base.
NOTE(3): The audio issue also occurs when the flag is dropped after the carrier is eliminated.
NOTE(4): The audio issue also occurs when a dropped flag is picked up.
column9:
[Kyle Kleven (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/23/2008 09:18:07 AM]
Dupe.

[Justin Westplate (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/25/2008 10:29:42 AM]
Not a dupe, re-opened on 10/25/08.

column7: Technical Check - Multiplayer: The Player cannot bring Custom Maps into multiplayer
column8:
Summary:
The Player cannot bring Custom Maps into multiplayer

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Fromthe Multiplayer Menu, with a Xbox LIVE enabled Gamer Profile signed in, and a custom map created.
2) The Player selects Xbox LIVE.
3) The Xbox LIVE Menu appears.
4) The Player selects Player Match.
5) The Player Match Menu appears.
6) The Player selects Create Game.
7) The Player Match Map Select Menu appears, and there is no way to select a Custom Map.

Expected Results:
The Player must be able to create Player Matches and System Link games with a Custom Map.

column7: Occasionally - Gameplay - Exhibition, in custom maps, opponents get stuck due to collision detection between bunkers placed together in groups.
column8:
Summary:
Occasionally, in Custom Maps with bunkers placed together in groups, the opponent AI get stuck due to collision detection between bunkers, and cannot retrieve the flag to complete the map.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From main menu user selects Field Creator.
2) Selects any map.
3) Clears map of bunkers.
4) Places a group of bunkers ( short brick bunker works more frequently) in a group near the opponent's flag station.
5) Saved Field and exited Field creator.
6) Selected Exhibition.
7) Set up a 7 vs. 7, capture the flag speed-ball exhibition with the default teams.
8) Selected custom map previously created.
9) User character eliminates all opponents that appear to have a clear path to the flag. 
9) Occasionally, after the user's character team had been fully eliminated, the opponent(s) did not retrieve the flag and the match did not end
because they appeared to be stuck on collision detection between the placed bunkers. 

Expected Results:
Opponents must retrieve flag after the user's character's team has been fully eliminated

Note(1):
Images of custom map setup attached.

Note(2):
Video-documentation available.

column7: Twice - Gameplay - Quick Play - Orlando Florida: Enemy NPC could not reach the user team's flag, and was stuck on an invisible bunker.
column8:
Summary:
Twice, during gameplay in Quick Play - Orlando, Florida, the user's character moved to the enemy team's flag station, was eliminated, as the enemy NPC moved to the user team's flag station and the NPC became stuck on an invisible barrier and could not reach the flag.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Entered gameplay in Quick Play - Orlando, Florida,
2) Moved to the enemy team's flag station,
3) Was eliminated,
4) Observed that the enemy NPC moved to the user team's flag station and the NPC became stuck on an invisible barrier and could not reach the flag.

Expected Results:
Enemy NPC must be able to get and return the flag.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: A static screen with button prompts appears after the results screen in multi-round matches.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, in any multi-round match (i.e., best 2 of 3, etc.), if the user completes a round that is not the final round, the results screen appears, and the user then presses the X (Continue) button, a static screen that includes inactive button prompts appears.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Select Quick Play
2) Select any match that has multiple rounds
3) Complete a round
4) The Results screen appears
5) Press the X (Continue) button
5) Observe the static screen that appears for ~3 seconds.

Expected Results:
This static screen must not exist.

Note (1) The button prompts that display are dependent on the game mode. (I.e., if in Career Mode, in a tournament that includes a Team Manager, the L2 and D-Pad button graphics appear on the static screen.)

Note (2) This issue occurs in Career Mode, Quick Play, and Exhibition.

column7: Menu/GUI - Dynasty Training Drills (Pause Menu): The TRIANGLE button displays the Help screen
column8:
Summary:
In any Dynasty Training Drill, on the Pause Menu, the TRIANGLE button displays the Help screen after exiting Help.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Select Dynasty Training Drills from the Main Menu
2) Select any of the Drills
3) Enter into gameplay
4) Press the START button to bring up the Pause Menu
5) Select Help
6) Press the X (Continue) button
7) Press the TRIANGLE button
8) Observe that the Help screen is displayed.

Expected Results:
The TRIANGLE button must not display the Help screen.

column7: Frequently - Gameplay - Exhibition: On a specific custom map, the opponent AI do not return center flag.
column8:
Summary:
During Exhibition, on a specifically designed Custom Map (See attached layout), in Huntington Beach, CA, the opponent AI frequently do not return the flag from the far right corner.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu user selects Field creator.
2) Selects Huntington Beach, CA.
3) Removes all pre-existing bunkers.
4) Places 24 brick bunkers on the map using the horizontal-mirror tool (See attached image.).
5) Saves map and exit field creator.
6) Selects Exhibition.
7) Sets up a 7 vs. 7, capture the flag speedball-exhibition.
8) Selects Huntington beach.
9) Match initiates.
10) Both teams are fully eliminated with the exception of 2 opponent team-mates and the user's character.
11) Leads the remaining opponents into the far right corner.
12) User's character is eliminated.
13) Observe that both remaining opponent teammates are stuck along the right-side row of unkers.

Expected Results:
Opponent team-mates must not get stuck on bunker.

Note (1) Map image attached.

Note (2) Video-documentation available.

Note (3) Save Data is attached with the custom map created.

Note (4) Issue has lower frequency with only 1 opponent team-mate survival

Note (5) Twice, the opponent grabbed the center flag but stopped right before the flag station, and the match didn't end.

column7: Technical Check - Multiplayer Ranked: The level Miami does not appear in the map rotations
column8:
Summary:
In Multiplayer Ranked matches, the level Miami does not appear in the map rotations, preventing the Player from playing in Miami.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Multiplayer Menu,
2) The Player selects Ranked Match.
3) The Player selects any game type.
4) 3 clients join.
5) The Player starts the match.
6) The level Miami is never playable.

Expected Results:
Miami must be playable in Ranked Matches.

column7: Text - Tournament Selection Screen: Text appears outside of the text box.
column8:
Summary:
On the Tournament Selection Screen, when the Player selects Malaga, Spain "Millennium Iberian Cup", a text box appears with the text "These tournaments take place at the same time. Playing this tournament will lock the other one in the slate. Are you sure you want to continue?" The letter "P" in "Playing" appears outside of the text box.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select Play Tournament
2) On the Tournament Selection Screen, select Malaga, Spain "Millennium Iberian Cup",
3) A text box will appear displaying the text "These tournaments take place at the same time. Playing this tournament will lock the other one in the slate. Are you sure you want to continue?",
4) Observe that the letter "P" in "Playing" appears outside of the text box.

Expected Results:
All text must appear inside of the text box.

column7: Text - Menu System: The Post-Earned text for the "World Tour" Achievement contains a capitalization error
column8:
Summary:
The Post-Earned text for the "World Tour" Achievement contains a capitalization error

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, with a Gamer Profile signed in that has earned the "World Tour" Achievement.
2) The Player presses the Xbox Guide button.
3) The Xbox Guide Blade appears.
4) The Player selects the Gamer Profile.
5) The Player selects View Games.
6) The Player selects Paintball 2009.
7) The Player selects World Tour, and the following text appears:

"Played a game of paintball in all the career and woodsball locations"

Change to:

"Played a game of paintball in all the Career and Woodsball locations"

by changing the text "career and woodsball" to the text "Career and Woodsball".

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: If reloading while ramping, paintballs appear floating on screen
column8:
Summary:
After the user's character upgrades Reload, floating paintballs appear on screen when reloading while ramping.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main menu user selects Career Mode.
2) selects Team manager.
3) Fully upgrades main character's Reload stats.
4) enters any mode of gameplay.
5) User's character reloads hopper while ramping.
6) Observe that paintballs appear floating near the bottom of the screen.

Expected Results:
Paintballs must not appear floating on the screen.

column7: Gameplay - Breakout Planner: The user is unable to select all players on the team
column8:
Summary:
During Exhibition, on the Breakout Planner, if the user loads a custom field with tall cubes in two rows from the user's flag station to the opponent's flag station, with the bunkers in each row placed so that there is no space in between the bunkers, the user is unable to select all players

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User selects Field Creator on the Main Menu
2) Selects Malaga, Spain as the base map
3) Creates a field with tall cube bunkers placed in two rows from one flag station to the other, but with no space in between the bunkers for each row
4) Stores the custom field
5) Backs out to the Main Menu
6) Selects Exhibition
7) Selects a 7 vs. 7 match
8) Proceeds to the Breakout Planner
9) Notice that not all players have a breakout destination and the user is unable to select all players

Expected Results:
The user must be able to select all the players on the user's team and give breakout destinations

Note: Screenshot of layout attached
Note: Save available

column7: Frequently - Gameplay: Opponents come up to user's character and start shaking rather than shooting whent he character is holding the flag in a Center Flag match.
column8:
Summary:
Frequently, while playing Center Flag after the user has picked up the Center Flag if the user's character takes cover in a way that forces opponents to get very close (i.e., hiding behind a snake bunker that is separated by tombstone bunkers), the opposing characters will not shoot the user's character, but instead run up to the user's character and start moving erratically. This can also be caused by wiping all incoming hits while an opposing character is approaching the user's character.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the main menu enter Exhibition mode,
2) Create a 1vs1 Center Flag match in Nurburgring, Germany,
3) Pick up the flag,
4) Run to the far right side of the field and take cover in the corner between the two tombstone bunkers located within the snake bunker
5) Observe that frequently, the opponent will come up to the user's character and start shaking rather than shooting.

Expected Results:
Opponents must react realistically to the user's character at all times.

Note(1) Video Capture available.

Note(2) This bug can still occur if the opponent shoots a few times but the user manages to wipe while sitting in the corner.

Note(3) A second Video Capture available.
column9:
[Kyle Kleven (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/22/2008 11:48:12 PM]
Still occurs in 10/22/08 PS2 build.

column7: Occasionally - Gameplay - Exhibition - Custom map: The opposing AI does not grab the flag.
column8:
Summary:
Occasionally, during Exhibition gameplay, Custom map, after the user's character and teammates have all been eliminated, the opposing AI players do not move to the user's flag station to grab the flag.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu select Exhibition 
2) Change the settings to CTF, 7v7, 9 rounds, with defaults teams
3) Select a Custom field made from Houston Texas Pre-Made map (screenshot attached of layout)
4) Enter into gameplay
5) Allow the user's character and teammates to be eliminated 
6) Occasionally, the camera is fixed upon an unresponsive opposing player that does not move to get the flag

Expected Results:
The opposing players must grab the flag.

Note(1): Screenshot of bunker layout attached.

Note(2): Screenshot attached of additional custom map where bug occurred. 

Note(3): Once when enemy NPC was stuck the game crashed after 20 seconds after eliminating the last of the user's team.

Note(4): Occurs most often, when the opponent players are behind a bunker as the user's last player is eliminated

column7: TCR 070 - Multiplayer: The Rich Presence for the Match Lobby is incorrect
column8:
Summary:
The Rich Presence for the Match Lobby is incorrect

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Match Lobby, any Multiplayer mode, any level, with a Xbox LIVE enabled Gamer Profile signed in and a Friend monitoring the Player's Rich Presence.
2) The Player's Rich Presence appears as:

"Browsing the menu
Profile menus"

Expected Results:
The Rich Presence for the Match Lobby must appear as:

"<X> - <Y>
Match Lobby"

Notes:
1) <X> refers to the multiplayer mode, Ranked Match, Player Match, or System Link.
2) <Y> refers to the game type, CTF, CF, or Elim.

column7: Technical Check - Player Match: During Player Match Gameplay, the match still appears joinable
column8:
Summary:
During Player Match Gameplay, the match still appears joinable

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, Player Match, any level.
2) The Player presses the Xbox Guide button.
3) The Xbox Guide Blade appears.
4) The Player selects Messages.
5) The Player selects Create New, and the option to create a Game Invite appears.

Expected Results:
The Player must only be able to send Game Invites in the Match Lobby.

Notes:
1) The Player's game also appears Joinable to Friends or Players that attempt to Join Session in Progress. The Join does not succeed (the game is not joinable once gameplay begins)
2) This is related to TCR 115.

column7: Gameplay - Gear Store: The Pod Harnesses NXE Elevation and Custom Products Pod Pack have the same stats but the Custom Products Pod Pack appears to cost more.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, Gear Store, if the User accesses the Gear Store menu, then cycles to the harness NXE Elevation, then cycles to the harness Custom Products Pod Pack, the stats for the two harnesses appear to be the same but the Custom Products Pod Pack costs more.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select Career Mode,
2) Select the Gear Store,
3) Cycle to the harness NXE Elevation and take note of its stats and cost,
4) Cycle to the harness Custom Products Pod Pack and take note it its stats and cost,
5) Observe that the two harnesses have the same stats but different purchase prices.

Expected Results:
Purchasable items in the Gear Store that have the same stats must have the same prices.

column7: Menu/GUI - Ranked - Woodsball - Elimination - Results screen: When the Host removes the controller battery on the Results screen, the menu disappears after the controller is reconnected.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in a Ranked Woodsball Elimination match, after the match is completed and the Host disconnects the battery from the controller on the Results screen, then reinserts the battery and reconnects the controller, then presses the "A" button, the Results screen disappears and returns to the game. The Host must then press the START button to bring the Results screen back up again to exit from the game.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select Multiplayer,
2) Select Xbox LIVE,
3) Select Ranked Match,
4) Select Custom Match,
5) Change the Game Mode to Woodsball,
6) Change the Game Type to Elimination,
7) Enter gameplay,
8) Have the Host eliminate the opponents for all three rounds,
9) After completing the third round, disconnect the battery from the Host's controller when the Results screen appears,
10) Reinsert the battery and reconnect the controller,
11) Press the "A" button to continue,
12) Observe that the Results screen will disappear and the Host must press the START button to bring the Results screen up again to exit the match.

Expected Results:
When the controller is disconnected on the Results screen and then reconnected, pressing "A" must exit the Player from the game.

Note:
This will also occur if the battery is removed BEFORE the results screen is displayed.

Expected Results:
Purchasable items in the Gear Store that have the same stats must have the same prices.

column7: Video/Graphic - Speedball - Nürburgring, Germany: A building on the far right corner of the course appears and disappears
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, in Nürburgring, Germany, a gray-and-white building on the far right corner of the course disappears as the user moves closer and reappears as the user moves further away.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select Exhibition,
2) Select any game type,
3) Choose Speedball,
4) Select Nürburgring, Germany,
5) When gameplay begins, run over to the far right corner of the course,
6) Note that there is a gray-and-white building with a scoreboard in this area,
7) Observe that chunks of this building disappear as the user's character moves closer, and re-appear as the character moves further away.

Expected Results:
All areas of the environment must appear properly.

NOTE(1): Screenshots attached.

column7: TCR 115 - Multiplayer: Game Invites do not function
column8:
Summary:
Game Invites do not function

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, with a Xbox LIVE enabled Gamer Profile signed in and a Game Invite to a hosted Player Match.
2) The Player presses the Xbox Guide button.
3) The Player selects Message.
4) The Player selects the Game Invite.
5) The Player accepts the Game Invite, and nothing occurs.

Expected Results:
Game invites, when accepted, must move the Player to the accepted game's Match Lobby.

Games must allow players to send game invites for player match game sessions. Games must also allow players to join player match sessions. This is a violation of TCR 115. 

Notes:
1) The Host sees the Client's Gamertag appears in the Match Lobby.
2) All locations in the game have yet to be tested, but none so far has worked properly.

column7: Frequently (50%-59%) - Video/Graphic - Gameplay: When a match starts, the user's character's paintball marker is in the middle of the screen
column8:
Summary:
Frequently, during gameplay, when any match starts, the user's character's paintball marker is in the middle of the screen instead of along the right or left sides. When the user's character fires the marker, paintballs come out of the barrel sideways.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select any game type,
2) Select any location,
3) When gameplay begins, observe that the marker is in the middle of the screen rather than on the sides, blocking the user's view.

Expected Results:
The user's character must hold his marker correctly.

NOTE(1): If the user switches the marker between his left and right hands several times, the marker will return to a normal position on the screen.

column7: TCR 071 - Player Match Lobby: The navigational prompt for viewing a Gamer Card does not appear for the clients in Player Match
column8:
Summary:
The navigational prompt for viewing a Gamer Card does not appear for the clients in Player Match

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Match Lobby, Player Match, with the Player as a client.
2) No navigational prompt for veiwing Gamer Cards appears.

Expected Results:
The following navigational prompt must appear on all Player's screens:

"[X button Graphic] Gamer Card"

Games must provide the player the option to access another players gamer card wherever gamertags are enumerated. This is a violation of TCR 071.

Notes:
1) This prompt appears correct on the Host's screen.

column7: Frequently - Scoring - Results: Scoring after a 9 round match is incorrect.
column8:
Summary:
Frequently the results screen will display incorrect scoring. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Select Exhibition, 
2) Select 7 vs 7, 9 round, capture the flag, speedball, select any map,
3) Proceed through the rounds until the results screen,
4) Frequently observed the numbers for survivors and eliminations did not match the actual totals or the displayed totals from individual rounds.

Expected Results:
Scoring must be totaled accurately.

NOTE(1):Occurred twice on Bakersfield, CA. May be potentially caused by a player being eliminated after the flag is hung. During at least one match the User had 4 team members displayed, after hanging the flag a teammate was eliminated displaying 3 remaining team members. The Results screen displayed that the User's team had 3 survivors. The Results screen after the completion of the entire match displayed results that the User's team had one extra survivor then were recorded. The end results seem to be counting the remaining players before the flag is hung and not counting the elimination after the flag is hung.

NOTE(2): Match summary for the attached picture,

Round 1: My team eliminated 4 opponents and 3 teammates survived. The opponents eliminated 4 of my teammates and 3 opponents survived. Displayed results were accurate.

Round 2: My team eliminated 3 opponents and 2 teammates survived. The opponents eliminated 5 of my teammates and 4 opponents survived. Displayed results were accurate.

Round 3: My team eliminated 4 opponents and 3 teammates survived. The opponents eliminated 4 of my teammates and 3 opponents survived. Displayed results were accurate.

Round 4: My team eliminated 7 opponents and 1 teammates survived. The opponents eliminated 6 of my teammates and 0 opponents survived. Displayed results were accurate.

Round 5: My team eliminated 5 opponents and 3 teammates survived. The opponents eliminated 4 of my teammates and 2 opponents survived. Displayed results were accurate.

Final Results: My team eliminated 23 opponents and 12 teammates survived. The opponents eliminated 23 of my teammates and 12 opponents survived. The displayed results showed that my team eliminated 21 opponents and 12 teammates survived, the opponents eliminated 23 of my teammates and 14 opponents survived.

column7: TCR 096 - Multiplayer: If the Host of an Xbox LIVE Ranked Multiplayer Match has an internet connection limited to bandwidth 64kbps/64kbps, when every Client after the first joins the Game Lobby, only one Client remains and all others are ejected.
column8:
Summary:
If the Host of an Xbox LIVE Ranked Multiplayer Match has an internet connection limited to bandwidth 64kbps/64kbps, when every Client after the first joins the game, only one Client remains and all others are ejected from the Game Lobby.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1's internet connection is limited to 64kbps/64kbps,
2) User 1 creates an Xbox LIVE Ranked Match,
3) User 2 joins User 1's game,
4) User 3 joins User 1's game,
5) Observe, when User 3 joins User 1's game, either User 2 or User 3 is ejected from the Game Lobby.

Expected Results:
The title must support Xbox LIVE gameplay when the host has an internet connection with limited bandwidth of 64kbps/64kbps.

Peer-to-peer gameplay between two different Xbox consoles must not be disconnected as long as the following performance conditions are maintained:
 Each console has an upstream and downstream bandwidth of 64 kilobits/sec (64,000 bits/sec) or higher.
 200 ms or less round-trip latency between consoles.
 Ten percent or less packet loss in a ten-second interval.
 Two percent or less packet loss, in general.

This is a violation of TCR 096.

Note(1): This is PreCert TCR 096 Issue 1 of 1.
Note(2): Occasionally, four Users are supported in the Ranked Match Game Lobby for a short period of time before they are ejected from the Game Lobby due to being disconnected from the host.

column7: Gameplay - Match Results: The Match Results screen does not appear after finishing the final match of any tournament.

The Match Results screen must appear after every round in Tournament Mode.

4) User's character navigated to the far-right corner of the map where the remain opponent was positioned behind a bunker.
5) Occasionally, observed that while the opponent was positioned at a bunker near the opponent, the opponent appeared to appeared to be stuck crouching in an unrealistic movement loop.

column7: Occasionally - Crash - Mutliplayer : The host is stuck on an indefinite black screen when they select Quit Game from the XMB while loading into gameplay.
column8:
Summary:
When loading into a multiplayer match with 2 players, the host with the 2.50 system software update presses the PS Button and selects Quit Game from the XMB, the host observes a black screen appear and must manually power down the console using the power switch on the back of the PS3.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) The host with the 2.50 system software update creates a default multiplayer match
2) A client joins the player lobby and the host starts the game
3) While on the loading screen the host presses the PS Button to bring up the XMB
4) The host selects Quit Game
5) Selects 'YES' to confirm
6) Black screen appears,
7) System beeps 3 times,
8) Observes being crashed on the black screen.
5) The host will be stuck on a black screen until manually re-booting the system.

Expected Results:
The host must be brought back to system software screen menu when quitting the game via the XMB anywhere within multiplayer. 

NOTE(1): When rebooting via the power button on front of the system, the button has to be held down longer than normal before the system reboots.
NOTE(2): Bug occured when the Host or Client quit via XMB on the countdown into gameplay. A TTY is attached for this reproduction.
NOTE(3): Bug occured when the Client quit via XMB while on the Stats Menu. A TTY is attached for this reproduction.
NOTE(4): Bug occured when the Host or Client quit via XMB while on the Controls Menu. A TTY is attached for this reproduction
column9:

column7: Video/Graphic - Multiplayer - When users are too close to each other, the user's paintball markers will clip and disappear
column8:
Summary:
When 2 users are in a game and are close to each other, the user's markers will start to disappear.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) 2 users load into multiplayer gameplay (same team or not)
2) Users stand as close a possible facing each other
3) Users will see the other user's marker disappear

Expected Results:
Users must not see other user's markers disappear, markers must remain visible at all times.

column7: Video/Graphic - Speed ball - SC Village: On SC Village, the is no graphical environment past the trees outside of the field.
column8:
Summary:
On SC Village, the is no graphical environment past the trees outside of the field.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Multiplayer Menu, User 1 hosts a Speed ball Player Match on SC Village,
2) User 2 joins Host's game,
3) Users progress into gameplay,
4) One of the Users shoots and eliminates the other User,
5) When eliminated User is in Spectator Mode, they move to the corner of the field that has trees outside the fence,
6) User observes that there is no graphical environment past the trees.

Expected Results:
A graphical environment must exist as far as the User can see.

column7: Video/Graphic - Multiplayer: While watching another Player performing the reload animation, the User observes there is no hopper within that Player's hand.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay of an Xbox LIVE player match, if the User navigates their character up to another Player, that Player performs the reload animation, and the User observes no Hopper appears within that Player's hand.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 hosts an Xbox LIVE player match with any settings.
2) User 2 joins the match.
3) All Users READY up, and User 1 launches the game.
4) Gameplay appears.
5) From the starting position, User 1 navigates their character to User 2's character, and positions themself to the side of User 2's character.
6) User 2 presses the "LT"/"RT" button to fire off a few paintball rounds at the ground.
7) User 2 then presses the Right Stick (RELOAD) button to perform the reload action.
8) User 1 observes User 2's character perform the reload action.
9) User 1 observes that User 2's character has no Hopper in their hand when performing the action.

Expected Results:
The reload animation must appear correctly to other Players.

NOTE: No paintballs appear as well.

column7: Video/Graphic - Multiplayer - Train Depot Field: While in spectator view, the user is able to see under the world after colliding with a spool.
column8:
Summary: While in spectator view, the user is able to see under the world after colliding with a spool. The user attempts to move in between the top and bottom of the spool, and ends up seeing outside the world.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates an Xbox LIVE Capture the Flag, Player match at Train Depot Field.
2) User 2 joins User 1's match.
3) Users begin gameplay.
4) User 2 eliminates User 1.
5) User 1 navigates to any spool that is flipped over onto it's side.
6) User 1 attempts to position their camera in between the spool.
7) User 1 observes their camera clip through the ground, and can see outside the world.

Expected Results: Users must not be able to see outside the world.

3) User 1 observes the menu box for gear types is position further to the left. (Not centered on the screen)
