column7: Video/Graphic - Speedball - London, England: Spectators standing behind the mesh net on the left side of the field (Red Team's perspective) float approximately 1-foot off the ground and clip through 4 short cylindrical cement pillars.
column8:
Summary:
During Speedball gameplay, London, England, the spectators standing behind the mesh netting on the left side of the field from the Red Team's starting point are floating approximately one foot off the ground and clip through four short cylindrical cement pillars along the length of the field.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select Multiplayer,
2) Select Xbox LIVE,
3) Select Player Match,
4) Create a game at London, England,
5) Enter gameplay,
6) From the Red Team's starting point, navigate the User's Avatar to the left side of the field,
7) Observe that the spectators standing behind the mesh net along the length of the field float approximately one-foot off the ground and clip through four short cylindrical cement pillars.

Expected Results:
Spectators must not appear to be floating or clip through objects.

column7: Text - Career Mode: With a new Career, the Canadian Invitational text will appear on-screen for a split second when Play Tournament is selected from the Career Mode menu.
column8:
Summary:
From the Main menu, with a new Career, the User selects Career Mode, selects Play Tournament, the Tournament menu appears, and the User observes the text below the Charlotte, North Carolina level briefly appears as "Canadian Invitational, Locked, 5 vs 5."

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User creates a new Career.
2) From the Main menu, User selects Career Mode.
3) User selects Play Tournament.
4) The Tournament menu appears, and the User observes the text below the Charlotte, North Carolina level briefly appears as "Canadian Invitational, Locked, 5 vs. 5", before switching to the correct text.

Expected Results:
The correct text must always appear underneath Tournament level pictures.

NOTE: This also happens on other levels within the Tournament menu, but the User must progress through the tournaments and reach those levels.

column7: Video/Graphic - Multiplayer: The turning animation does not occur during sliding, if the User immediately begins turning when starting the slide.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in a Multiplayer match, if the User presses the "A" button to perform the slide action, then immediately begins turning, other Players in the game will observe that the User's character stays facing the original direction of the slide, when in fact the User has already turned nearly 180 degrees in the opposite direction.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates a multiplayer match with any settings.
2) User 2 joins the game.
3) Both Users READY up, and User 1 launches the game.
4) During gameplay, both Users navigate to the same bunker that is slide-able.
5) User 1 performs the slide action by pressing the "A" button while moving towards the bunker.
6) Immediately after pressing the "X" button, User 1 turns their camera and character by moving the Right Stick to the left/right to face User 2.
7) User 2 observes that during the slide animation, User 1's character is always facing the original direction of the slide action, when in fact, User 1 has turned in mid-slide and has User 2 in their sight.
8) The slide action completes, and User 2 observes that User 1's character has suddenly turned towards them.

Expected Results:
The slide animation must properly reflect the actions of the User.

NOTE: If User 1 is firing while performing this bug, User 2 wll observe that User 1 appears to be firing at their paintballs at weird angles.
NOTE: This bug is timing specific.

column7: TCR 070 - Exhibition: The Rich Presence for Exhibition - Miami is incorrect
column8:
Summary:
The Rich Presence for Exhibition - Miami is incorrect

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, Exhibition, any mode, Miami, with a Friend monitoring the Player's Rich Presence,
2) The Player's Rich Presence appears as:

"Exhibition - Speedball
Houston, Texas"

Change to:

"Exhibition - Speedball
Miami, Florida"

By replacing the text "Houston, Texas" with the text "Miami, Florida".

In active gameplay, games must update presence information. Presence information must accurately reflect the players state. This is a violation of TCR 070.

column7: TCR 070 - Quick Play: The Rich Presence for Quick Play - Miami is incorrect
column8:
Summary:
The Rich Presence for Quick Play - Miami is incorrect

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, Quick Play, Miami, with a Friend monitoring the Player's Rich Presence,
2) The Player's Rich Presence appears as:

"Quick Play
Houston, Texas"

Change to:

"Quick Play
Miami, Florida"

By replacing the text "Houston, Texas" with the text "Miami, Florida".

In active gameplay, games must update presence information. Presence information must accurately reflect the players state. This is a violation of TCR 070.

column7: Once - Crash - System Link Lobby: After pressing the Guide Button, the Blade came up full screen and the game crashed.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, on the System Link Lobby screen with default game-type settings and no Clients in the match, after the Host pressed the Guide Button, the Guide Blade appeared full screen and the game crashed with a fatal system error.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, selected Multiplayer,
2) Selected System Link,
3) Selected Create Match,
4) Used the defaulted game types,
5) In the Lobby, pressed the Guide button,
6) Observed that the Guide Blade appeared full screen and the game crashed.


Expected Results:
The game must not crash when the Guide Blade is brought up in the Lobby.

Notes:
1) There is no crash dump available for this crash.

column7: Menu/GUI - Multiplayer: Players are moved to the Main Menu if a System Link game ends in an error
column8:
Summary:
Players are moved to the Main Menu if a System Link game ends in an error

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, System Link.
2) The host quits the game.
3) The clients recieve the message "Lost connection with the Host".
4) The clients select Ok, and the Main Menu appears.

Expected Results:
The System Link must appear after exiting a System Link game.

Notes:
1) This also occurs for the Host, if all the Clients leave.
column9:
[Steve Myers (AMP TRG Lead) -- 10/21/2008 09:18:49 PM]
Moved back to Dev ownership

column7: Menu/GUI - System Link: A Host that quits out of a System Link game is brought to an incorrect menu
column8:
Summary:
A Host that quits out of a System Link game is brought to an incorrect menu

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, System Link, with the Player as the Host.
2) The Player presses the START (Pause) button.
3) The Player selects Quit Match.
4) The Player selects Yes.
5) A loading screen appears, and a System Link Menu appears with the options "Quick Match", "Custom Match", and "Create Game".

Expected Results:
Anyone exiting from a Multiplayer game must be brought to the System Link Menu.

column7: Menu/GUI - System Link: A Client that quits out of a System Link game is brought to the incorrect Menu
column8:
Summary:
A Client that quits out of a System Link game is brought to the incorrect Menu

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, System Link, with the Player as a client.
2) The Player presses the START (Pause) button.
3) The Player selects Quit Match.
4) The Player selects Yes.
5) A loading screen appears, and a System Link Menu appears with the options "Quick Match", "Custom Match", and "Create Game".

Expected Results:
Anyone exiting from a Multiplayer game must be brought to the System Link Menu.

column7: Video/Graphic - Exhibition - Woodsball Maps: There is no paint splatter when paintballs hit anything except the ground.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, Exhibition Mode, on any woodsball level, when a paintball hits any object other than the ground (trees, shacks, barrels, and boxes), no paint splatter appears where the paintball landed.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select Exhibition,
2) Select any gameplay settings, and any woodsball map,
3) Hit A to start the game,
4) When the match starts, walk up to any object such as a tree or box and shoot it,
5) Observe, there is no paint splatter left where the paintball hit the object.

Expected Results:
There must be a paint splatter whenever a paintball hits an object.

NOTE(1):
The paint splatters do not appear on anything except the ground.

column7: Statistics: Scoreboards - Ranked match, statistics from partially completed ranked matches do not post to the scoreboards.
column8:
Summary: 
When viewing the ranked match scoreboards, users observe that statistics from partially completed ranked games (host leaves early) do not post to the scoreboard. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates a default ranked match.
2) Users 2-4 join user 1's game.
3) User 1 starts the game, gameplay begins for all users.
4) User 2(yellow team) eliminates users from the red team, then captures the flag to complete the round.
5) User 1 exits the match via the in-game menu.
6) User 2 enters the ranked match scoreboards.
7) User 2 observes they are not credited for their eliminations in the previous partially completed match.

Expected Results: 
Ranked match statistics must be tracked on a per-round basis to the scoreboards.

Note(1)
Currently, users could exploit the ranked scoreboard by choosing whether or not to complete a match. If the user is having a poor game, they can quit without being penalized.

column7: Gameplay - Multiplayer: The elimination text in the corner of the screen dissapears too quickly.
column8:
Summary:
The elimination text in the corner of the screen dissapears too quickly.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 hosts a Ranked or Player Match
2) Users 2-4 join User 1's game
3) Users enter into gameplay
4) User 1 eliminates User 2
5) Right after the elimination User 3 eliminates User 4
6) Users observe the text in the corner of the screen disappear for the first elimination before they can read it.

Expected Results:
Elimination text must stay on-screen for a resonable amount of time. Text must scroll when Users are eliminated at the same time.

column7: Menu/GUI - Multiplayer: The Client is returned to the Main menu after being disconnected from the Host while on the Exit Confirmation screen.
column8:
Summary:
The Client is returned to the Main menu after being disconnected from the Host while on the Exit Confirmation screen.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 Creates a Player Match with default settings,
2) User 2 joins user 1's game,
3) Game Lobby appears,
4) User 2 presses B button to Back out,
5) Exit Confirmation screen appears,
6) User 1 presses the B button to Back out,
7) Selects YES to confirm,
8) "Disconnected from the host." message appears for User 2,
9) Selects OK,
10) Observes being returned to the Main menu.

Expected Results:
The Client must be returned to the Xbox LIVE menu after they have lost connection with the Host.

NOTE(1): This occurs from Player Match, Ranked Match, and System Link game lobbies.
NOTE(2): Also occurs while a Client is on the Your Gear screen.
column9:
[John Hart (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/24/2008 01:58:55 AM]
Verified in the 10/22 build

column7: Video/Graphic - Multiplayer: The text indicating that the User has the flag overlaps the Sprint Meter when the resolution is set to 480i.
column8:
Summary:

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 or 2 has there resolution set to 480i
2) User 1 hosts a default Player Match
3) User 2 joins User 1's game
4) Users load into gameplay
5) The User with 480i resolution picks up the flag
6) User observes the text that appears overlaps the Sprint Meter.

Expected Results:
Text must not overlap the Sprint Meter.

column7: Video/Graphic - Multiplayer - Train Depot Field: While in spectator view, the user is able to see under the world after colliding with a spool.
column8:
Summary: While in spectator view, the user is able to see under the world after colliding with a spool. The user attempts to move in between the top and bottom of the spool, and ends up seeing outside the world.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates a Capture the Flag, Player match at Train Depot Field.
2) User 2 joins User 1's match.
3) Users begin gameplay.
4) User 2 eliminates User 1.
5) User 1 navigates to any spool that is flipped over onto it's side.
6) User 1 attempts to position their camera in between the spool.
7) User 1 observes their camera clip through the ground, and can see outside the world.

Expected Results: Users must not be able to see outside the world.

column7: Text - Multiplayer: Gamertags and Player Icons overlap the User's paintball mask graphic, on the Users HUD.
column8:
Summary:
Online ID's overlap the User's paintball mask graphic, on the Users HUD.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates a multiplayer game lobby with "Visible Player Name" set to Yes.
2) User 2 and 3 join User 1's game lobby, with User 2 on User 1's team.
3) Users progress to gameplay.
4) Gameplay begins, User 1 observes User 2.
5) User 1 observes User 2's Player Icon and Gamertag, overlapping with their Paintball Mask graphic, on their HUD.

Expected Results:
Player Icons and Gamertag must not overlap a User's Paintball mask graphic, on the Users HUD.

column7: Occasionally - Technical Check - Multiplayer - When 5 clients simultaneously join a game lobby, the game lobby between clients does not properly reflect what team multiple clients are on.
column8:
Summary:
Within a game lobby of a default multiplayer match, when 5 clients simultaneously join the match, the game lobby between clients does not properly reflect what team multiple clients are on.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) The host creates a default multiplayer match
2) 5 clients simultaneously join the lobby
3) Multiple clients observe the teams displayed on screen do not reflect what the teams actually are

Expected Results:
The teams listed within the game lobby must always appear properly before loading into multiplayer gameplay between all users.

column7: Technical Check - Gameplay: User observes a slight frame rate drop when jumping over small bunkers.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, if the User character attempts to jump over a small bunker, the User observes a slight frame rate drop when performing that jump.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User enters gameplay in any Speedball map.
2) User approaches a small bunker their character is able to jump.
3) User observes the text, "Press A to jump" appears on screen.
4) User presses the "A" button to have their character execute a jump.
5) User observes the a slight drop in frame rate while jumping.

Expected Results:
The frame rate must not drop, when the User's character is jumping over obstacles.

column7: Menu/GUI - Multiplayer: From the Audio Options screen in the Pause menu, User cannot choose the playlist "Menu Music."
column8:
Summary:
From the Audio Options screen in the Pause menu, User cannot choose the playlist "Menu Music."

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main menu, User loads into any type of gameplay,
2) Presses START button to access the Pause Menu,
3) Selects Options,
4) Selects Audio,
5) Highlights Playlist,
6) Scrolls cursor left and right to view playlists,
7) Observes there is no option to choose "Menu Music" as a playlist.

Expected Results:
User must be able to select any playlist.

Note(1): If User highlights Playlist and presses the "X" button to View Playlists, they see that "Menu Music" is supposed to be an available playlist.

column7: Gameplay - Multiplayer - Ranked Match: If a Client disconnects in any way during the Game Lobby countdown, the Host is unable to start the game, and other Clients are unable to join.
column8:
Summary:
In a Ranked Match, if a Client disconnects in any way during the Game Lobby countdown, the Host is unable to start the game, and other Clients are unable to join the game.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Host creates default Ranked Match
2) 3 Clients join the Host's game
3) The Host starts the Game Lobby countdown
4) As soon as the countdown begins 1 Client disconnects (signs out of Xbox LIVE, power down, pulling the network cable, etc.)
5) The timer counts down and dissapears
6) The Host notices the button prompts on the screen disappear and the screen only displays "Waiting For 1 More Client."
7) The Host is unable to start the game and no clients are able to rejoin the Host's game

Expected Results:
The title must not hang, malfunction or become unplayable due to communication, errors, or another Clients actions.

column7: Gameplay - Multiplayer: If the Host disconnects the controller, and the Client manually quits from the game, the Host stays in the game with no opposing team.
column8:
Summary:
In Multiplayer, if the Host disconnects the controller, and the Client manually quits from the game, the Host stays in the game with no opposing team

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Host creates a default Player Match.
2) Client joins the Host's game
3) Host presses "LB" to add a bot to their team.
3) Host starts the game
4) Gameplay appears
5) Host disconnects the controller
6) Client exits the game via the Pause Menu
7) The Host reconnects the controller and selects "OK" on the disconnected message
8) The Host notices he remains in gameplay with no clients/bots on the yellow team.

Expected Results:
Host must get disconnected when there are no Clients left in the game.
column9:
[John Hart (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/24/2008 01:58:55 AM]
Verified in the 10/22 build

column7: Technical Check - Multiplayer: The Host is unable to start a Player Match after creating it through the Quick Match option when the teams are not even.
column8:
Summary:
The Host is unable to start a Player Match after creating it through the Quick Match option when the teams are not even.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 selects Player Match from the Xbox Live menu
2) User 1 selects Quick Match
3) Users 2 and 3 join User 1's game
4) With all Users "readied up" and at least one User on each team, User 1 presses the A button to start the game
5) User 1 observes they are unable to start the game.

Expected Results:
Player Matches must be able to start when there is a minimum of two players in the lobby on opposing teams, even teams must not be turned on.

column7: Technical Check - Multiplayer: The Host is unable to start a Player Match after creating it through the Quick Match option.
column8:
Summary:
The Host is unable to start a Player Match after creating it through the Quick Match option.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 selects Player Match from the Xbox Live menu
2) User 1 selects Quick Match
3) User 2 joins User 1's game
4) With both Users "readied up" and on opposite teams, User 1 presses the A button to start the game
5) User 1 observes they are unable to start the game.

Expected Results:
Player Matches must be able start when there is a minimum of two players in the lobby on opposing teams.

Note: The host can start the game if there are 4 players in the game lobby.

column7: TCR 070 - Multiplayer System Link: The Rich Presence for Speedball Miami, Florida is incorrect
column8:
Summary:
In Multiplayer System Link, the Rich Presence for Speedball Miami, Florida is incorrect.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Multiplayer Menu, with a Friend monitoring the Player's Rich Presence,
2) The Player selects System Link.
3) The Host selects Create Game.
4) The host selects Speedball Miami, Florida.
5) Clients join.
6) Gameplay begins.
7) The Rich Presence appears as:

"LAN - Speedball 
Houston, Texas"

Change to:

"System Link - <X>
Miami, Florida"

By replacing the first set of text with the second set of text.

In active gameplay, games must update presence information. Presence information must accurately reflect the players state. This is a violation of TCR 070.

Notes:
1) "<X>" refers to the gametype - CTF, CF, or Elim.

column7: Video/Graphic - Field Creator: With the black and blue color scheme selected, the black color on the 4ft Cylinder bunkers appears gray
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in Field Creator, with the black and blue color scheme selected, if the user selects the 4ft Cylinder bunkers, the black color on the bunker appears gray.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select Field Editor.
2) Select any pre-made map.
3) When the Field Creator appears, press the X button until all of the pre-existing bunkers have been deleted.
4) Press left on the Directional Pad, set the color scheme to black and blue (the black square should be in front of the blue square), then press the B button to apply the color scheme.
5) Press right on the Directional Pad, and select the 4ft Cylinder bunkers.
6) Observe that the area that is supposed to be black in color appears gray in color.

Expected Results:
With the black and blue color scheme selected, the black color must appear black and not gray.

column7: Once - TCR 015 - Menu System: Signing in to an Xbox LIVE enabled Gamer profile that was not connected to Xbox LIVE caused a Profile change
column8:
Summary:
Once, on the Main Menu, a Player signed into a Xbox LIVE enabled idle Gamer Profile which caused a Profile change for the Active Xbox LIVE Gamer Profile.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, with an Xbox LIVE Gamer Profile not connected to Xbox LIVE signed in to Controller 2.
2) The Player signed in to a Xbox LIVE Gamer Profile not connected to Xbox LIVE with Controller 1.
3) A Profile change occurred for the Active Xbox LIVE Gamer Profile, returning the Player to the START screen. 

Expected Results:
Idle Profile sign ins must not affect the Active Gamer Profile during gameplay.

Games must properly detect and handle player profiles signing in or out in all areas of the game. This is a violation of TCR 015.

column7: Twice - TCR 015 - Gameplay - Exhibition: Signing in an non-Xbox LIVE idle Gamer Profile caused a Profile change for the Active Xbox LIVE Gamer Profile
column8:
Summary:
Twice, In Exhibition gameplay, the Player signed into a non-Xbox LIVE idle Gamer Profile which caused a Profile change for the Active Xbox LIVE Gamer Profile.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During Exhibition gameplay, with an Active Xbox LIVE Gamer Profile signed in to Controller 2.
2) The Player signed in an non-Xbox LIVE Gamer Profile in to Controller 1.
3) A Profile change occurred for the Active Xbox LIVE Gamer Profile, returning the Player to the START screen. 

Expected Results:
Idle Profile sign ins must not affect the Active Gamer Profile during gameplay.

Games must properly detect and handle player profiles signing in or out in all areas of the game. This is a violation of TCR 015.

column7: Video/Graphic - Woodsball - San Diego Field: All powerlines on the map are graphically corrupt
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, on San Diego Field, all the power lines strung above the map are graphically corrupt.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select Exhibition,
2) Select any game type,
3) Choose Woodsball,
4) Select San Diego Field,
5) When gameplay begins, look up at the sky near the middle of the map,
6) Observe that the power lines in this area are graphically corrupt.

Expected Results:
All areas of the environment must appear properly.

NOTE(1): Screenshot attached.

column7: Video/Graphic: Multiplayer - Woodsball, Gold Mine Field, the small wooden shack appears partially sunk into the ground.
column8:
Summary: During gameplay of a multiplayer match on Woodsball, Gold Mine Field, the small wooden shack appears partially sunk into the ground.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates any multiplayer match on Woodsball, Gold Mine Field.
2) User 2 joins user 1's game.
3) User 1 starts the game, gameplay appears for all users.
4) Users navigate their characters to the small wooden shack.
5) Users observe the shack is sunk partially into the ground.

Expected Results: The wooden shack must appear correctly.

column7: Video/Graphic: Multiplayer - Woodsball, Jungle Park, the small wooden shack appears partially sunk into the ground.
column8:
Summary: During gameplay of a multiplayer match on Woodsball, Jungle Park, the small wooden shack appears partially sunk into the ground.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates any multiplayer match on Woodsball, Jungle Park.
2) User 2 joins user 1's game.
3) User 1 starts the game, gameplay appears for all users.
4) Users navigate their characters to the small wooden shack.
5) Users observe the shack is sunk partially into the ground.

Expected Results: The wooden shack must appear correctly.

column7: Video/Graphic: Multiplayer - San Diego Field, users observe the house near the yellow team flag base is partially sunk into the ground.
column8:
Summary: During gameplay of a multiplayer match on San Diego Field, users observe the house near the yellow team flag base is partially sunk into the ground.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates an Xbox LIVE player match on the San Diego Field woodsball level.
2) User 2 joins user 1's game.
3) User 1 starts the game, gameplay begins for all users.
4) User 2(yellow team) observes the house in front of and to the left of their flag base.
5) User 2 observes the house is partially sunk into the ground.

Expected Results: The specified house must not be partially sunk into the ground.

column7: Video/Graphic: Multiplayer - Woodsball, San Diego Field, power lines above the level appear with corrupt graphics.
column8:
Summary: During gameplay of a multiplayer match on Woodsball, San Diego Field, power lines above the level appear with corrupt graphics.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates an Xbox LIVE player match on Woodsball, San Diego Field.
2) User 2 joins user 1's game.
3) User 1 starts the game, gameplay begins for all users.
4) Users observe the power lines that cross the center of the level.
5) Users observe the power lines appear with corrupt graphics.

Expected Results: The power lines on this level must appear correctly.

column7: Technical Check - Multiplayer : The users experience extreme amounts of lag during gameplay when the host is connected via a cable/dsl connection.
column8:
Summary:
The users experience extreme amounts of lag during gameplay when the host is connected via a cable connection.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) The host, connected via a cable connection, creates a default multiplayer match
2) 13 clients joins the game lobby
3) Gameplay appears
4) The users experience extreme amounts of lag during gameplay

Expected Results:
The users must not experience large amounts of lag during multiplayer gameplay when the host is connected via a cable connection.

Note: Because of the lag multiple issues occur including:
-Cheat meters do not appear until user's are already in spectator mode.
-Delay when attempting to pick up opponent flag.

Note: The following was the connection type used:
Router: D-Link 802.11g/2.4ghz
m/n: DL 524
Modem: Terayon 
M/N: TJ715X
column9:

column7: Twice - Crash - XPSL Nevada - Preliminary Match 3: After all teammates are eliminated by opposing team and pressing the "A" button to skip the scene, the game crashed.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, in XPSL Nevada, after all members of the Player Team are eliminated, the Player pressed the "A" button to skip the scene of the opponent capturing the Player's flag when the text "Press A to skip" was displayed. After pressing "A" on the controller, the game crashed with a fatal system error.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Begin the XPSL Nevada Tournament,
2) Allow all teammates to be eliminated by the opposing team,
3) When the text "Press A to skip" appears on screen, press the "A" button on the controller,
4) Observe that the game crashes with a fatal system error.

Expected Results:
The game must not crash when the Player presses "A" to skip the scene of the opposing team capturing the Player Team's flag.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay - San Diego California: Palm trees in the background partially appear
column8:
Summary:
In San Diego California, palm trees in the background partially appear.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, in San Diego California,
2) The Player views the palm trees towards the buildings, and they appear only partially depending on where the Player is on the field.

Expected Results:
Palm trees must appear properly during gameplay.

Notes:
1) The image attached highlights this issue.

column7: Video/Graphic - Field Creator: When the Player flies upward, the Player is able to view the edges of levels
column8:
Summary:
In Field Creator, when the Player is in Fly Through mode, and proceeds upwards, the Player is able to view the edges of the levels.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During fly through mode in Field Creator, any level,
2) The Player proceeds upwards with the camera.
3) The Player is able to view the edges of levels.

Expected Results:
Levels must be designed in such a manner to not allow the Player to view the edges of levels.

column7: Video/Graphic - Field Creator - Malaga Spain: The Player is able to see the edge of the level
column8:
Summary:
In Field Creator Malaga Spain, the Player is able to see the edges of the level.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) In Field Creator, Malaga Spain,
2) The Player presses Y (fly through) button.
3) The Player proceeds to the area with the ocean.
4) The Player looks towards the corners and is able to see the edges of the level.

Expected Results:
The level must appear naturally to the Player, and the edges must be conceled.

column7: Gameplay - Gameplay: AI characters are unable to jump over beam bunkers
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in any Speedball match, the AI characters are unable to jump over the beam bunkers.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select any mode of play.
2) Select any Speedball match.
3) Dismiss the Instructions Screen to begin gameplay.
4) During gameplay, observe that the AI characters do not jump over beam bunkers, and run around them instead.

Expected Results:
AI characters must be able to jump over beam bunkers.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay - Paris France: A building in the background appears off the level
column8:
Summary:
In Paris France, a building in the background appears off the level edge.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, in Paris France,
2) The Player navigates to where the large house is located.
3) The smaller building to the left of it appears off the edge of the level.

Expected Results:
The level must not appear to abruptly end to the Players view.

Notes:
1) The image attached highlights this issue.
column9:
[Justin Westplate (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/23/2008 05:44:34 PM]
Verified on the 10/22/08 X360 Build.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay - San Jose California: Floating pizza boxes appear inside tents

2) The Player proceeds to the large brown tents by the stands.
3) Pizza boxes appear floating inside of the tents.

Expected Results:

Notes:
1) The image attached highlights this issue.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay - San Jose California: Banner poles clip through the top of a tent

Summary:
In San Jose California, the poles of a banner clip through the top of a tent, in the area with all of the tents lined up.

Steps to Reproduce:

2) The Player proceeds to the mesh fence where all the tents are located.
3) The Poles of a banner are clipping through the top of the tent.

Expected Results:
The poles must be moved as to not clip through the top of tents.

1) The image attached highlights this issue.

In San Jose California, a pizza box and drink bottles appear floating.

3) A pizza box and drink bottles appear floating.

Expected Results:
A table must be added for the pizza box and drink bottles to sit on.

Notes:
1) The image attached highlights this issue.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay - SC Village: A banner pole is clipping through the benches
column8:
Summary:
In SC Village, a banner pole appears clipping through the benches on the right side of the map.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, in SC Village,
2) The Player proceeds to the right of the map.
3) The Player proceeds to the middle banner.

Expected Results:

column7: Video/Graphic - Field Creator - SC Village: Objects outside of the field pop in and out when the Player is on the opposite end of the field
column8:
Summary:
In Field Creator SC Village, the objects outside of the field pop in and out when the Player is on the opposite end of the field.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, in SC Village,
2) The Player observes that objects outside of the field pop in and out when the Player is on the opposite end of the field.

Expected Results:
Objects must not pop in and out while the Players are on the field.

Notes:
1) The image attached highlights this issue.

column7: Occasionally (1%-9%) - Gameplay - Multiplayer: With Gamertags enabled, friendly AI characters' names stayed on screen after the character was eliminated
column8:
Summary:
Occasionally, during Multiplayer gameplay with bots and Gamertags enabled, friendly bots' names stayed on screen after they were eliminated.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, the host and clients selected Multiplayer,
2) The host selected any map,
3) The host chose Capture the Flag,
4) He then enabled Gamertags,
5) He added the maximum amount of bots,
6) During gameplay, the users eliminated all the bots,
7) The users then observed that friendly bots' names occasionally stayed on screen and were listed on the HUD as still being active.

Expected Results:
All bots must properly disappear when eliminated.

column7: Video/Graphic - Field Creator - SC Village: The Player is able to see outside of the level while in fly through mode
column8:
Summary:
In Field Creator SC Village, the Player is able to see outside of the level in the bottom right corner of the level.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, in Field Creator SC Village, 
2) The Player presses Y (Flythrough) button.
3) The Player proceeds to the corner with the yellow tent and bleachers.
4) The Player flies upwards and is able to see outside of the level.

Expected Results:
The Player must not be allowed to see outside of the level.

Notes:
1) The image attached highlights this issue.
2) This issue will also occur in Multiplayer, when a Player is eliminated and enters Fly through mode.

column7: Frequently - Crash - Multiplayer: During a 4 player Center Flag match, on the Round Results screen the Host will crash.
column8:
Summary:
Frequently, during gameplay, System Link, if the User creates 2 player Center Flag match on the Round Results screen, the Host crashes.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Multiplayer menu, User 1 hosts a default Center Flag System Link match.
2) Users 2-14 join Host's game,
3) One team completes the round by bringing the Center Flag to their opponent's base,
4) Observe the host appears to crash on the Round Results screen.

Expected Results:
The game must not crash during a System Link match.

NOTE(1): There are crash dumps uploaded to this bug.
NOTE(2): The client also appears to crash, but at a lower frequency.

column7: Video/Graphic - Field Creator - SC Village: Drink bottles appear highly visible through the mesh fence
column8:
Summary:
In Field Creator SC Village, the drink bottles appear highly visible through the mesh fence.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, in Field Creator SC Village.
2) The Player presses Y (fly through) button.
3) The Player proceeds to the edge of the mesh fence, and the drink bottles appear highly visible through it.

Expected Results:
Drink bottles must appear properly behind the mesh fence.

Notes:
1) The image attached highlights this issue.

column7: Menu/GUI - Leaderboards: Scrolling through pages does not function properly in the Leaderboards
column8:
Summary:
In Multiplayer Leaderboards, when the Player scrolls up from Rank 26, it defaults the Player highlighting to Rank 1.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Multiplayer Menu, with 26 Ranks filled in the Ranked Multiplayer Speedball Elimiinations Leaderboards.
2) The Player selects Ranked.
3) The Player selects Leaderboards.
4) The Player selects Multiplayer Speedball Eliminations.
5) The Player scrolls down to rank 26.
6) The Player scrolls up one position.
7) The Player is defaulted to highlighting Rank 1.

Expected Results:
When the Player scrolls up from Rank 26, it should highlight Rank 25.

column7: Technical Check - Gameplay: Massive Ads do not properly update when the Player connects to Xbox LIVE after the game starts.
column8:
Summary:
Massive Ads do not properly update when the Player connects to Xbox LIVE after the game starts.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, with a Xbox LIVE enabled Gamer Profile signed in but not connected to Xbox LIVE.
2) The Player presses the Xbox Guide button.
3) The Xbox Guide Blade appears.
4) The Player selects Connect to Xbox LIVE.
5) The Player is connected to Xbox LIVE.
6) The Player closes the Xbox Guide Blade.
7) The Player enters gameplay, any level, and static ads appear where the Massive Ads normally appear.

Expected Results:
The in game Massive Ads must update properly when the Player is connected to Xbox LIVE and the Massive Ad server.

Notes:
1) This issue also occurs if the Player selects an alternate map or gametype.
2) This also appears if the Player reconnects during gameplay.
column9:
[Steve Myers (AMP TRG Lead) -- 10/23/2008 06:46:23 PM]
This issue still occurs in the 10.22.08 X360 build. No Change.

column7: Occasionally - Gameplay - Multiplayer: At least one player in a Ranked Match did not see Player Names over their teammates.
column8:
Summary:
Occasionally, at least one player in a Ranked Match did not see Player Names over their teammates.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Multiplayer, Play Online menu, User 1 hosted a default Ranked Match,
2) Users 2-4 joined User 1's Ranked Match lobby,
3) Users progressed into gameplay,
4) Occasionally, at least one User did not observe a Player Name over their teammate.

Expected Results:
Users must be able to identify their teammates by their Player Names.

Note(1): Issue also occurs with more than four players.
Note(2): The flag does not appear and the large pulsing flag indicator arrow is stationary when this issue occurs (may be related to issue 5183).
column9:
[Dean Fingerholz (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/24/2008 06:03:56 PM]
Verified on 10.23.08 build.
[Dean Fingerholz (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/27/2008 01:45:07 PM]
Issue Verified on 10.26.08 build.

[John Hart (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/29/2008 04:19:02 AM]
Verified in the 10/28 build

column7: Once - Crash - Quick Play - Speedball - Las Vegas, Nevada: Once, game crashed after recieving a disconnected from host message
column8:
Summary:
Once, during gameplay in Quick Play, in the Las Vegas, Nevada tournament, after the 3rd round, the user received a disconnected from host message, and the game became unresponsive.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, selected Quick Play.
2) Selected the Las Vegas, Nevada tournament.
3) Dismissed the Instructions Screen to begin gameplay.
4) The user won the 1st round, lost the 2nd round, and won the 3rd round.
5) After the Results Screen appeared in the 3rd round, the user received a "Disconnected from host" message.
6) User pressed the XBox Guide button to dismiss the message.
7) User observed the Main Menu appeared, but the game was unresponsive when the user attempted to navigate the Main Menu.

Expected Results:
In Quick Play, the user must not receive a disconnected from host message, and the game must not crash after receiving the message.

NOTE(1): Screenshot of message attached.
NOTE(2): No crash dump was available as the game hard locked.

column7: Menu/GUI - Team Manager: The Player can field 10 players
column8:
Summary:
The Player can field 10 players

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Team Manager Menu, with 10 players unlocked.
2) The Player can field all ten players at the same time.

Expected Results:
The Player must only be able to field 7 players at a time.
column9:
[vDev13 Fun Labs (AMP Dev) -- 10/17/2008 04:43:57 AM]
Some tournament types allows fielding more than 7 players which are then sheffled around in between rounds.
There are at no time more than 7 players in the field.

[Steve Myers (AMP TRG Lead) -- 10/17/2008 09:38:08 AM]
The Player is told they cannot enter a Tournament with more than 7 Players fielded.

[vDev13 Fun Labs (AMP Dev) -- 10/18/2008 12:44:32 PM]
we do not understand what is the issue.
there are tournament formats allowing the player to shuffle players between rounds and these allow to begin the game with 10 players.

[Steve Myers (AMP TRG Lead) -- 10/19/2008 09:03:28 AM]
There are tournaments that allow you to select any of your unlocked teammates inbetween rounds. However, there are no tournaments in the game that allow you to enter with all of your teammates fielded.

[vDev13 Fun Labs (AMP Dev) -- 10/20/2008 06:29:35 AM]
Sure, that's true.
There are not tournamentsin the game that allow you to play with more than 7 players. You do however have the hole team pool to choose from inbetween rounds. The 7 fielded players in the begining define the players that begin the game on the field.
Do you think that we should have a better wording that using "Field" and "Bench" terms?
Thanks.

[Steve Myers (AMP TRG Lead) -- 10/20/2008 08:43:25 AM]
There is nothing wrong with the terminology. The Player must not be allowed to Field more Players than he can ever take into a tournament (seven), as it causes unneccessary navigation to the Team Manager.

column7: Collision Detection - Gameplay: User's Character appears to be able to partially clip into the large cone bunkers.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, if the User's selects a field with at least one Large Cone Bunkers, then moves their character to the side of the bunker while crouched, then while facing the the bunker moves towards it part of the character appears to clip into and see through the Large Cone Bunker.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select Career Mode,
2) Select Tournament Play,
3) Select Tournament 1 - East Coast Invitational,
4) Eliminate all opponents and take flag,
5) Walk next to the Large Cone Bunker,
6) Position character to face the bunker,
7) Place character into a crouching position,
8) Move character towards the bunker,
9) Observe that the User's Character appears to clip into the bunker.

Expected Results:
The User's Character must not clip into the bunkers.

NOTE(1): Screenshots attached,
NOTE(2): Eliminating the opponents and capturing the flag is not necessary, but it does make checking this bug easier.
NOTE(3): Field chosen does not matter so long as it has a Large Cone Bunker.

column7: Occasionally (1%-9%) - Video/Graphic - Multiplayer: The user experienced a rapidly flashing HUD while in Spectator Mode after being eliminated
column8:
Summary:
Occasionally (1%-9%), the user experienced a rapidly flashing HUD while in Spectator Mode after being eliminated.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 Created a Multiplayer, Online, Player Match with default settings,
2) 13 Clients joined User 1's game,
3) Proceeded to Gameplay,
4) Users eliminated each other,
5) At least 1 user observed a rapidly flashing HUD during spectator mode after being eliminated.

Expected Results:
The user must not experience a Flashing HUD in spectator mode after being eliminated during a match.

NOTE(1): Once, the user experienced a Crash while the HUD was flashing during spectator mode after being eliminated.

column5: Tournament 22a - Millennium MAXS CPL European Mast
column7: Text - Tournament 22a - Millennium MAXS CPL European Masters: On the Results Screen following the tournament, the tournament title overlaps a white line near the top of the screen
column8:
Summary:
On the Results Screen following the Millennium MAXS CPL European Masters tournament, the tournament title text slightly overlaps a white line near the top of the screen.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select Career Mode,
2) Choose Play Tournament,
3) Choose Tournament 22a - Millennium MAXS CPL European Masters,
4) Play through the tournament normally,
5) After the tournament ends, look at the final Results Screen,
6) Observe that the tournament title appears to be slightly too high on the screen.

Expected Results:
All elements of the Results Screen must appear properly aligned.

NOTE(1): Screenshot attached.

column7: TCR 095 - Multiplayer: The game enters an unresponsive state for ~20 seconds when the uplink cable has been disconnected for the Client
column8:
Summary:
The game enters an unresponsive state for ~20 seconds when the uplink cable has been disconnected for the Client

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, Player Match or Ranked Match, with the Player as the Client.
2) The Player removes the uplink cable, and the game becomes unresponsive for ~20 seconds before a message appears.

Expected Results:
The game must correctly handle network disconnections and display an appropriate message.

Games must properly detect and handle loss of network connectivity in all areas of the game. This is a violation of TCR 095.

Notes:
1) This is PreCert TCR 095 Issue 2 of 2.

column7: TCR 095 - Multiplayer: The game enters an unresponsive state for ~80 seconds when the uplink cable has been disconnected for the Host
column8:
Summary:
The game enters an unresponsive state for ~80 seconds when the uplink cable has been disconnected for the Host

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, Player Match or Ranked Match, with the Player as the Host.
2) The Player removes the uplink cable, and the game becomes unresponsive for ~80 seconds before a message appears.

Expected Results:
The game must correctly handle network disconnections and display an appropriate message.

Games must properly detect and handle loss of network connectivity in all areas of the game. This is a violation of TCR 095.

Notes:
1) This is PreCert TCR 095 Issue 2 of 2.

column7: TCR 115 - Menu System: The game does not correctly handle Game Invites to idle Players
column8:
Summary:
The game does not correctly handle Game Invites to idle Players

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, with a Xbox LIVE enabled Gamer Profile signed in on an idle Xbox 360 Conttoller, and a hosted Xbox LIVE Player Match.
2) The Host sends a Game Invite to the idle Player.
3) The idle Player accepts the Game Invite, and nothing occurs.

Expected Results:
The game must display a confirmation message accessible by the active Gamer Profile to confirm that the invite can be accepted, and then change the active Gamer Profile to the Idle Gamer Profile, join the Player Match, without carrying over the current game state from the previous active Gamer Profile.

Games must allow players to send game invites for player match game sessions. Games must also allow players to join player match sessions. This is a violation of TCR 115.

Notes:
1) This is PreCert TCR 115 Issue 1 of 2. 
2) This also occurs in Gameplay.

column7: TCR 115 - Front End: The game does not accurately handle accepted Game Invites or Joins from outside of the game
column8:
Summary:
The game does not accurately handle accepted Game Invites or Joins from outside of the game

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Xbox Dashboard, with a Xbox LIVE enabled Gamer Profile signed in and a hosted Xbox LIVE Player Match and the Paintball 2009 disc present.
2) The Host sends a Game Invite to the Player.
3) The Player accepts the Game Invite.
4) The Game begins, and the Player is not moved to the Match Lobby.

Expected Results:
The game must correctly handle invites and move the Player to the Match Lobby.

Games must allow players to send game invites for player match game sessions. Games must also allow players to join player match sessions. This is a violation of TCR 115.

Notes:
1) This is PreCert TCR 115 Issue 2 of 2.

column7: TCR 022 - Menu System: The Xbox Guide Blade cannot be accessed for 4 seconds when entering gameplay before the loading screen appears
column8:
Summary:
The Xbox Guide Blade cannot be accessed for 4 seconds when entering gameplay before the loading screen appears

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu.
2) The Player selects Quick Player.
3) The Quick Play Menu appears.
4) The Player selects any map.
5) The Player quickly presses the Xbox Guide button, and the Xbox Guide Blade cannot be accessed for ~2 seconds to ~4 seconds.

Expected Results:
Games must ensure that system UI can be rendered at least every 66 milliseconds in all areas of the game for any display mode. This is a violation of TCR 022.

Notes:
1) This is PreCert TCR 022 Issue 1 of 1.
2) This occurs for all transitions to the loading screen prior to entering gameplay.

column7: TCR 015 - Gameplay: Idle Gamer Profile sign In or out causes the Active Xbox LIVE Gamer Profile to be returned to the Multiplayer Menu
column8:
Summary:
Idle Gamer Profile sign In or out causes the Active Xbox LIVE Gamer Profile to be returned to the Multiplayer Menu

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, Player Match or Ranked Match, with an Active Xbox LIVE Gamer Profile signed into Xbox LIVE on Controller 1,
2) The Player signs into an Idle Gamer Profile with Controller 2.
3) The Active Xbox LIVE Gamer Profile is returned to the Multiplayer Menu.

Expected Results:
Sign ins and sign outs with idle Gamer Profiles must not affect the active Gamer Profile.

Games must properly detect and handle player profiles signing in or out in all areas of the game. This is a violation of TCR 015.

Notes:
1) This is PreCert TCR 015 Issue 1 of 1.
2) This also occurs for sign outs.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: The User's Character's finger repeatedly moves when holding the RT button.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, any game mode, any level, if the user holds the RT button, the User observes the User's Character's finger repeatedly moves.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the the main Menu, select any game mode,
2) Select any level,
3) Hold down on the RT button,
4) Observe the User's Character's finger repeatedly moves.

Expected Results:
Trigger must appear to be properly pulled.

column7: Options - Movement Options: The Vibration on/off option appears in the Movement Options Menu
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in the Options Menu, under the Movement Options, the Vibration on/off option appears, when it should appear in the Gameplay Options Menu.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select Options.
2) Select Movement.
3) Observe that the Vibration on/off option appears, but has nothing to do with movement.

Expected Results:
The Vibration on/off option must be removed from the Movement Options Menu, and placed in the Gameplay Options Menu.

column7: Video/Graphic - Match Description: Upon disconnecting the active controller the message to reconnect the controller appears corrupted.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, Match Description, if the User has one or more controllers connected to the Xbox 360, then goes to Career Mode, then Tournament Play, then selects any tournament, then proceeds through the screens until reaching the Match Description screen, and then disconnects the active controller the message to reconnect the controller appears corrupted.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Attach one or more controllers to the Xbox 360,
2) Boot the game and set any controller to be the active controller at the initial interactive,
3) From the Main Menu, select Career Mode,
4) Select Tournament Play,
5) Select any tournament,
6) Proceed through the screens that appear until reaching the Match Description screen,
7) Disconnect the active controller,
8) Observe that the message to reconnect the controller appears to be corrupted.

Expected Results:
The message to reconnect the controller must appear properly.

NOTE(1): Screenshot attached.
column9:
[Justin Westplate (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/23/2008 05:44:34 PM]
Verified on the 10/22/08 X360 Build.

column7: Video/Graphic - Field Creator: At the Load Map Screen, the Left Bumper icon appears larger than the Right Bumper, and is off center from the text boundary box
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in Field Creator, on the Load Map Screen, the Left Bumper icon appears larger than the Right Bumper, and is off center from the text boundary box.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select Field Creator.
2) When the Load Map Screen appears, observe the bottom center of the screen; the Left Bumper icon appears larger than the Right Bumper, and is off center from the text boundary box.

Expected Results:
The Left Bumper icon must be scaled down so that it is the same size as the Right Bumper icon, and moved to the left so that the curve on the bumper lines up with the curved line on the boundary area.

NOTE(1): Screenshot attached. New screenshot attached for 10/22 build.
column9:
[Justin Westplate (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/20/2008 08:25:04 AM]
Verified on the 10/17/08 build.

[Justin Westplate (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/23/2008 05:42:47 PM]
Verified on the 10/22/08 X360 Build.

column7: Video/Graphic - Team Manager: The Left Trigger icon appears too close to the edge of the text boundary box
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in the Team Manager Menu, on the left side of the screen, the Left Trigger icon appears too close to the right edge of the text boundary box, and the placement is inconsistent compared to the positioning of the Right Trigger icon on the right side of the screen.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main Menu, select Career Mode.
2) Select Team Manager.
3) When the Team Manager Menu appears, observe that on the left side of the screen, the Left Trigger icon and the "Field" text appears too close to the right edge of the text boundary box, and the placement is inconsistent compared to the positioning of the Right Trigger icon and "Help" text on the right side of the screen.

Expected Results:
The Left Trigger icon and "Field" text must be moved to the right so that the placement is consistent compared to the positioning of the Right Trigger icon and "Help" text that appears on the right side of the screen.

NOTE(1): Screenshot attached.

column7: Gameplay - Career: Opposing team AI always has a set direction of attack
column8:
Summary:
In Career Gameplay, the opposing team AI always uses the same directional attacks of attacking left for Semi-Finals and attacking right for Finals.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, in a Career Semi-final match.
2) The Player observes the AI always attacking from the left.
3) During a Finals match, the AI always is attacking from the right.

Expected Results:
The paths at which the AI attacks should be random as to not create repetition.
column9:
[Justin Westplate (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/23/2008 05:42:47 PM]
Verified on the 10/22/08 X360 Build.

column7: Frequently (60% - 69%) - Gameplay - Gameplay: NPC characters face the wrong direction on the course just before the user's character takes control
column8:
Summary:
Frequently, during gameplay, on any 7 vs. 7 match, if the user's character is eliminated and forced to take control of a crouching NPC player, the NPC will turn around and face the wrong way on the course just before the user takes over.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select Career Mode, Quick Play, or Exhibition,
2) Choose any 7 vs. 7 match,
3) During gameplay, attempt to get eliminated as soon as possible,
4) When the user is about to take control of a crouching NPC player, observe that the NPC turns and faces the wrong direction.

Expected Results:
NPC characters will behave properly at all times.

column7: TCR 006/TCR 095 - Load Game Menu: Loading a game causes a static screen for ~23 seconds after pulling the uplink cable
column8:
Summary:
Loading a game causes a static screen for ~23 seconds after pulling the uplink cable

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Load Game Menu, with a Xbox LIVE enabled Gamer Profile signed in and a Storage Device that contains a saved game.
2) The Player removes the uplink cable.
3) The Player quickly selects any saved game.
4) The Player selects Yes, and a static screen appears for ~23 seconds before the Load Successful message appears.

Expected Results:
Games must not pause without game-representative on-screen graphics. When the pause time is greater than five seconds, the game must indicate the reason and provide on-screen animation. This is a violation of TCR 006.

Notes:
1) The "uplink cable" is the cable that connects the router to the internet, not the "ethernet cable", that connects the Xbox 360 console to the router. 
2) This is PreCert TCR 095 Issue 1 of 2.

column7: TCR 006/TCR 095 - New Game Menu: Selecting Continue causes a static screen for ~41 seconds after pulling the uplink cable
column8:
Summary:
Selecting Continue causes a static screen for ~41 seconds after pulling the uplink cable

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the New Game/Load Game/Continue Menu, with a Xbox LIVE enabled Gamer Profile signed in and a Storage Device that contains a saved game.
2) The Player removes the uplink cable.
2) The Player quickly selects Continue, and a static screen appears for ~41 seconds before the Main Menu appears.

Expected Results:
Games must not pause without game-representative on-screen graphics. When the pause time is greater than five seconds, the game must indicate the reason and provide on-screen animation. This is a violation of TCR 006.

Notes:
1) The "uplink cable" is the cable that connects the router to the internet, not the "ethernet cable", that connects the Xbox 360 console to the router.

column7: Text - Team Manager (Menu System): The text description under any character's Communication bar contains errors
column8:
Summary:
During the Team Manager menu, while any player's Communication bar is highlighted, the phrase "Command reaches __ closest team mates" (the blank spot has a number from 2-6 depending on the character's level) appears. This phrase contains text errors.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select Career Mode,
2) Choose Team Manager,
3) Select any character,
4) Press the [X button] to adjust the character's points,
5) Scroll down to the Communication bar,
6) Observe that the following phrase appears,

"Command reaches __ closest team mates"

Change to:

"Commands reach __ closest teammates"

by adding an "s" on the end of "command," removing the "es" from the end of "reach," and combining the words "team" and "mates" into one word.
column9:
[Justin Westplate (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/23/2008 05:42:47 PM]

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: The user's character does not remove the lid to the Viewloader Dynasty Vlocity while reloading
column8:
Summary:
During Gameplay, with the Viewloader Dynasty Vlocity hopper equipped, if the user's character reloads, the user's character does not remove the lid to the hopper

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User selects any mode of gameplay on the Main Menu, with the Viewloader Dynasty Vlocity hopper equipped
2) Selects any location
3) Proceeds into gameplay
4) User's character fires at least one shot
5) Reloads the hopper
6) The user's character does not remove the lid to the hopper before reloading

Expected Results:
The user's character must reload the Viewloader Dynasty Vlocity properly, removing the lid before reloading the hopper and then replace the lid after reloading

column7: TCR 050 - New Game Menu: The game doesn't use the XUI to handle low storage conditions
column8:
Summary:
The game doesn't use the XUI to handle low storage conditions 

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the New Game/Load Game Menu, with a Gamer Profile signed in and a Storage Device present that is full.
2) The Player selects New Game.
3) The Character Selection Menu appears.
4) The Player selects a character.
5) The Difficulty Selection Menu appears.
6) The Player selects a difficulty.
7) The No Storage Device selected message appears.
8) The Player selects Select Storage Device.
9) The Select a Device Blade appears.
10) The Player selets the full Storage Device, and the Save Game Menu appears.

When selecting a Storage Device to save to, the XUI must properly detect the Low Storage Space condition, and return the expected error using the Blades.

Games must provide an option that allows the player to select any available storage device for saving game data. If no device is selected, the game must notify the player that no game data will be saved. The notification must occur before any potential data loss. This is a violation of TCR 050.

Notes:
1) When loading, the game does not need to detect for Low Storage Space, as the save has already been created.
2) This also occurs when selecting Save from the Main Menu.

column7: Occasionally - Video/Graphic - Multiplayer: One Client was initially unable to see the flag in a Center Flag or Capture The Flag game, all the large flag-indicator arrows appeared inanimate, and the Client's teammate(s) had no Player Names or indicators.
column8:
Summary:
Occasionally, in Multiplayer, one Client was initially unable to see the flag in a Center Flag or Capture The Flag game, all the large flag-indicator arrows appeared inanimate, and the Client's teammate(s) had no Player Names or indicators.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, selected Multiplayer,
2) User 1 (Host) created any game,
3) Users 2-4 joined User 1's game,
4) Users entered gameplay,
5) From each of their respective starting positions, Users navigated their Avatars to the flag located in the middle of the level (Center Flag) or on the opposite side of the field (Capture The Flag),
6) One of the Clients observed no visible flag, the large flag-indicator arrows located at the flag and at each of the bases were not animated, and the User's teammates had no Player Names or indicator arrows.

Expected Results:
The flag must appear for all Users, the large flag-indicator arrows must appear animated for all Users, and Users must be able to see Player Names and indicators above teammates.

NOTE(1): The 1st Client on the Yellow-team side is usually the Client for which this bug occurs.
NOTE(2): When this bug occurs, it only occurs for the beginning round and for that Client only. Also, once the flag is picked up, the Client will then see the flag if it is subsequently dropped.
NOTE(3): This bug occurs with fewer Players, but the frequency is lower.
NOTE(4): This issue occurs in all game modes.
NOTE(5): More easily reproduced at San Diego Field - Woodsball, in a Center Flag match.
NOTE(6): May be related to issue 5568.

column7: TCR 094 - Multiplayer: Voice Chat continues when a Voice Communication Friends Only Gamer Profile is signed in as an idle Gamer Profile
column8:
Summary:
Voice Chat continues when a Voice Communication Friends Only Gamer Profile is signed in as an idle Gamer Profile

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, in a Player Match or Ranked Match, with a Xbox LIVE enabled Gamer Profile signed in as the active Gamer Profile and an idle Xbox LIVE enabled Gamer Profile signed in with their voice communication set to Friends Only.
2) The Player is able to send and recieve voice chat.

Games must only allow communication between friends when the friends-only communication privilege is on. In cases in which multiple players are signed in on one console, games must respect the most restrictive communications settings among all users. This includes situations in which the most restrictive settings are set for a gamer that is "idle" in a session (that is, signed in to the console but not actively participating in the session). This is a violation of TCR 094.

Notes:
1) This occurs for both Player and Ranked Matches. 
2) This is PreCert TCR 094 Issue 1 of 1.
column9:
[Steve Myers (AMP TRG Lead) -- 10/19/2008 02:16:22 PM]
This issue still occurs in the 10.17.08 X360 build. No change.

column7: TCR 093 - Multiplayer: Voice Chat continues when a Voice Communication Blocked Gamer Profile is signed in as an idle Gamer Profile
column8:
Summary:
Voice Chat continues when a Voice Communication Blocked Gamer Profile is signed in as an idle Gamer Profile 

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, in a Player Match or Ranked Match, with a Xbox LIVE enabled Gamer Profile signed in as the active Gamer Profile and an idle Xbox LIVE enabled Gamer Profile signed in with their voice communication set to blocked.
2) The Player is able to send and recieve voice chat.

Games must not transmit text chat, voice chat, or video chat when the communication privilege is turned off. In cases in which multiple players are signed in on one console, games must respect the most restrictive communications settings among all users. This includes situations in which the most restrictive settings are set for a gamer that is "idle" in a session (that is, signed in to the console but not actively participating in the session). This is a violation of TCR 093.

Notes:
1) This occurs for both Player and Ranked Matches. 
2) This is PreCert TCR 093 Issue 1 of 1.
column9:
[Steve Myers (AMP TRG Lead) -- 10/19/2008 02:07:52 PM]
This issue still occurs in the 10.17.08 X360 build. No change.

column7: TCR 119 - Menu System - Multiplayer: There is no Ranked Leaderboard for Ranked Center Flag.

column7: 1st Party Standards - Tournament Bracket: The User is unable to unlock all Gear Store Content.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, Tournament Bracket, if the User's Character plays through all career mode tournaments getting 1st on each tournament played, due to gear being unlocked from specific tournaments in the multi tournaments that become locked the User appears unable to unlock all content for the Gear Store.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Career Mode, select Tournament,
2) Complete all tournaments in 1st place.
3) Observe that due to the the non selected tournament for the multi tournaments becoming locked the User appears unable to unlock all content for the Gear Store.

Expected Results:
User must be able to complete previously locked tournaments upon completing the final tournament.
column9:
[vDev13 Fun Labs (AMP Dev) -- 10/12/2008 06:19:22 PM]
There was never intended to unlock all the gear from the 1st pass thoughout the game. For replayability reasons, if the player wants to get all items in the game he must play career again

[George Batog (AMP Production) -- 10/12/2008 06:30:06 PM]
This is not what we discussed. The final unlock of the double tournaments should have been implemented. This should have been forwarded as WNF because of insufficient time.

[vDev13 Fun Labs (AMP Dev) -- 10/17/2008 07:41:02 PM]
ok

[Steve Myers (AMP TRG Lead) -- 10/19/2008 09:02:08 AM]
We need an unlock list - if the Player cannot get all the Markers to unlock the Achievement, this causes a violation of TCR 073.

[vDev13 Fun Labs (AMP Dev) -- 10/20/2008 06:34:45 AM]
The final unlock of the double tournaments was not the initial design but a last-minute patch.
See FTP folder /Paintball/AMP QA Bug Captures and Dumps/4928 - xls/ for the unlock gear file that has been provided to us.

[Steve Myers (AMP TRG Lead) -- 10/20/2008 08:41:02 AM]
Is file accurate to the current implementation, or is your implementation different?

In any case, unlocked markers (and gear) DO NOT CARRY OVER between careers, and should not.

[vDev13 Fun Labs (AMP Dev) -- 10/20/2008 11:04:22 AM]
The file is for current implementation.
It's the same file we've sent you over a month ago.
Unlocked markers do not carry over, that's true. However, this does not mean that you ca not play with all the markers in the game because you simply have to buy the markers you did not buy in the previous Career. You can even play the Career ten times, each marker you've bought and used over the ten Careers are tracked and recorded as such.

[Steve Myers (AMP TRG Lead) -- 10/20/2008 01:36:58 PM]
Where is this information tracked? In the saved game? In the Gamer Profile?

column7: TCR 061 - Multiplayer: A Player with their Player-created content flag set to Blocked can join games with Custom Maps
column8:
Summary:
A Player with their Player-created content flag set to Blocked can join games with Custom Maps

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Player Match Games List, with a Xbox LIVE enabled Gamer Profile signed in with their Player-created Content flag set to blocked and a hosted, joinable game on a Custom Map.
2) The Player highlights the game.
3) The Player presses the A (Join) button, and the Match Lobby appears.

Expected Results:
When the Player has their player-created content flag set to blocked and they attempt to join a game on a Custom Map, the following message must appear:

"You cannot join the selected game. You cannot view Custom Created content."

Games must not receive any player-created content if the player-created content viewing flag is turned off. This is a violation of TCR 061.

Notes:
1) This PreCert TCR 061 Issue 1 of 1.

column7: Gameplay - Field Creator: The user is able to place more bunkers then what is specified causing the game to crash.
column8:
Summary:
In the Field Creator, if the user places the maximum amount of single bunkers (25), and then highlights a bunker and selects the splitter tool, changing the single bunker into 4 bunkers, and then repeats this to all the single bunkers, they are able to place 100 bunkers onto the field which results in a infinite loading screen when trying to play the map from Exhibition Mode.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu select Field Creator
2) Select any map
3) Delete all the preset bunkers by repeatedly pressing the Square button
4) Place single bunkers down 35 times (Smaller bunkers of the same type make the following steps easier)
5) Use the left stick to navigate to any single bunker
6) Use the directional pad to highlight and change the splitter tool to 4 bunkers instead of 1
7) Move the 4 bunkers with the right stick to a placeable location on the map
8) Navigate to another single bunker with the left stick
9) Repeat steps 6 - 8 until all the single bunkers have been replaced with 4 bunkers
10) Press the Start button
11) Select Store Custom Field
12) Select any Slot
13) Name the map and select Done
14) Select Exit and return back to the Main Menu
15) Select Exhibition 
16) Press the A button to continue with any of the match settings and teams
17) Press 2 to change to Custom maps
18) Select the newly created map
19) The game crashes in an infinite loading screen

Expected Results:
The user must not be able to place more then the designated amount of bunkers on a field.

column7: Frequently - Video/Graphic - Career Mode - Charlotte, North Carolina: Frequently, in the 3v3 match, the friendly AI's marker barrels clip through the bunkers
column8:
Summary:

column7: TCR 085 - Multiplayer Player Match: The Player is unable to submit Player Reviews and view detailed Player stats at the Results screen

Summary:

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: The User's Characters shadow does not disappear if the User is eliminated at the end of the round.

column7: Once - Gameplay - Woodsball - Gold Mine Field: Opponent became stuck picking up center flag, near mine-cart
column8:
Summary:
Once, during a woodsball exhibition, in the Gold Mine Field, the opponent became stuck with the center flag, after the user's character was eliminated with the flag in-between the central barn and the opponent's flag station, near a mine cart.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, user selected Exhibition.
2) Set up a 7 vs. 7, seven round, center-flag exhibition between The Coalition and Dynasty.
3) Selected Gold Mine Field.
4) User's character navigated immediately towards the central barn.
5) Picked Up central flag.
6) Navigated towards opponents flag station .
7) User's character was eliminated close to the the opponent's bunker near a mine-cart, just past the barn.
8) Remainder of user's characters were eliminated.
9) Opponent picks up center flag.
10) Once, user observed that the opponent was stuck and could not return the center flag to the correct location to complete the match.

Expected Results:
Opponent(s) must not get stuck picking up or carrying the center flag.

Note():
Video-documentation available.
