column7: Occasionally - Gameplay - Exhibition - Custom Field - Center Flag Match: Flag becomes stuck inside of a wide cylinder-shaped bunkers out of reach for NPCs.
column8:
Summary:
Occasionally, during gameplay in a Custom Field in a Center Flag Match, when the user's teams flag carrier is eliminated near a wide cylinder-shaped bunker the flag clips inside of the bunker and is out of reach for NPCs.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Created a custom Field with 25 Gravitron bunkers,
2) Entered gameplay in the Custom Field in a Center Flag Match,
3) Moved user's character to the flag
4) Took the flag
5) Moved near a bunch of wide cylinder-shaped bunkers,
6) User's character was eliminated,
7) Observed that the flag clipped into a Gravitron bunker and that the enemy NPC was unable to reach the flag.

Expected Results:
Enemy NPCs must be able to reach the flag and return it to score.

Note(1) 
NPCs seem to have a hard time navigating the field with out the flag clipping into the bunker.

Note(2)
Video available and Picture of the field layout attached.

column7: Frequently - Gameplay - Exhibition - Custom Match - Center Flag Match: Enemy NPCs become stuck on 6ft Tetrahedron bunkers.
column8:
Summary:
Frequently, during gameplay in a custom field with 25 6ft tetrahedron bunkers, if the user's character picks up the flag, moves into a highly bunker populated area, get shot, drops the flag, has the rest of the user's team become eliminated, user observes that the enemy NPC frequently could not retrieve the flag because the NPC was stuck on a bunker.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter the Field Creator,
2) Make a field with all 6ft tetrahedron bunkers,
3) Save the field,
4) Enter the newly created level in an exhibition 7vs7, Center Flag Match, match,
5) After the round begins move the user's character to the flag,
6) Take the flag and move to an area with many bunkers,
7) Become eliminated,
8) Have the rest of the user's team become eliminated,
9) Observe that frequently the enemy NPCs will be stuck on bunkers and unable to return the flag.

Expected Results:
Enemy NPCs must not become stuck on bunkers, and must be able to return the flag.

Note(1) 
Video availible.

Note(2)
Field layout image attached.

column7: Options - Exhibition - Woodsball: The Automatic Fire option does not save properly
column8:
Summary: 
During Exhibition, in any Woodsball, in gameplay, if the user enters the options menu, turns on the Automatic Fire, returns to gameplay and exits out of the game, returns to main menu, saves the profile, resets the console, loads the same profile, enters into a Woodsball match again, the Automatic Fire option is turned off

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter Exhibition, in any Woodsball
2) Press the 2 Button to enter the Pause Menu
3) Select Options
4) Select Gameplay
5) Turn on Automatic Fire
6) Return to gameplay
7) Press and hold the Z Button to confirm Automatic Fire
8) Exit out of the game
9) Return to the main menu and perform a save
10) After saving is completed, reset the Wii system
11) Load from the save
12) Enter into any Woodsball match again
13) Return to the gameplay options
14) Observed that the Automatic Fire is now turned off

Expected Results:
The Automatic Fire must save properly

column7: Frequently - Gameplay - Exhibition - Custom Match - Center Flag Match: Enemy NPCs become stuck on 8ft Tetrahedron bunkers.
column8:
Summary:
Frequently, during gameplay in a custom field with 25 8ft tetrahedron bunkers, if the user's character picks up the flag, moves into a highly bunker populated area, get shot, drops the flag, has the rest of the user's team become eliminated, user observes that the enemy NPC frequently could not retrieve the flag because the NPC was stuck on a bunker.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter the Field Creator,
2) Make a field with all 8ft tetrahedron bunkers,
3) Save the field,
4) Enter the newly created level in an exhibition 7vs7, Center Flag Match, match,
5) After the round begins move the user's character to the flag,
6) Take the flag and move to an area with many bunkers,
7) Become eliminated,
8) Have the rest of the user's team become eliminated,
9) Observe that frequently the enemy NPCs will be stuck on bunkers and unable to return the flag.

Expected Results:
Enemy NPCs must not become stuck on bunkers, and must be able to return the flag.

Note(1) 
Video availible.

Note(2)
Field layout image attached.

column7: Occasionally - Gameplay - Exhibition - Custom Field - Center Flag Match: Flag becomes stuck inside of large cone bunkers out of reach for NPCs.
column8:
Summary:
Occasionally, during gameplay in a Custom Field in a Center Flag Match, when the user's teams flag carrier is eliminated near a large cone bunker the flag clips inside of the bunker and is out of reach for NPCs.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Created a custom Field with many large cone bunkers,
2) Entered gameplay in the Custom Field in a Center Flag Match,
3) Moved user's character to the flag
4) Took the flag
5) Moved near a large cone bunker,
6) User's character was eliminated,
7) Observed that the flag was clipping the large cone bunker and that the Enemy NPC was unable to reach the flag.

Expected Results:
Enemy NPCs must be able to reach the flag and return it to score.

column7: Text - Menu System: The Post-earned text for the Achievement "Woodsball Chief" is incorrectly displayed
column8:
Summary:
The Post-earned text for the Achievement Woodsball Chief is incorrectly displayed.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, with a Gamer Profile signed in that has earned the "Woodsball Chief" Achievement.
2) The Player presses the Xbox Guide button.
3) The Xbox Guide Blade appears.
4) The Player selects the Gamer Profile.
5) The Player selects View Games.
6) The Player selects Paintball 2009.
7) The Player selects the Achievement Woodsball Chief, and the following Post-earned text appears: 

Won at least 50 Woodsball matches over Xbox LIVE

Change to:

Won at least 50 Woodsball Ranked Matches over Xbox LIVE

By changing the text "matches" to the text "Ranked Matches".
column9:
[Steve Myers (AMP TRG Lead) -- 10/24/2008 09:01:15 PM]
This issue still occurs in the 10.22.08 X360 build. The issue has been updated.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: Bunkers appear on the wrong side of the fence on the ending flyby.
column8:
Summary: 
During gameplay, when the camera is outside of the playing field at the end of the match during the ending flyby, the User observes the bunkers appear to be sitting in front of the fence and the fence appears to be in the background instead of the foreground.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) from the Main Menu, enter any Speedball event,
2) Win the event,
3) Observe the bunkers appear to be in the foreground and the fence appears to be in the background on the ending flyby when the camera is out side of the playing area.

Expected Results:
All environmental objects must appear properly.

column7: TCR 070 - Menu System: The Rich Presence for the Menu System is incorrect
column8:
Summary:
The Rich Presence for the Menu System is incorrect

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, with a Xbox LIVE enabled Gamer Profile signed in and a Friend monitoring the Player's Rich Presence.
2) The Player Rich Presence appears as:

"Browsing the menu
Profile menus"

Change to:

"Browsing the menu"

by removing the text "Profile menus".

In active gameplay, games must update presence information. Presence information must accurately reflect the players state. This is a violation of TCR 070.

Notes:
1) This is PreCert TCR 070 Issue 1 of 2.
column9:
[Steve Myers (AMP TRG Lead) -- 10/19/2008 11:29:59 AM]
This issue still occurs in the 10.17.08 X360 build. The issue has been updated.

column7: Video Graphic - Gameplay: The Right Bumper and the Right Trigger, cause the User's character to shoot with the incorrect finger.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, the controls to shoot, the (Right Bumper) causes the User's character to shoot with his bottom finger and the (Right Trigger) causes the User's character to shoot with his top finger.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter any match,
2) Press the (Right Bumper), 
3) Press the (Right Trigger),
4) Observe that the User's character will move the wrong finger to shoot the marker.

Expected Results:
The controls must trigger the correct graphical reaction on the User's character.

NOTE(1): The bumper should function the top finger, and the trigger should function the lower finger.

column7: Once - Crash - Multiplayer Ranked Match: The Player crashed loading into a match
column8:
Summary:
In Multiplayer Ranked Match, the Player crashed upon loading into the match.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Ranked Match Multiplayer Lobby, with a Woodsball game hosted,
2) 3 Clients joined.
3) The host selected Start Game.
4) Upon loading into the game, the Client crashed.

Expected Results:
Clients must not crash loading into Multiplayer Matches.

Notes:
1) The Crash dump is available on the FTP.

column7: Text - Gameplay - Career Mode - Tournament: When the User is signed in as a Guest, no text appears when an opponent is eliminated.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, Career Mode, Tournament with the User signed in with a Guest Profile, when the Guest User eliminates an opponent, no text appears onscreen to indicate that the Guest User has done so.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Sign in as a Guest with Controller 1,
2) Press START on the Press Start screen,
3) Select "Continue Without Saving",
4) Begin a New Game,
5) Select a character on the Character Selection screen,
6) Select any team,
7) Select any difficulty,
8) Select Career Mode,
9) Select Play Tournament,
10) Select any map,
11) Observe that when the Guest User eliminates an opponent, no text appears to indicate that the Guest User has done so.

Expected Results:
The Guest User's name must appear and the Guest User must be informed when an opponent is successfully eliminated.

column7: Text - Gameplay - Career Mode - Tournament: When the User is not signed in to a Gamer Profile and eliminates an opponent, "John Doe" appears onscreen.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, while signed out of a Gamer Profile for Player 1 and signed in to a Gamer Profile with Player 2, when Player 1 eliminates an opponent the text "John Doe" appears on the bottom left of the screen instead of the Player Character's name.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Sign in to a Gamer Profile with Controller 2,
2) With Controller 1 signed out of a Gamer Profile, press START on the Press Start screen,
3) Press the "B" button on the controller,
4) Select "Continue Without Saving",
5) Start a New Game,
6) Select any character from Character Selection (make a mental note of the selected character's name),
7) Select any team,
8) Select any difficulty,
9) Select Career Mode,
10) Select Play Tournament,
11) Select any map,
12) Observe that when an opponent is shot, the text "John Doe eliminated an opponent" appears on the bottom left of the screen instead of the name of the Player Character that was previously selected.

Expected Results:
The text "John Doe" must not appear when the User is signed out of a Gamer Profile and shoots an opponent during gameplay. The name of the selected Player Character should appear.

column7: Technical Check - Gameplay: Xbwatson reports errors for idle Controllers when in Xbox LIVE Gameplay
column8:
Summary:
Xbwatson reports errors for idle Controllers when in Xbox LIVE Gameplay

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, Ranked Match or Player Match, with XbWatson Montoring the Xbox 360 console and the Player using Controller 1.
2) The following text appears in the XbWatson output:

"WRN[XGI]: Non-signed-in index passed to XUserGetANID. (dwUserIndex=1
WRN[XGI]: Non-signed-in index passed to XUserGetANID. (dwUserIndex=2
WRN[XGI]: Non-signed-in index passed to XUserGetANID. (dwUserIndex=3
"

Expected Results:
The game must not pass indexes to non-signed in Users.

Notes:
1) This also occurs in career mode.

column7: Technical Check - Multiplayer: Xbwatson reports a Rich Presence error when the Host exits the Match Lobby
column8:
Summary:
Xbwatson reports a Rich Presence error when the Host exits the Match Lobby

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Match Lobby, Ranked Match or Player Match, with XbWatson monitoring the Xbox 360 console.
2) The Player presses the B (Back) button.
3) The Player selects Yes, and XbWatson reports the following error:

"WARNING: XSessionDelete called for a presence enabled session
(XSESSION_CREATE_USES_PRESENCE) that was never started. Please ensure that
XSessionStart and XSessionEnd are always called on a presence enabled session
when a Live multiplayer game takes place to ensure accurate reporting of
multiplayer usage data."

Expected Results:
The game must not call XSessionDelete() before a call to XSESSION_CREATE_USES_PRESENCE().

column7: Once - Crash - Multiplayer: The game crashed when the Host disconnected their Xbox 360 Controller after disconnected their ethernet cable
column8:
Summary:
The game crashed when the Host disconnected their Xbox 360 Controller after disconnected their ethernet cable

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, Player Match, with the Player as the host.
2) The Player removed their ethernet cable.
3) The "Disconnected from Xbox LIVE" message appeared.
4) The Player disconnceted their Xbox 360 Controller.
5) The Player reconnected their Xbox 360 Controller.
6) The Player selects Ok.
7) A Loading Screen appeared.
8) The "No clients left, returning to menus" message appeared.
9) The Player selected OK, and the game become unresponsive to any Controller input.

Expected Results:
The game must not crash after a Player disconnects their Xbox 360 Controller.

column7: Gameplay - Woodsball - Train Field (Center Flag) - Flag can become stuck when dropped at the large building near the flag spawn point.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, Woodsball map type, in Train Field (Center Flag), the flag becomes stuck after a player retrieves the flag, proceeds towards the building near the flag spawn point, positions on the wall facing the AI's spawn point, and gets eliminated while positioned against the wall.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter gameplay, Exhibition.
2) Change game type to Woodsball, Center Flag.
3) Select Train Field.
4) Capture the center flag.
5) Proceed to the building near the flag spawn point.
6) Position User's Character on the wall facing the AI's spawn point.
7) Allow User's Character to become eliminated.
8) Observe that the flag drops inside object.

Expected Results:
The flag must be retrievable at all times.

column7: Gameplay - Woodsball - Gold Mine Field (Center Flag) - Flag can become stuck when dropped at the large tree near friendly spawn point.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, Woodsball map type, in Gold Mine Field (Center Flag), the flag becomes stuck after a player retrieves the flag, proceeds towards the large tree left of the friendly spawn point, and then gets eliminated while positioned against the side closest to the friendly spawn point.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter gameplay, Exhibition.
2) Change game type to Woodsball, Center Flag.
3) Select Gold Mine Field.
4) Capture the center flag.
5) Proceed to the largest tree positioned near the edge of the field, directly left from the friendly spawn point.
6) Position User's Character on the side closest to the friendly spawn point.
7) Allow User's Character to become eliminated.
8) Observe that the flag drops inside object.

Expected Results:
The flag must be retrievable at all times.

Note(1):Video attached showing location of tree. 
Note(2): Bug occurs within the map at other locations with the same tree model.

column7: Once - Crash - Multiplayer Player Match Lobby: The Player disconnected the Controller and the game hard crashed
column8:
Summary:
Once, in the Multiplayer Player Match lobby, the Player disconnected the Controller, and the game hard crashed.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Multiplayer Main Menu, with an Player Match created.
2) The Client selected Join Game.
3) The Client entered the Player Match Lobby.
4) The Player disconnected the Controller.
5) A hard crash occurred.

Expected Results:
The game must properly handle Controller disconnects.

column7: Crash - Multiplayer: When exiting a match after the Controller was initially disconnected upon entering gameplay
column8:
Summary:
In Multiplayer, when the Client exits a match after initially entering gameplay with a disconnected Controller, the game will hard crash on the Multiplayer Menu.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Multiplayer Lobby, any mode,
2) Clients join.
3) A Client disconnects the Controller.
4) The Host starts the match.
5) Gameplay begins.
6) The Client reconnects the Controller during gameplay.
7) The Host presses START (pause) button.
8) The Host selects Quit Match.
9) The Client recieves the Host Disconnected message.
10) The Client is returned to the Multiplayer Menu crashed with a hard lock.

Expected Results:
Players must not crash when controller disconnects have occurred.

Notes:
1) This occurs in all Multiplayer Game Types: System Link, Ranked Match, Player Match.

column7: Gameplay - Woodsball - San Diego Field(Center Flag) - Flag can become stuck when dropped near the middle oil platform.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, Woodsball map type, in San Diego Field (Center Flag), the flag becomes stuck after a player retrieves the flag, proceeds towards the middle oil platform near the flag spawn point, and then gets eliminated while positioned against the oil platform.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter gameplay, Exhibition.
2) Change game type to Woodsball, Center Flag.
3) Select San Diego Field.
4) Capture the center flag.
5) Position User's Character against the middle oil platform nearby.
6) Allow User's Character to become eliminated.
7) Observe that the flag drops inside object.

Expected Results:
The flag must be retrievable at all times.

column7: Gameplay - Woodsball - Tippmann Field (Center Flag) - Flag can become stuck when dropped near the set of three wooden spools.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, Woodsball map type, in Tippmann Field (Center Flag), the flag becomes stuck after a player retrieves the flag, proceeds towards the set of three wooden spools and then gets eliminated while positioned between the spools.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter gameplay, Exhibition.
2) Change game type to Woodsball, Center Flag.
3) Select Tippmann Field.
4) Capture the center flag.
5) Proceed out of the flag building to the right.
6) Proceed up to the set of three wooden spools.
7) Position User's Character in between two of them.
8) Allow User's Character to become eliminated.
9) Observe that the flag drops inside object.

Expected Results:
The flag must be retrievable at all times.

Note:
Video attached showing location and occurrence of opponent unable to retrieve flag.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: In game GUI appears vertically stretched in 4:3 video resolution
column8:
Summary:
In 4:3 video resolution, the in game GUI appears vertically stretched.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, with the Xbox 360 console Video Resolution set to 4:3,.
2) The GUI appears vertically stretched.

Expected Results:
In game GUI must appear properly for all video resolutions.

column7: Menu/GUI - Multiplayer Player Match Lobby: Invite Menu is incorrectly implemented
column8:
Summary:
In the Multiplayer Player Match Lobby, the Invite Menu is incorrectly implemented.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From The Multiplayer Player Match Lobby,
2) The following navigational prompt appears:

"[Y button Graphic] Invite"

Expected Results:
Remove this prompt and its functionality.

Notes:
1) Invites can be done through the Xbox Guide Blade, the current implementation does not work and must be removed.
column9:
[John Hart (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/18/2008 02:43:32 AM]
Verified open on the 10/17 build. Issue occurs with the same steps.

column7: TCR 006 - Multiplayer: A ~3 second black screen appears after dismissing the "Disconnected from Xbox LIVE" error
column8:
Summary:
~3 second black screen appears after dismissing the "Disconnected from Xbox LIVE" error

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, Player Match or Ranked Match.
2) The Player pulls the network cable from their Xbox 360 console.
3) The "Disconnected from Xbox LIVE" message appears.
4) The Player selects Ok, and the a ~3 second black screen appears.

Expected Results:
Games must not pause without game-representative on-screen graphics. When the pause time is greater than five seconds, the game must indicate the reason and provide on-screen animation. This is a violation of TCR 006.

column7: TCR 006 - Multiplayer: Users observe a static screen that varies in length (dependant on the number of games hosted) after pressing "Y" to Refresh the Games List.
column8:
Summary: 
Users observe a static screen that varies in length (dependant on the number of games hosted) after pressing "Y" to Refresh the Games List.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Users 1-4 each host a default Capture the Flag - Player Match.
2) User 5 selects Multiplayer.
3) User 5 selects Xbox LIVE
4) User 5 selects Player Match.
5) User 5 selects Join Game.
6) User 5 presses "A" on the Join Game screen.
7) The Games List appears.
8) User 5 presses the Y (Refresh) button, and a ~8 second static screen before the games list appears.

Expected Results:
The screen must not be static.

Games must not pause without game-representative on-screen graphics. When the pause time is greater than five seconds, the game must indicate the reason and provide on-screen animation. This is a violation of TCR 006.

column7: Technical Check - Multiplayer: Games that are not full, do not disappear from the Games list, after entering gameplay.
column8:
Summary:
Games that are not full, do not disappear from the Games list, after entering gameplay. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates default player match game.
2) User 2 joins User 1's game.
3) Users progress to gameplay.
4) From the main menu, User 3 selects multiplayer.
5) User 3 selects Xbox LIVE.
6) User 3 selects Player Match.
7) User 3 selects Join Game.
8) User 3 presses the A button to Search, with default filters.
9) User 3 observes User 1's game appear on the games list until the observed game is terminated in any way.

Expected Results:
Games must no longer appear on the games list after they have entered gameplay. 

Notes:
1) This game remains on the Games List for at least 5 minutes after entering gameplay, it only disappeared when the game was completed.

column7: Collision Detection - Gameplay: The user's character clips into the snake bunkers
column8:
Summary:
During Gameplay, if the user's character jumps on top of the snake bunkers, goes into prone stance, crouches or stands from the prone stance, the user's character clips into the snake bunker

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User selects any mode of gameplay
2) Proceeds into any level with snake bunkers
3) User's character enters prone stance
4) Crouches or stands from prone stance
5) The user's character clips into the snake bunker and frequently becomes stuck inside the snake bunker

Expected Results:
The user's character must not clip into the snake bunkers

Note: The user's character is able to get out of the bunker by entering prone stance and crawling off the bunker\
Note: Video capture is available

column7: Gameplay - Exhibition - Woodsball - Train Depot Field (Center Flag): Opponents are unable to retrieve the flag nearby trains
column8:
Summary: 
During Exhibition, in Woodsball - Train Depot Field (Center Flag), if the user captures the center flag and gets eliminated nearby a train, the flag drops/clips inside the train and the opponents are unable to retrieve the flag

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter Exhibition
2) Select the Center Flag gametype
3) Select and enter Woodsball, in Train Depot Field
4) Capture the center flag
5) Get eliminated next to a train
6) The flag drops/ or clips inside the nearby train
7) Continue gameplay and lose all of the user's teammates
8) Observe that the opponents cannot retrieve the flag

Expected Results:
Opponent's must be able to capture the flag

NOTES(1): Video is available; (Part 1: User grabs the flag and gets eliminated near a train; Part 2: The opponents eliminate the user's team and cannot retrieve the flag)

column7: Occasionally - Gameplay - Dynasty Training Drills: The user completes the objective to dive into a snake bunker without sliding behind the bunker
column8:
Summary:
Occasionally, during Dynasty Training Drills, in Fitness Drills, in Stage 2, if the user's character dives but does not reach the snake bunker, the bunker is still counted as completed

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User selects Dynasty Training Drills on the Main Menu
2) Progresses to the Fitness Drills
3) Proceeds into Stage 2 of the Fitness Drills
4) Dives towards the designated snake bunker
5) Immediately dives towards the next bunker, but does not reach it
6) Occasionally, the user's character still completes the bunker

Expected Results:
The objectives for each stage must not be completed until the user's character does the proper actions

column7: Text - Exhibition - Woodsball - Match Summary: Additional scorings for 7v7 Center Flag match must be removed
column8:
Summary: 
During Exhibition, in any Woodsball (Center Flag; 7v7 match), additional scorings must be removed

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter Exhibition
2) Select Center Flag as the gametype
3) Select the 7v7 player match
4) Press the 2 Button to select Woodsball
5) Enter to the Match Summary Screen
6) The following texts appear:

"Scoring:
Round win: 1 point

7 Points for each elimination,
3 points for each survivor"

Change to:

"Scoring:
Round win: 1 point"

By removing the points for elimination and survivor

NOTES(1): The scoring for elimination and survivor must also be removed for any 3v3 and 5v5 Center Flag Matches in all Speedball and Woodsball level

column7: Technical Check - Multiplayer: When the user signs back into Xbox Live before loading back to the Press Start screen, the user signs in, then is stuck signing back out.
column8:
Summary:
When the user signs out of Xbox LIVE from within multiplayer gameplay, when the user signs back in before loading out to the Press start screen, the user signs in and then is stuck signing out.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) The host creates a default multiplayer match
2) A client joins the match
3) Gameplay begins
4) Either user signs out of Xbox LIVE
5) The user signs back into Xbox LIVE before returning to the Press Start screen
6) The user signs back in and then is stuck signing out on the Xbox Guide Blade

Expected Results:
The user must be signed back into Xbox LIVE when selecting to do so.

Note: 
1) The user is able to close the Blade, and then attempt to sign in again.
2) This also occurs in the Menu System, but with a lower frequency.

column7: Twice - Gameplay - Exhibition: In a custom map, oppponent did not pick up & return flag
column8:
Summary:
Twice, while playing in a 7 vs. 7, seven round, capture the flag exhibition in a custom Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania map and a custom Malaga, Spain map, the opponent failed to pick up and return the flag after the user's character was eliminated. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From Main menu user selected Exhibtion.
2) Set up a 7vs. 7, 7 round, capture the flag exhibition with the default teams.
3) Selected a previously created custom map in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
4) Gameplay initiated.
5) Won 3 matches and lost 1.
6) User's character was fully eliminated during the 5th round.
7) Twice, Observed that the opponent did not grab and return the flag resulting in the user being unable to complete stage.

Expected Results:
During capture the Flag and Center Flag matches, after the user's character has been eliminated, the enemy must return the flag to the correct location.

Note(1):
Screen-shot of custom map attached.

Note(2):
Video-documentation available.

Note(3) :
In both instances of the issue, many 8ft tetrahedron bunkers were placed in the custom map.

column7: Gameplay - Exhibition (Custom Map): AI characters do not react properly to a bunker layout
column8:
Summary:
With a Custom Map created that has numerous bunkers lined up across the 20 yard line, the AI characters (friendly and enemy alike) that are assigned to grab or hang the flag cease to move to the flag or flag station to finish the match. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu select Field Creator
2) Select any Pre-Made field
3) Proceed to delete all of the existing bunkers on the field by holding the B Button and pressing the A Button repeatedly
4) Selects a bunker to block the flag station (snake bunker works 100%)
5) Proceed to place the bunkers in a line that runs parallel to the ends of the field (there should be 5 bunkers placed on each of the team's sides of the field (there should be a 'wall of bunkers' created that forces the players to use the 'safe corridor'. See the attached topdown screenshot for reference.)
6) Proceed to save and exit the Field Creator
7) Return to the Main Menu and select Exhibition
8) With 7v7 Capture the Flag (or Center Flag) settings selected, continue to the field selection
9) Press the 2 (Custom) Button
10) Select the recently saved Custom Map
11) Press the A Button to Continue into the match
12) Allow the user's team to be eliminated
13) Observe that the opponent (or the user's character's team in the opposite scenario) gets stuck along the bunkers and will never retrieve the flag.

Expected Results:
All NPCs must react properly to game events.

Note: Video capture available.

Note: Multiple screenshots of bunker setup attached.

column7: Crash - Multiplayer - When the host of a match is connected to a WAN router, multiple clients crash loading into gameplay.
column8:
Summary:
When loading into multiplayer gameplay with 14 players when the host is connected to a WAN router, multiple clients crash on the loading screen.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) The host creates a default multiplayer match while connected to a WAN router
2) 13 clients joins the game lobby and "Ready up"
3) The host presses A to start the match and the loading screen appears
4) Multiple clients crash loading into gameplay.

Expected Results:
The game must not crash when loading into multiplayer gameplay when the host is connected to a router.

column7: Crash - Multiplayer - When the host disconnects during the game lobby countdown, multiple clients crash on the loading screen into gameplay.
column8:
Summary:
When the host disconnects during the game lobby countdown, multiple clients crash on the loading screen into multiplayer gameplay with 14 players.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) The host creates a default multiplayer match
2) 13 clients join the game lobby and "ready up"
3) The host presses the A button to start the match
4) Disconnects in any manner (power down, sign out, network cable, or WAN) as soon as the countdown appears
5) When the loading screen appear, multiple clients crash.

Expected Results:
The game must not crash when the host disconnects from the game lobby during the countdown to gameplay.

Note: This occurs when the host disconnects on the loading screen or on the Waiting for Players screen before gameplay as well.

column7: Occasionally - Technical Check - Multiplayer - The client receives the "Could not join game" message when loading into a game lobby.
column8:
Summary:
Occasionally, when loading into a default multiplayer game lobby with 13 clients (one by one or simultaneously), one client will receive the "Could not join game" message.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) The host creates a default multiplayer match
2) 13 clients join the game lobby
3) Occasionally, one client will receive the "Could not join game" message.

Expected Results:
The user must always be able to join a game lobby that is not full.

Note: This occurs more frequently when the host is on a throttled internet connection.

column7: Frequently (50%-59%) - Technical Check - Multiplayer: Lobby team lists do not update correctly when 13 users simultaneously join a ranked match.
column8:
Summary: Lobby team lists do not update correctly when 13 users simultaneously join a ranked match.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates a default ranked match.
2) Users 2-14 simultaneously join User 1's match.
3) At least 1 client observes Users missing from the Yellow team list.

Expected Results: Teams must update correctly.

NOTE(1): This also occurs without simultaneous joins, just not as frequently.
NOTE(2): This also occurs in System Link.

column7: Occasionally (40%-49%) - Technical Check - Multiplayer: Lobby team lists do not update correctly when 13 users simultaneously join a match hosted by a user with a connection that has two percent packet loss.
column8:
Summary: Lobby team lists do not update correctly when 13 users simultaneously join a match hosted by a user with a connection that has two percent packet loss.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates a default player match, with two percent packet loss.
2) Users 2-14 simultaneously join User 1's match.
3) At least 1 client observes Users missing from the Yellow team list.

Expected Results: Teams must update correctly.

NOTE(1): This also occurs without simultaneous joins, just not as frequently.
NOTE(2): This also occurs in Ranked matches.

column7: TCR 096 - Multiplayer: Xbox LIVE player match gameplay does not function when the host has an internet connection with limited bandwidth of 64kbps/64kbps.
column8:
Summary: When the host of an Xbox LIVE multiplayer player match has an internet connection with limited bandwidth at 64kbps/64kbps, Xbox LIVE gameplay does not function.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) With an internet connection limited to 64kbps/64kbps, user 1 creates a default Xbox LIVE player match.
2) User 2 attempts to join user 1's game.
3) User 2 observes when user 1 attempts to start the game, they are disconnected from the game.

Expected Results: The title must support Xbox LIVE gameplay when the host has an internet connection with limited bandwidth of 64kbps/64kbps.

Peer-to-peer gameplay between two different Xbox consoles must not be disconnected as long as the following performance conditions are maintained:
 Each console has an upstream and downstream bandwidth of 64 kilobits/sec (64,000 bits/sec) or higher.
 200 ms or less round-trip latency between consoles.
 Ten percent or less packet loss in a ten-second interval.
 Two percent or less packet loss, in general.

This is a violation of TCR 096.

Note: 
1) If multiple clients attempt to join the host's game lobby, they will be disconnected from the lobby.
2) This is PreCert TCR 096 Issue 1 of 1.

column7: Technical Check - Multiplayer: Lobby team lists do not update correctly when 13 users simultaneously join a match hosted by a user with a connection that has ten percent or less packet loss in a ten second interval.
column8:
Summary: Lobby team lists do not update correctly when 13 users simultaneously join a match hosted by a user with a connection that has ten percent or less packet loss in a ten second interval.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates a default player match, with ten percent or less packet loss in a ten second interval.
2) Users 2-14 simultaneously join User 1's match.
3) At least 1 client observes Users missing from the Yellow team list.

Expected Results: Teams must update correctly.

NOTE(1): This also occurs without simultaneous joins, just not as frequently.
NOTE(2): This also occurs in Ranked matches.

column7: Once - Crash - Multiplayer - When the host was a on throttled connection, a client crashed loading into gameplay.
column8:
Summary:
Once, when the host was on a throttled connection running at 200ms or less round trip latency between consoles, when 13 clients joined the game lobby and the host started the match, a client crashed on the pre-game fly by camera.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) The host creates a default multiplayer match while running on a connection at 200ms or less round trip latency between consoles
2) 13 clients join the game lobby and "ready up"
3) The host starts the game
4) On the pre-game fly by camera one client crashed

Expected Results:
The game must not crash loading into gameplay when the host is running on a throttled connection.

Note: Watson Crash dump attached.

column7: Technical Check - Multiplayer: Lobby team lists do not update correctly when 13 users simultaneously join a match hosted by a user with 200 ms or less round trip latency between consoles.
column8:
Summary: Lobby team lists do not update correctly when 13 users simultaneously join a match hosted by a user with 200 ms or less round trip latency between consoles. The red team fills up all 7 slots, while the yellow team appears to have 0-1 users on the team.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates a default player match, using 200 ms or less round trip latency.
2) Users 2-14 simultaneously join User 1's match.
3) Users observe the Yellow team does not update correctly, and displays either 0 users, or 1 user on the team.

Expected Results: Teams must update correctly.

NOTE(1): This also occurs without simultaneous joins, just not as frequently.
NOTE(2): Occasionally the teams are only missing a few users.
NOTE(3): This also occurs in Ranked matches.

column7: Crash - Multiplayer: User crashes after accepting an invite during multiplayer gameplay and joining the new lobby, and then the host backs out of the lobby.
column8:
Summary: User crashes after accepting an invite during multiplayer gameplay and joining the new lobby, and then the host backs out of the lobby. The client crashes on a black screen after pressing "A" on the disconnection message.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates a default Player Match.
2) User 2 creates a default Player Match.
3) User 2 presses "LB" to add a bot to the game.
4) User 2 presses "A" to begin the game.
5) User 2 begins gameplay.
6) User 1 presses "Y" to open the Invite menu.
7) User 1 presses "A" while highlighting User 2's name to invite.
8) User 2 accepts the invite.
9) User 2 enters User 1's game lobby.
10) User 1 manually backs out of the lobby.
11) User 2 observes a disconnection message, and presses "A".
12) User 2 observes a crash on a black screen.

Expected Results: Users must not crash.

column7: Technical Check - Multiplayer: Users are returned to the multiplayer menu after accepting any game invites while in a multiplayer game lobby.
column8:
Summary: Users are returned to the multiplayer menu after accepting any game invites while in a multiplayer game lobby.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates a default player match.
2) User 2 joins User 1's match.
3) User 3 creates a default player match.
4) User 3 presses "Y" to open the invite menu.
5) User 3 highlights User 2's gamertag and presses "A" to invite.
6) User 2 accepts User 3's invite.
7) User 2 is brought back to the multiplayer menu.

Expected Results: Multiplayer invites must function correctly.

column7: Gameplay - Multiplayer: The default marker hand option does not function correctly in multiplayer. All users default marker hand is based off of the host's choice.
column8:

2) User 1 selects movement.
3) User 1 changes the default marker hand to "left."
4) User 1 creates a default multiplayer match.
5) User 2 joins User 1's match.
6) Users begin gameplay.
7) User 2 observes their marker is placed in the left hand.

Expected Results: Default marker hand must function correctly.

column7: Crash - Multiplayer: When the Host leaves a multiplayer match before the Client, the Client is returned to the main menu and crashes.

5) User 1 selects Player Match.

11) User 2 observes User 1's game is on the list.

Expected Results: Menu flow must not interfere with multiplayer match creation
.
NOTE(1): The game also appears on the System Link Games List.
column9: [Kyle Kleven (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/10/2008 03:54:42 AM]

column7: TCR 006 - Multiplayer: Users observe a static screen that varies in length (dependant on the number of games hosted) after pressing "A" on the Join Game screen.
column8:
Summary: Users observe a static screen that varies in length (dependant on the number of games hosted) after pressing "A" on the Join Game screen. The screen is static for about 2 seconds per game that is hosted. With 4 games hosted on the list, the static screen lasts about 8 seconds.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Users 1-4 each host a default Capture the Flag - Player Match.
2) User 5 selects Multiplayer.
3) User 5 selects Xbox LIVE
4) User 5 selects Player Match.
5) User 5 selects Join Game.
6) User 5 presses "A" on the Join Game screen.
7) User 5 observes an eight second static screen before the games list appears.

Expected Results:
The screen must not be static.

Games must not pause without game-representative on-screen graphics. When the pause time is greater than five seconds, the game must indicate the reason and provide on-screen animation. This is a violation of TCR 006.

column7: Crash - Multiplayer System Link: Disconnecting the Ethernet cable from the back of the Xbox 360 console during the loading screen
column8:
Summary:
In Multiplayer System Link, disconnecting the Ethernet cable from the back of the Xbox 360 console during the loading screen into gameplay causes the game to hard crash.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Multiplayer Menu, with an Ethernet cable connected to the back of the Xbox 360 console.0
2) The Player selects System Link.
3) The Player creates a Game.
4) The Match Lobby appears.
5) The Player presses RB (add bot) button. to add a bot.
6) The Player presses A (start game) button.
7) The loading screen appears, and the Player disconnects the Ethernet cable from the back of the Xbox 360 console.
8) The game hard locks and is unrecoverable.

Expected Results:
The game must properly handle network disconnects.

column7: Once - Crash - Team Manager: Game crashed when scrolling through the list of team mates.
column8:
Summary:
Once, during gameplay, at the Team Manager screen (in-game), User completing the Pacific Shootout Challenge tournament and unlocked a new team mate, User proceeded to the 2v2 XPSL NorCal tournament and was brought to the Team Manager screen. User scrolled through the list, and selected 5 team mates, then scrolled through the list and the game crashed to a black screen with looping audio.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Entered gameplay, Career Mode, Pacific Shootout Challenge.
2) Completed the event.
3) User unlocked a new team mate.
4) User proceeded to the next event.
5) User was brought to the Team Manager screen to recruit more team mates.
6) User selected 5 additional team mates.
7) User scrolled through the list of team mates towards the second slot.
8) Observed that game crashed to a black screen with looping audio while highlighting team mates.

Expected Results:
Game must not crash when selecting team mates.

column7: Gameplay - Gameplay: Pausing the game when the Cheat Meter is on screen and returning to gameplay causes the User to fail the cheat.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, in any game utilizing the 3 for 1 cheat meter penalty, if the User's Character is hit, the User Pauses the game while the meter is in the yellow/red section of the meter, and selects Resume, the User is returned to gameplay and instantly fails the cheat.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter into any game utilizing the 1,2 or 3 for 1 cheat penalty,
2) Get hit,
3) While the meter is in the yellow/red, Pause the game,
4) Select Resume using the A (continue) Button,
5) Observe that the User instantly fails the cheat.

Expected Results:
Button confirmation from the Pause Menu must not effect the button confirmation required by the Cheat Meter.

NOTE(1): This only occurs if the User presses the A Button to return to gameplay from the Pause Menu.
NOTE(2): This only occurs with the 1,2 or 3 for 1 style Cheat Meter (noted in the attached screenshot).

column7: Frequently - TCR 088 - Multiplayer Player Match Games List: Gamertags are incorrectly displayed
column8:
Summary:
Frequently, In Multiplayer Player Match Games List, Gamertags do not display correctly.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Player Match Menu, with a joinable Player Match game hosted.
2) The Client selects Join Game.
3) The Player Match Filters Menu appears.
4) The Player presses the A (Search) button with the filters set to the hosted game.
5) The Games List appears, and hosted games Game Name appears as "SV_Paintball".

Expected Results:
Gamertags must be displayed properly.

Games must correctly display all 15 characters of any gamertag. Gamertags consist of ASCII characters a-z, A-Z, 0-9, (, ), and " " (ASCII character 0×20). This is a violation of TCR 088.

"Custom created"

The Map Name must correctly appear as the map the Host selected.

column7: Occasionally - Gameplay: The opposing AI did not return the flag in a center flag match.
column8:
Summary:
Occasionally, during Center Flag gameplay, when the user's character grabbed the flag and moved directly in front of their home flag station and then the user's character and all of their team was eliminated, the opposing AI player grabbed the flag that was directly in front of the flag station and remained still not hanging it.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Entered a Center Flag match
2) The user's character gained possession of the flag
3) The user's character moved directly in front of the user's home flag station
4) The user's teammates were eliminated
5) The user's character was eliminated
6) An AI player grabbed the flag that laid directly in front of the flag station
7) The AI player remained still with the flag, and never hung it

Expected Results:
The AI players must hang the flag after gaining possession of it.

Note(1): This bug has occured in Career Mode, Exhibition Mode, and Quick Play Center Flag matches.
Note(2): In 10-8-08 build, occurred twice in Woodsball, Train Depot Field, but opponents did not retrieve the flag and remained idle.

column7: Gameplay - Gameplay: Completing a tournament that had been already finished does not appear to award the appropriate amount of credits.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, if the User's Character replays a finished tournament, they do not appear to be awarded the full amount of credits.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter Career Mode, then select Tournament,
2) Select any tournament,
3) Complete the tournament,
4) Replay and complete the finished tournament,
5) Observe the User appears to earn 0 credits instead of what was stated to have been earned.

Expected Results:
User must be able to replay tournaments to earn credits.

NOTE(1): Previously played tournament games appear to not award the User with any of the credits that it informs the User they have earned.
NOTE(2): As of the 10/22/08 build, if the user gets 2nd place in a tournament and then replays the tournament and earns 1st place, he will gain the full amount of 1st place credits. If, however, the user gets 1st place in a tournament and then replays the tournament and receives 1st place a second time, he will get no extra credits.

This design encourages users to purposefully finish all tournaments in 2nd place, and then go back and finish them all again in 1st place for extra credits.

If the user is given 2nd place in a tournament and he replays it again and gets 1st, he should only be given the credits he did not earn the first time around - OR - the user should be allowed to earn the full amount of credits per place every time he plays through, allowing him to accrue unlimited credits.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: The framerate drops when the User spams the triggers at the beginning of the level.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, any game mode, any level, the User observe the framerate drops to less than 30 frames per second if the User spams the triggers at the beginning of the match.

2) Select any level,
3) From the initial match start spam the triggers firing a volley into the other team,
4) Observe the framerate drops to less than 30 frames per second.

Expected Results:
The framerate must not drop below 30 frames per second.

column7: Options - Autosave appears set to ON when it is actually OFF.
column8:
Summary:
In the Options menu, if the autosave option was turned off at any save point, it continues to appear set to ON.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Boot the game with the Wii system memory full of i-nodes, FS blocks or both
2) Proceed to the main menu after selecting 'Continue without saving' at the save point
3) Proceed to the Options - Gameplay menu and observe that the Autosave option is set to ON
4) Return to the main menu and select Dynasty Training Drills
5) Complete a drill and select 'Quit Training'
6) Select 'Yes' on the message, "Are you sure you wan to quit?"
7) Select 'No' on the message, "Do you want to save your progress?"
8) Select 'Yes' on the message, "Do you want to turn Autosave off?"
9) Return to the main menu and proceed to the Options - Gameplay menu
10) Observe that the Autosave option still appears set to ON.

Expected Results:
The Autosave option must appear set to OFF when it is changed to OFF at a save point.

Note: The Autosave option continues to function properly even though the option appears incorrectly.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: The 3-2-1-GO prompt interferes with the sight of the User.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, if the User starts any match in any level, the User observes the 3-2-1-GO prompt appears to obstruct the view of the User as it is set right in the center of the Users aiming reticle.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the main menu, select any game mode,
2) Select any level,
3) At the start of the match, observe the 3-2-1-GO prompt obstructs the User's view.

Expected Results:
The 3-2-1-GO prompt must not obstruct the User's view.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: Switching the Marker from the right to the left hand causes the paintballs to appear to be coming out of the side of the barrel.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: Switching the Marker from the right to the left hand causes the animation to twitch and stutter.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, if the user switches hands, holding the paintball marker in the left hand the animation appears to twitch and stutter. 

Steps to Reproduce:

column7: Video/graphic - Gameplay: Lean and Snap appear too animate too slowly into the new position.

2) Lean or Snap,

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: During any Woodsball match, the framerate is low
column8:

2) Select any kind of Woodsball game with any amount of players,
3) Enter any Woodsball location,
4) During gameplay, attempt to turn to the left or right,
5) Observe that the camera movement is choppy.

Expected Results: 
Gameplay must function smoothly in all locations.

NOTE(1): As of the 10/17/08 build, this issue has become much worse with 14 players in Train Depot Field.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: The LS (Left Stick) and RS (Right Stick) prompts are not legible on a 4:3 standard definition monitor.

4) Observe when using a 4:3 standard definition monitor, the LS (Left Stick) and RS (Right Stick) prompts are not legible.

All prompts must be legible during gameplay.

NOTES:

column7: Once - Crash - Exhibition: The game crashed after ~20 seconds of gameplay on the Orlando, Florida match
column8:
Summary:
Once, during gameplay, on Orlando, Florida in Exhibition mode, when the user entered gameplay and played for ~20 seconds, the game crashed.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, the user selected Exhibition,
2) He selected Career Mode,
3) Selected 7 vs. 7 Capture the Flag,
4) Selected Orlando, Florida,
5) When gameplay began, the user played through the match normally for ~20 seconds,
6) Observed that the game crashed.

Expected Results:
The game must not crash.

NOTE(1): This crash occurred after the Xbox had been soaking in gameplay for 12 hours. Additionally, the user had played several levels prior to entering Orlando.
NOTE(2): An Xbox Xenon Crash Dump is available on the FTP in the following location:
/Paintball/X360 Crash Dumps

- PB_#4154.rar

column7: Video/Graphic - Opposing player shadows can be seen through objects in the map during gameplay.

column7: Video/Graphic - Team Outfit: The FL Firebird barrel clips in slightly into the Spyder MR2
column8:

In the Team Outfit, if the user equips the FL Firebird barrel and the Spyder MR2, the barrel clips slightly into the the marker

3) Buys both the FL Firebird barrel and the Spyder MR2
4) Selects Team Outfit
5) Equips both the FL Firebird barrel and the Spyder MR2

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: A section of the user's character's wrist is missing

3) Selects Gear Store
4) Buys the JT 08 Pro Glove and the JT 08 Pro Custom 2 jersey

All graphics must appear properly

JT 2008 Team Glove and JT 08 Pro Custom 1
JT 2008 Team Glove and JT 08 Pro Custom 2

column7: Menu/GUI - Team Outfit: The wrong item is highlighted after the user enters the code for the Tippmann X7 AK47
column8:
Summary:
In Team Outfit, if the user enters the code for the Tippmann X7 AK47, returns to the Team Outfit menu, the wrong item is highlighted and does not match the equipment text

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User selects Career Mode on the Main Menu
2) Selects Team Outfit
3) Enters the code for the Tippmann X7 AK47: Up, Up, Right, Right, Down, Down, Left, Left on the Directional Pad
4) Selects Ok on the message that an item has been unlocked
5) Returns to the Team Outfit menu
6) The wrong item category is highlight and the equipment list displays the equipment for the category to the right (Example: Hoppers is highlighted but the items on the list are for Barrels)

Expected Results:
The correct list must be selected after entering the code for the Tippmann X7 AK47

Note: The image in the background is also changing according the list and not the equipment that is centered on the screen

column7: Video/Graphic - Team Outfit: The image in the background appears with missing pieces after enter the code for the Tippmann X7 AK47

3) Enters the code for the Tippmann X7 AK47: Up, Up, Right, Right, Down, Down, Left, Left on the Directional Pad

column7: Gameplay: The user is not informed of the automatic firing is available for Woodsball matches

Summary:
During Exhibition, in any Woodsball match, the user is not informed that automatic firing is available

2) Selects Woodsball match
3) Proceeds into gameplay
4) Pushes the 2 Button to enter the Pause Menu
5) Selects Options
6) Selects Gameplay
7) Notice that there is an option to turn automatic firing on or off
8) At no point while entering the match is the user informed that automatic firing is an option

Expected Results:
Upon enters the Woodsball match the user must be informed that automatic firing can be turned on in the Options Menu

Suggestion: Have the text "Automatic Firing can be accessed through the in-game Options menu." on the Match Summary, under the Special Rules

3) While Michael Martin is looking down observe that his neck does not attach to his body.

Expected Results:
All head's and bodies must not separate.

column7: Collision Detection - Speedball - Miami, Florida: User's character clips into tanning booth bunkers.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in Speedball - Miami, Florida, if the user's character moves left of the spawn-point to the line of snake bunkers, Jumps on the snake bunkers, Moves to the tanning booth shaped bunker, lays in to prone position on top of the tanning booth bunker and then moves into the kneeling position, the user will observe that the user's character is now inside of the bunker.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter Speedball - Miami, Florida,
2) From the spawn-point move to the left to the line of snake bunkers,
3) Jump on to the snake bunkers,
4) Move to one of the tanning booth shaped bunkers,
5) Lay on top of one of the tanning booth bunkers in the prone position,
6) Change stance to the kneeling position,
7) Observe that the user's character is now looking out from inside of the tanning booth bunker.

Expected Results:
The user's character must not clip any bunkers.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: The user's character does not remove the lid to the Viewloader Dynasty Vlocity while reloading
column8:
Summary:
During Gameplay, with the Viewloader Dynasty Vlocity hopper equipped, if the user's character reloads, the user's character does not remove the lid to the hopper

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User selects any mode of gameplay on the Main Menu, with the Viewloader Dynasty Vlocity hopper equipped
2) Selects any location
3) Proceeds into gameplay
4) User's character fires at least one shot
5) Reloads the hopper
6) The user's character does not remove the lid to the hopper before reloading

Expected Results:
The user's character must reload the Viewloader Dynasty Vlocity properly, removing the lid before reloading the hopper and then replace the lid after reloading

column7: Occasionally - Gameplay - Career Mode: The user takes control of a eliminated teammate
column8:
Summary:
Occasionally, during Career Mode, if the user's character gets eliminated, the user is automatically placed behind a player that will be taken over, the player is eliminated before the user takes control, the user takes control of the eliminated player and the player is not counted as eliminated

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User selects Career Mode on the Main Menu
2) Proceeds into gameplay
3) User's character gets eliminated
4) The user is automatically placed behind another player that will be taken over
5) The player is hit by a paintball and is eliminated before being taken over
6) Occasionally, the user takes control of the eliminated player and the player resumes with gameplay

Expected Results:
The user must not take control of eliminated players

Steps to Reproduce:

2) User selects Play Tournament.
3) User selects XPSL Nevada.
4) User begins gameplay.
5) User observes a low frame rate during gameplay.

Expected Results: Gameplay must function smoothly.

NOTE: Some locations are less severe, but still noticeable.

column7: Scoring - Career Mode: Center Flag scoring is inconsistent, and incorrect.
column8:
Summary: Center Flag scoring is inconsistent, and incorrect. Depending on the number of players per match (1vs1, 2vs2, etc) the scoring changes for eliminations and survivors. For all center flag games the scoring for Flag Hangs and Flag Pulls is different, and incorrect. Ex. 7vs7 Hang = 40 points, Pull = 32 points. Ex. 1vs1 Hang = 32 points, Pull = 50 points. Ex. 5vs5 Hang = 55 points, Pull = 20 points.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User selects Exhibition. 
2) User selects Any Teams.
3) User selects 7vs7.
4) User selects Center Flag.
5) User begins gameplay at any location.
6) User picks up the flag first, and observes 32 points.
7) User hangs flag and observes 40 points.

Expected Results: Scoring must work correctly.

NOTE: Eliminations in 4vs4 and 5vs5 are worth 4 points instead of 3.
column9:
[vDev13 Fun Labs (AMP Dev) -- 10/17/2008 05:10:23 AM]
We thought that the 100pts system is to be used with the Capture the Flag matches.
Now we should have it also for Center Flag?

Requesting producer input on this.

column7: Video/Graphic - Multiplayer: While watching another person dive in multiplayer gameplay, User observes the other User's character clipping through environmental objects.
column8:
Summary:
While watching another person dive in multiplayer gameplay, User observes the other User's character clipping through environmental objects.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 hosts a default multiplayer match
2) User 2 joins User 1's game
3) User load into gameplay
4) User 1 positions their character so they are looking at User 2
5) User 2 runs at an object and performs the dive action
6) User 1 observes User 2's character clipping through the object.

Expected Results:
User's character must not clip through environmental objects while performing the dive action.

column7: Once - Crash - Multiplayer: User crashes after beginning gameplay on a Custom Houston, Texas with 13 bots.
column8:
Summary: User crashes after beginning gameplay on a Custom Houston, Texas with 13 bots. The custom map had 35 large round bunkers placed as close as possible to the middle of the map.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User selects Field Editor.
2) User selects Houston, Texas.
3) User deletes all of the bunkers, and replaces them with 35 Large Round bunkers, placed as closely to the center as possible.
4) User saves the map.
5) User creates a multiplayer match, using the custom map.
6) User adds 13 bots to the match.
7) User begins gameplay.
8) User observes crash.

Expected Results: Users must not crash.

column7: Video/Graphic - Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania: The course appears without a Big Spike on the 50 yard line, which violates NPPL's official rules.
column8:
Summary:
The course appears without a Big Spike on the 50 yard-line, which violates NPPL's Official rules.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User enters into gameplay at Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania
2) User observes no Big Spike on the 50 yard-line.

Expected Results:
A Big Spike must appear on either the right-50, left-50, or center-50.

column7: Technical Check - Multiplayer: If Client disconnects the network cable while the Game Lobby countdown begins, then plugs the network cable back in, the Client encounters a loading screen.
column8:
Summary:
In Multiplayer, if the Client disconnects the network cable while the Game Lobby countdown begins, then plugs the network cable back in, the Client encounters a loading screen.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Host creates default Multiplayer match
2) Client joins the Host's game
3) Host starts the Game Lobby timer
4) During the Game Lobby countdown the Client disconnects the network cable from the system
5) After the Client receives the disconnected message, the Client plugs the network cable back in the system
6) The Client selects OK on the disconnected message
7) The Client is brought back to the Main Menu
8) Client waits a few seconds
9) The Client encounters a Loading screen, then brought back to the Multiplayer Menu

Expected Results:
The Client must not get a loading screen in the Main Menu, after disconnecting the network cable from the Game Lobby.

NOTE: If the Client proceeds to single player or multiplayer gameplay after this bug occurs, the user crashes on the load screen.

column7: Video/Graphic - Multiplayer: AI players start in different standing positions.
column8:
Summary:
In Multiplayer, the AI players start in different standing positions.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Host creates default Multiplayer match
2) The Host adds the maximum number of bots to the Red Team and Yellow Team
3) Host starts the game
4) Gameplay appears
5) The Host notices that some AI start standing straight up and some AI players are leaning forward in a crouching position.

Expected Results:
All AI players must start in the same standing position.

NOTE: Bug also occurs in Exhibition.

column7: Menu/GUI - Multiplayer: There are no vital game statistics/settings displayed in the Game Lobby prior to entering gameplay.
column8:
Summary:
There are no vital game statistics/settings displayed in the Game Lobby prior to entering gameplay.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select Multiplayer,
2) Select Play Online or Local Network,
3) Create or Join a game,
4) Observe in the Game Lobby that there are no vital game statistics/settings displayed.

Note(1): Since there is a possible maximum number of 14 players, Users may have to wait in the Game Lobby an indeterminable length of time before entering gameplay and it would be very useful to have the Game Type, Time Limit, Rounds, whether or not Friendly Fire is turned on, and whether or not Cheating is allowed displayed in the Game Lobby before the match begins; Users may forget what the match settings are prior to entering gameplay.

column7: Comment - Gameplayer - Multiplayer: User should be able to control Bot difficulty level.
column8:
Summary:
User should be able to control Bot difficulty level before entering a match.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Multiplayer menu, User hosts a default match,
2) Adds a bot to the other team,
3) Loads into gameplay,
4) Observes that the bot is too easy.

Expected Results:
User must be able to control the bot difficulty before starting the match.

column7: Menu/GUI - Multiplayer: On the filters list for a client, there is no "Any" option for a filter.
column8:
Summary: 
On the filters list for a client, there is no "Any" option for a filter. The client has to choose specifically what game mode they want.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User selects Xbox Live
2) User selects Player Match
3) User selects Join Game
4) User observes no "Any" option is available

Expected Results: 
There must be an "Any"option available.

column7: Video/Graphic - Multiplayer: While watching another Player performing the reload animation, the User observes there is no pod within that Player's hand.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay of a Play Online match, if the User navigates their character up to another Player, that Player performs the reload animation, and the User observes no pod appears within that Player's hand.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 hosts a Play Online match with any settings.
2) User 2 joins the match.
3) All Users READY up, and User 1 launches the game.
4) Gameplay appears.
5) From the starting position, User 1 navigates their character to User 2's character, and positions themself to the side of User 2's character.
6) User 2 presses the "RB"/"Right Trigger" button to fire off a few paintball rounds at the ground.
7) User 2 then clicks the "Right Stick" (RELOAD) button to perform the reload action.
8) User 1 observes User 2's character perform the reload action.
9) User 1 observes that User 2's character has no pod in their hand when performing the action.

Expected Results:
The reload animation must appear correctly to other Players.

NOTE: No paintballs appear as well.

column7: Video/Graphic - Multiplayer - Multiple Members of the crowd float above the seating within the stands.
column8:
Summary:
Within multiplayer gameplay, multiple members of the crowd float above the seating within the stands in arena gameplay.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) The host creates a multiplayer match on an arena map
2) A client joins the lobby
3) The users load into gameplay
4) The users observe multiple members of the crowd are floating above the seating within the stands

Expected Results:
The crowd must appear normally within multiplayer gameplay.

Note: Easiest to notice on the Magala, Spain level.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: When the user changes their "default marker hand" to the left hand, the marker takes up more of the screen when compared to the right hand.
column8:
Summary: When the user changes their "default marker hand" to the left hand, the marker takes up more of the screen when compared to the right hand.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User selects quickplay.
2) User selects any location.
3) User begins gameplay.
4) User presses the X button to change their default marker hand.
5) User observes the marker takes up more screen space in the left hand than it does in the right hand.

Expected Results: Marker must take up the same amount of screen space in both hands.

column7: Gameplay: When a user presses directly up against an object, the object pushes the user to the left or right.
column8:
Summary: When a user presses directly up against an object, the object pushes the user to the left or right. The user is holding forward, but instead moves to either side.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User selects Quick Play.
2) User selects any location.
3) User begins gameplay.
4) User positions their character facing an object.
5) User presses up on the left-stick to run directly forward.
6) User observes their character move to the left or the right, once it has collided with the object.

Expected Results:
When the user navigates the character into an object the character must stop on the object when presses just forward.

column7: Video/Graphic - Multiplayer - After the completion of one round in multiplayer, the Round Results screen appears with 2 square, black, transparent text boxes

Summary:
After users complete one of the rounds in a multiplayer match, the Round Results screen appears. The Round Results screen appears with 2 square, black, transparent text boxes.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) 2 users load into any multiplayer match that is more than one round
2) Users complete the round and the Round Results screen appears before the start of the next round
3) Users will notice that Round Results screen appears with 2 black, square, transparent text boxes

Expected Results:
Text boxes must appear stylized and visually stimulating

column7: Menu/GUI - Multiplayer - Round Results: The Round Results screen only appears for 3 seconds.
column8:

The Round Results screen only appears for 3 seconds; shorter when/if all users press A to continue.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Multiplayer menu, Host creates a default multiplayer game,
2) Client joins the Host's game,
3) Users progress into gameplay,
4) Users complete a round,
5) The Round Results screen appears,
6) Users observe that the Round Results screen only appears for 3 seconds.

Expected Result:
The Round Results screen must appear for at least 10 seconds.

Note(1): If all Users press A on the Round Results screen, it will disappear in less than 3 seconds.

column7: Video/Graphic - Multiplayer: Changing their character's Standing stances causes the Player's character to momentarilly float off the ground.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in a Multiplayer match, if the User switches their character's stance from Standing to Crouching and finally to Prone, other Players in the game are able to observe that the User's character momentarily floats off the ground while switching stances.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 hosts a Player Match game with any settings.
2) At least one other User joins the game.
3) User 1 launches the game.
4) Gameplay appears.
5) All Users navigate to the same location on the level.
6) User 1 begins pressing the "B" button to make their character switch between the standing stances (Stand/Crouch/Prone).
7) All other Users look at User 1's character, and are able to see that User 1's character momentarily floats off the ground when switching standing stances.

Expected Results:
User's character must not appear to float off the ground when changing stand stances.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: When a user goes prone, that user's hand clips through the ground.
column8:
Summary: When a user goes prone, that user's hand clips through the ground.

Steps to Reproduce:

2) User selects any location.
3) User begins gameplay.
4) User presses "B" twice to go prone.
5) User observes their characters hand clips into the ground.

Expected Results: Users must not clip into the ground when prone.

column7: Audio/Sound - Multiplayer: While standing next to an opponent, if User 1 prompts a voice over, User 2 hears a different character's voice.
column8:
Summary:
While standing next to an opponent, if User 1 prompts a voice over, User 2 hears a different character's voice.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Multiplayer Menu, User 1 hosts a default multiplayer match,
2) User 2 joins the Host's game lobby,
3) Users enter into gameplay
4) User 1 progresses toward the opponent's character,
6) User 1 presses "Up" on the directional buttons to prompt a voice over,
7) User 2 observes that the voice over is spoken by a different character than on User 1's console.

Expected Results:
Voice overs from must be spoken by the correct character when heard from any console.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: In woodsball locations, the smaller pine trees change colors as the user approaches them from a distance.
column8:
Summary: In woodsball locations, the smaller pine trees change colors as the user approaches them from a distance. The trunks and leaves change colors as you approach the trees.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates a multiplayer match.
2) User 1 selects any Woodsball location.
3) User 2 joins User 1's match lobby.
4) Users begin gameplay.
5) User 1 positions their camera, in order to view a small pine tree from a distance.
6) User 1 presses forward on the left-stick to move toward the tree.
7) User 1 observes the pine tree change colors as they approach it.

Expected Results: Pine trees must not change colors when viewed from different distances.

column7: Menu/GUI - Comment - Multiplayer - Round Results: The Round Results and Final Results screens must appear easy for the User to read with clear indications of what all the stats and numbers relate to.

3) Users progress into gameplay,
4) Users complete a round,

Note(1): If the Users complete all rounds and arrive at the Final Results screen, the screen also has stats and numbers that are difficult to understand.

column5: Tournament 15 - NPPL Xtreme Paintball Beyond The P
column7: Once - Scoring - Career Mode - NPPL Xtreme Paintball Beyond the Paint: The opposing team's score appeared incorrect at the end of the round.
column8:
Summary:
Once, during Career Mode gameplay, NPPL Xtreme Paintball Beyond the Paint, Preliminary rounds, the user's character was eliminated at the same time as the last opposing player was eliminated ending the round in a draw, but the HUD and Results gave the user 21 point and the opposing team 24 points, awarding the win to the opposing team.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu select Career Mode
2) Select Play Tournament 
3) Select NPPL Xtreme Paintball Beyond the Paint
4) Enter into gameplay
5) The user eliminated the last opposing player while at the same time being eliminated ending the round
6) The HUD and Results awarded the user 21 points and the opposing team 24 points

Expected Results:
The points must be correctly calculated at all times for both the user and the opposing team.

Note(1): In a 7v7 CTF NPPL tournament, a team is awarded 3 points for each elimination. Both teams should only be able to reach a maximum of 21 points when eliminating all the opposing players.

column7: Scoring - Exhibition - Speedball (Center Flag) - Match Summary: The scoring texts for elimination and survivor must be taken out
column8:
Summary: 
During Exhibition, Speedball (In 5v5 and 7v7 Center Flag Matches), during the Match Summary screen, the scoring texts for elimination and survivor must be taken out

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter Exhibition, Speedball 
2) Select the Center Flag gametype
3) Select any player type match up to 5v5 or 7v7
4) Proceed to the Match Summary screen
5) Observe that the scoring includes points for elimination and survivor

Expected Results:
The scoring texts for elimination and survivor must be taken out to be consistent with gameplay.

NOTES(1): The Match Summary screen for 5v5 and 7v7 should be changed to match the gameplay.
NOTES(2): Screen shot attached

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: The user's character's teammates are not in the proper stance at the start of the round

1) User selects any mode of gameplay on the Main Menu
2) Selects any level
3) Proceeds into gameplay
4) Some of the user's character's teammates are not in the proper starting stance, and are instead standing and aiming their markers to the side

Expected Results:
The teammates must be in the proper starting stance at all times

column7: Frequently - Gameplay - Dynasty Training Drills - Fitness Stage 2: The user is directed to dive into a bunker that has already been completed.
column8:
Summary: Frequently, during Dynasty Training Drills, Fitness Stage 2, when the user's character performed a dive into a snake bunker and then immediately moved on to perform a dive into the next bunker (before the opposing player finished firing), the bunker in which the user's character was performing a dive into would very quickly recognize the dive and switch the indicator arrow graphic to the next bunker, and if the user's character performed a dive anywhere on the field thereafter, the indicator graphic switched back to the bunker that the user had previously completed a dive next to.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu select Dynasty Training Drills
2) Select Fitness
3) Select Stage 2
4) Move the user's character towards the first bunker while sprinting by holding the B Button
5) Press the A Button to perform a dive behind the bunker
6) Immediately after performing the dive press the - Button to put the user's character into a standing position
7) Move and hold the B Button to again sprint towards the next bunker
8) Press the A Button to dive behind the bunker
9) As the user pressed the A Button the arrow graphic instantly changed to the next bunker
10) The user performed a dive by moving forward while holding the B Button and then pressing the A Button in any area of the field
11) The arrow graphic changed back to the bunker that the user's character had already performed a successful dive behind

Expected Results:
The user must not be required to perform a dive behind a bunker that has already been successfully completed.

column7: Video/Graphic - Multiplayer: Host encounters moderate framerate drop during gameplay.
column8:
Summary:
In Multiplayer, the Host encounters moderate framerate drop during gameplay. Frame rate drops to 15 FPS when 14 clients have headsets and are communicating with each other.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Host creates a Player or Ranked match
2) 13 Clients join the Host's game
3) Host starts the game
4) Gameplay appears
5) During gameplay, the Host encounters moderate framerate drop during gameplay. Host also encounters ~15 FPS when voice communication is present.

Expected Results:
Host must not encounter framerate drops.
column9:
[vDev13 Fun Labs (AMP Dev) -- 10/26/2008 11:13:39 PM]
These issue has been improved. Please feedback

[Dean Fingerholz (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/27/2008 03:12:50 PM]
This issue still occurs in the 10.26.08 build. In general, the more bandwidth that is being sent, the worse the lag will be. In example, 14 players all moving and shooting will cause the host to have moderate lag, 10+ players talking over head sets will cause lag for the host as well.

[John Hart (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/29/2008 04:19:02 AM]
Verified in the 10/28 build

column7: Scoring - Career Mode (Results) : The Results screen does not correctly add up the team points.
column8:
Summary: 
During Career Mode, in any NPPL/XPSL tournament, after completing a game in the Preliminary Round of the tournament, the Results screen appears, and the opposing team's point total does not include the points received for Remaining Players.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter Career Mode, in any 100pt preliminary gametype matches
2) Proceed and complete the first preliminary match
3) User returns to the tournament bracket
4) Observe that the scoreboard appears incorrect for simulation matches between opponents

Expected Results:
The Results screen must accurately add up scores.

Note (1): Opponents do not receive points for Remaining Players.

Note (2): This issue applies to NPPL and XPSL tournaments, as well as any unlicensed tournaments. But it does not apply to Millennium tournaments.

Example: All but 1 player on the opposing team is eliminated, giving them 1 Survivor point. The opposing team eliminated 3 players from the user character's team, giving them 15 Elimination points. The final score for the opposing team displays as 15, which does not take into account the Survivor score.

column7: Frequently - Gameplay: The aiming reticule when leaning does not indicate where the shots will hit
