3) The Player pulls and holds the Left Trigger (Lean) while sprinting.
4) The Player presses the Right Bumper (Fire) or pulls the Right Trigger (Fire).
5) The Player releases the Left Bumper.
6) The Player fires while leaning, and the reticule does not indicate where the shots will hit.

The aiming reticule must always indicate the location the shots will hit.

Notes:
1) This goes away after running again, without holding down the Left Trigger.

column7: Comment - Gameplay: Sliding is innacurately implemented
column8:
Summary:
In gameplay, sliding is innacurately implemented.

Expected Results:
Sliding should be implemented as follows:
The Player should be allowed control of the duration and length of the slide, as to not get stuck sliding when the Player does not want to. This could be done by utilizing a hold and release button combo.
column9:
[George Batog (AMP Production) -- 09/23/2008 01:20:25 PM]
We need to have an explanation as to how you can control the length of your slide.

[John Hart (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/06/2008 01:49:12 AM]
The length could be just like the sprint meter. you have a default slide length and then you could just push the slide button again to cut the slide short. Or hold to slide and if/when you choose to cut the slide short, release the button. Again, using a slide meter.

Just a thought.

[Justin Westplate (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/20/2008 08:55:40 AM]
As of the 10/17/08 Build, the User is able to slightly slow down their slide; however, it is not as accurate as it could be by using button holds as opposed to button presses.

Ideally, the slide should last for as long as the User holds down the A Button. The on screen prompt would be changed to "Hold [A button graphic] to Slide". The slide would trigger when the A button is pressed, and would continue until the User's Character runs out of momentum, or when the User releases the A button.

column7: Gameplay: Sliding into obstacles does not stop the Player
column8:
Summary:
In gameplay, sliding into obstacles or barriers does not cause the Player to stop, and will slide around them.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay,
2) The Player proceeds towards a bunker.
3) The Player presses the RB and A buttons to slide into the bunker.
4) The Player slides into the bunker and is pushed around it while still in the slide animation.

Expected Results:
The Player must not slide around bunkers or obstacles

column7: Frequently (80%-89%) - Collision Detection - Train Depot Field: User is able to Dive into the wood stacks and become stuck inside
column8:
Summary:
Frequently (80%-89%), during Gameplay, at Train Depot Field, the user is able to Dive into the wood stacks and become stuck inside.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 Creates a match at Train Depot Field,
2) User 2 joins User 1's game,
3) Proceeds to Gameplay,
4) Gameplay begins,
5) Navigates to a stack of wood,
6) Runs towards the end cap of the wood,
7) Presses A button to Dive just before reaching the wood stack,
8) Observes diving into the wood stack and becoming stuck inside.

Expected Results:
All objects must have proper collision.

NOTE(1): Also occurs in PS3.
NOTE(2): Screenshots attached.
column9:
[John Hart (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/24/2008 01:58:55 AM]
Verified in the 10/22 build

column7: Video/Graphic: Multiplayer - Gold Mine Field, user observes LOD popping when navigating their character closer then further away from the large building with Tippmann banners.
column8:
Summary: During gameplay of an Xbox LIVE multiplayer match, user observes LOD popping when navigating their character closer then further away from the large building with Tippmann banners.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates an Xbox LIVE multiplayer match on the Gold Mine Field level.
2) User 2 joins user 1's game.
3) User 1 starts the game, gameplay begins for all users.
4) User 1 navigates their character towards the large building with Tippmann banners.
5) User 1 moves their character closer then further away from the building and observes LOD popping on the building.

Expected Results: Users must not observe LOD popping on the specified building.

Note: Video of issue attached.
Note: This issue occurs from either side of the building.
column9:
[John Hart (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/04/2008 07:51:18 PM]
Verified in the 10/04 build. Issue remains the same.

column7: Video/Graphic - Multiplayer - The user's character twists too far at the torso when viewed by other users in gameplay.
column8:
Summary:
Within multiplayer gameplay, when the user looks to the left or the right with the character, the other users observe the character's torso twisting too far before the legs turn with the rest of the body.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User1 creates a default multiplayer match
2) User2 joins the match
3) Gameplay begins
4) User1 navigates the character in front of User2's character
5) User1 turns the character to the right or left as far as they can before the legs of the character move
6) User2 observes that User1's character twists at the torso at an extreme angle

Expected Results:
The user's character must not twist at an extreme angle when viewed by other user's within multiplayer gameplay.

column7: Menu/GUI - Multiplayer - Host cannot scroll backwards through the level select screen to get from the first level to the last level
column8:
Summary:
When a user selects XBbox Live, selects Create game, the user is brought to the level select screen. The user then notices that they must scroll all the way to the right to get to the last level on the level select screen.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User selects Xbox Live
2) User selects Create Game
3) User is now on the level select menu and notices that they cannot scroll to the left to get to the last level. They must scroll all the way through all the levels to get to the last level.

Expected Results:
The level select screen must loop the levels so that users can easily access the woods ball courses. User must be able to scroll to the left while on the first level to get to the last level.
column9:
[John Hart (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/18/2008 02:43:32 AM]
Verified open on the 10/17 build. Issue occurs with the same steps.

[John Hart (AMP QA Lead) -- 10/24/2008 01:53:28 AM]
Verified in the 10/22 build

column7: Frequently - Video/Graphic - Gameplay: If the user is eliminated when against the level boundary the death camera will often clip though the ground and other level objects.
column8:
Summary:
Frequently, during gameplay in any level if the user is eliminated and against the level boundary, the camera will often clip through the ground and other level objects like crowds, benches, trees, and buildings. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Enter any gameplay level,
2) Move user's character to the level boundary,
3) Have the user's character be shot and eliminated
4) Observe that often after being eliminated that the camera will clip items in the level.

Expected Results:
The ground and all the objects in the level must appear solid.

column7: Gameplay - Gameplay: When crouched against a smaller sized bunker, the lean up action exposes the User's character, and still does not allow the User to see past that bunker.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in any Speedball level, if the User maneuvers their character to any smaller sized bunker, enters crouch mode, then performs the lean up action, the User observes that nothing is accomplished and they are still unable to see above that small bunker.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 hosts an Xbox LIVE Player Match game on any Speedball level.
2) User 2 joins the game.
3) Both Users ready up, and User 1 launches the game.
4) Gameplay appears.
5) User 1 maneuvers their character to a smaller sized bunker.
6) User 1 presses the "B" button once to make their character enter the crouch position.
7) User 2 navigates near User 1's position.
8) User 2 observes they are able to see User 1.
9) User 1 is unable to see anything past the bunker.
10) User 1 presses the "TRIANGLE" button to switch their lean mode to UP.
11) User 1 presses and holds the "LEFT TRIGGER" button to make their character lean up.
12) User 1 observes that they are still unable to see past the small bunker.
13) User 2 observes that User 1's character is even more exposed, and easier to shoot and eliminate.

Expected Results:
Leaning up must allow the User to see above a smaller sized bunker.

NOTE: Screen shots attached highlighting the issue.

column7: Gameplay - Gameplay: The User's character is unable to perform the lean action, when tightly pressed up against a bunker.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in any Speedball level, if the User maneuvers their character tightly against a bunker, the User observes that their character is unable to perform the lean action.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User enters gameplay in any Speedball level.
2) From their Starting position, the User maneuvers their character to any bunker.
3) User maneuvers their character tightly up against that bunker.
4) User presses the "LEFT TRIGGER" in an attempt to perform the lean action.
5) User observes that their character does not perform the lean action.

Expected Results:
User's character must be able to perform the lean action, when against a bunker.

column7: Gameplay - Gameplay: When crouching behind small bunkers, the User is unable to see, but the User's character can easily be seen and shot at by enemy Players.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay in any Speedball level, if the User maneuvers their character behind a small bunker and enters the crouch position, enemy Players will still be able to see and shoot the User's character but the User will be unable to shoot that enemy.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 hosts an Xbox LIVE Player Match game on any Speedball level.
2) User 2 joins the game.
3) Both Users ready up and User 1 launches the game.
4) Gameplay appears.
5) User 1 maneuvers their character to any smaller sized bunker.
6) User 1 presses the "B" button once to make their character crouch.
7) User 2 navigates their character to User 1.
8) User 1 observes that they are unable to see anything to the front of the bunker.
9) User 2 observes that User 1's head clearly breaks the top plane of the bunker, and observes that they are able to shoot and eliminate User 1.

Expected Results:
Enemy Players must not have an unfair advantage on the User, when the User's character is crouched behind a smaller sized bunker.

NOTE: Screen shots attached, highlighting the issue.

column7: TCR 022 - Team Selection Menu: The Player is unable to access the Xbox Guide Blade after the Paintball FMV finishes and the Player moves to the Team Selection Menu
column8:
Summary:
The Player is unable to access the Xbox Guide Blade after the Paintball FMV finishes and the Player moves to the Team Selection Menu

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the New Game Menu.
2) The Player selects New Game.
3) The Paintball FMV plays.
4) The Player presses the A button to skip the FMV.
5) The Character Selection Menu appears.
6) The Player quickly presses the A button.
7) The Team Selection Menu appears.
8) The Player quickly presses the Xbox Guide button, and the Xbox Guide Blade doesn't appear for ~3 seconds.

Expected Results:
The Xbox Guide Blade must appear without delay when the Xbox Guide button is pressed.

Games must ensure that system UI can be rendered at least every 66 milliseconds in all areas of the game for any display mode. This is a violation of TCR 022.

column7: TCR 022 - New Game Menu: The Xbox Guide Blade cannot be accessed until the FMV starts after selecting New Game
column8:
Summary:
The Xbox Guide Blade cannot be accessed until the FMV starts after selecting New Game

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the New Game Menu.
2) The Player selects New Game.
3) The Player quickly presses the Xbox Guide button, and the Xbox Guide Blade does not appear for ~3 seconds.

Expected Results:
There must be no delay between when the Xbox Guide button is pressed and when the Xbox Guide Blade appears.

Games must ensure that system UI can be rendered at least every 66 milliseconds in all areas of the game for any display mode. This is a violation of TCR 022.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: The field-sponsor logo on the very large, low to the ground, rectangle-shaped bunkers with rounded tops, darkens as if by shadow if the User manipulates the Right Stick (RS) at the correct angle.
column8:
Summary:
During gameplay, the field-sponsor logo on the large, low to the ground, rectangle-shaped bunkers with rounded tops, darkens as if by shadow if the User manipulates the Right Stick (RS) at the correct angle.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, select a game-type,
2) Select a field-location with large, low to the ground, rectangle-shaped bunkers with rounded tops (eg. Houston),
3) Enter gameplay,
4) Manipulate the Right Stick (RS) while viewing the bunker,
5) Observe that the field-sponsor logo abnormally darkens as if by shadow.

Expected Results:
Sponsor logos must not abnormally darken.

column7: Video/Graphic - Menu System: The "Change Storage Device" prompt does not have a black background in the Career Mode Save Career Menu
column8:
Summary:
The "Change Storage Device" prompt does not have a black background in the Career Mode Save Career Menu

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Career Menu, with Autosave enabled and the selected Storage Device removed.
2) The Player selects Play Tournament.
3) The Tournament Menu appears.
4) The Player selects any Tournament.
5) The Tournament Bracket appears.
6) The Player presses the A (Continue) button.
7) The Match Description Screen appears.
8) The Player presses the A (Contniue) button.
9) The Match Summary Screen appears.
10) The Player presses the A (Start Game) button, and the Autosave Menu appears, with the "Change Storage Device" without a black highlighted background.

Expected Results:
All navigational prompts must appear with the black background to improve readability and be consistent with the presentation of the game.

column7: Collision Detection - Gameplay: The row of low bunkers do not have collision detection along the top
column8:
Summary:
Low bunkers do not have collision detection along the top

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay, Houston, Texas.
2) The Player can jump onto the row of low bunkers and clip into them.

Expected Results:
The Player must not be able to clip into bunkers.

Notes:
1) This occurs for all rows of low bunkers.
2) The attached screenshot highlights this issue.

column7: Text - Multiplayer: Client's Pause Menu does not display the user's location
column8:
Summary:
During Gameplay, the Client's Pause Menu does not display the user's location.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User 1 creates a Multiplayer match at any location,
2) User 2 joins User 1's game,
3) Proceeds to Gameplay,
4) Gameplay begins,
5) User 2 (CLIENT) brings up the Pause Menu,
6) Observes there is nothing that displays the location.

Expected Results:
The Pause Menu must display the user's location to be consistant with the Host.

column7: Video/Graphic - Gameplay: Player shadows appear pixelated and low poly.
column8:
Summary:
In gameplay, the user's player's shadows appear low poly.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) User enters gameplay in Single Player or Multiplayer
2) Walks up to any inflatable obstacle
3) User notices the player's shadow appears pixelated and low poly

Expected Results:
Player shadows must not appear pixelated and low poly

column7: TCR 023 - Breakout Manager: The navigational prompts cross the Title Safe Area in 480p resolution and text and button graphics overlap
column8:
Summary:
The navigational prompts cross the Title Safe Area in 480p resolution and text and button graphics overlap 

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Breakout Manager, with the resolution set to 480p and the Screen format set to Normal.
2) The following navigational prompt crosses the Title Safe Area:

"Strategy"
"[Y button Graphic] Clear Shooter"

Expected Results:
The navigational prompts must not cross the Title Safe Area.

Games must display all text and menu items critical to gameplay, using the game's default settings, within the inner 90 percent of the x and y resolution for all display modes. This is a violation of TCR 023.

Notes:
1) The attached image highlights this issue.
column9:
[Steve Myers (AMP TRG Lead) -- 10/23/2008 11:56:29 AM]
This issue still occurs in 480p normal. A new image has been attached.

This issue was verified in the 10.22.08 build. A new image has been attached.

column7: TCR 003 - Front End: The game takes ~30 seconds to reach the Press START Screen from a fresh boot
column8:
Summary:
The game takes ~30 seconds to reach the Press START Screen from a fresh boot

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From a fresh boot.
2) The Player repeatedly presses the A and START buttons to skip the FMVs, and the Press START Screen appears after ~30 seconds.

Expected Results:
The game must take less than ~20 seconds to reach the Press START Screen.

Games must enter an interactive state that identifies the game and accepts player input within 20 seconds after the initial start-up sequence. If an animation or cinematic shown during the start-up sequence runs longer than 20 seconds, it must be skippable using the START button. The initial interactive state must not be displayed for longer than 120 seconds, at which point the game must enter attract mode. This is a violation of TCR 003.

IMPLEMENTATION NOTES:
1) The Activision FMV, Fun Labs FMV, Autodesk FMV can al be skipped as soon as the Player presses the A or START button - only the Legal FMV needs to be displayed for 3 seconds before being skippable.

Notes:
1) This is PreCert TCR 003 Issue 1 of 1.
column9:
[Steve Myers (AMP TRG Lead) -- 10/07/2008 04:17:25 PM]
In the 10.06.08 build, the loading time was increased to ~35 seconds.

[Steve Myers (AMP TRG Lead) -- 10/23/2008 11:40:53 AM]
This issue still occurs in the 10.22.08 X360 build. The loading time has been reduced back to ~30 seconds, and some of the FMVs are skippable.

column7: TCR 076 - Multiplayer: The Player is unable to view Player scores during Multiplayer gameplay
column8:
Summary:
In Multiplayer gameplay, the Player is unable to view individual Player scores before the end session Results screen appears.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During a Multiplayer Xbox LIVE Match,
2) The round ends, and no End Results screen that lists points broken down by Player appears.

Expected Results:
The Player must be allowed to view Player scores during a Xbox LIVE Multiplayer match.

Games that support the concept of competitive game play for both ranked and standard sessions must report a relative score before the end of the session. Games must rank the player in relation to the number of players in the session with the highest ranking going to the winner. This is a violation of TCR 076.

Notes: 
1) This occurs in all Xbox LIVE Multiplayer Modes: Unranked Match, Ranked Match.
column9:
[Steve Myers (AMP TRG Lead) -- 10/23/2008 09:50:25 AM]
No change in the 10.22.08 X360 build. Updated the issue to be clearer - A statistics screen identifying the scores by Player must appear, and the Player must be able to make Session Reviews for the Players listed on the screen.

column7: TCR 085 - Multiplayer: There is no end Session Player Review screen
column8:
Summary:
In Multiplayer, there is no Session Player Review screen at the end of a match.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During a Multiplayer Unranked Match,
2) The Player finishes the match.
3) The results screen appears, and the Player is unable to submit a Player Session Review.

Expected Results:
The Player must be allowed to submit a Player Session Review at the end of a Multiplayer Match.

Games that support post-game lobbies must provide the player the ability to directly submit a player review at the end of the game session for the 100 most recent players. This is a violation of TCR 085.

Notes:
1) This occurs in all Xbox LIVE Multiplayer Game Modes: Unranked Match, Ranked Match.
2) This functionality must occur on the results screen mentioned in Issue #2199.

column7: Technical Check - Multiplayer: Voice communication does not function properly
column8:
Summary:
In Multiplayer, the Voice communication does not function properly.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) In Multiplayer Menu System and Gameplay,
2) The Voice communications between Players does not function properly.

Expected Results:
Voice communication must function as such:

With Broadcast:
Game Lobby - All Players may communicate.
Loading Screen into Gameplay - All Players may communicate.
Gameplay - while still playing - All Players may communicate.
Gameplay, after shot - Shot Player may only communicate with other Shot Players.
End Match - All Players may communicate.

With Team Only
Game Lobby - All Players may communicate.
Loading Screen into Gameplay - All Players may communicate.
Gameplay - while still playing - Only Teams may hear each other.
Gameplay, after shot - Shot Player may only communicate with other Shot Players.
End Match - All Players may communicate.

Notes:
1) This must be implemented for all Multiplayer game modes: System Link, Ranked Match, Player Match

column7: Menu/GUI - Multiplayer: Voice Broadcast Disabled option must be removed.
column8:
Summary:
In Multiplayer, the Voice Broadcast Disabled option must be removed.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Multiplayer Main Menu,
2) The Player selects Play Online.
3) The Player selects Unranked Match.
4) The Player selects Create Game.
5) The Player selects a map.
6) The Player selects Voice Broadcast to Disabled.

Expected Results:
Voice Broadcast Disabled must be removed.

Notes:
1) Muting of players and volume of the speaking volume is handled on a per player basis. The inclusion of this option is unnecessary.

column7: TCR 071 - Menu System: There is no way to access the Gamer Card of the highlighted game's host's Gamer Card
column8:
Summary:
There is no way to access the Gamer Card of the highlighted game's host's Gamer Card

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Multi Player Menu, with a Xbox LIVE enabled Gamer Profile signed in and a Player Match hosted.
2) The Player selects Play online.
3) The Xbox LIVE Menu appears.
4) The Player selects Join Game.
5) The Games List/Filter Menu appears.
6) The Player presses the A (Refresh) button.
7) The Games List appears, and there is no way to access the Gamer Card of the listed Gamertags.

Expected Results:
Games must provide the player the option to access another players gamer card wherever gamertags are enumerated. This is a violation of TCR 071.

Notes:
1) This is PreCert TCR 071 Issue 1 of 1.
column9:
[Steve Myers (AMP TRG Lead) -- 10/08/2008 02:58:07 PM]
This occurs for both Player Match and Ranked Match. This must not function on System Link. - 10.06.08

column7: TCR 006/TCR 007/TCR 015 - Menu System: An active Gamer Profile change results in a sequence of load screens that is ~25 seconds, not engaging, and contains static black screens
column8:
Summary:
An active Gamer Profile change results in a sequence of load screens that is ~25 seconds, not engaging, and contains static black screens 

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu, with a Gamer Profile signed in.=
2) The Player presses the Xbox Guide button.
3) The Xbox Guide Blade appears.
4) The Player presses the X (Sign out) button.
5) The Player selects Yes, sign out.
6) The Gamer Profile is signed out.
7) The Player closes the Xbox Guide Blade, and a sequence of loading screens and static screens appear for ~23 to ~25 seconds.

Expected Results:
The game must move the Player to the Press START Screen with animated loading screens that take less than 15 seconds, and inform the Player the reason for the move.

Notes:
1) This also occurs for sign ins.
2) This also occurs in gameplay.

column7: Controls - Gameplay: Pressing the BACK button does not indentify the song
column8:
Summary:
Pressing the BACK button does not indentify the song.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) During gameplay.
2) The Player presses the BACK button, and no song info appears.

Expected Results:
When the Player presses the BACK button, informational text for the current song must appear.

column7: Controls - Menu System: Pressing the BACK button does not indentify the song
column8:
Summary:
Pressing the BACK button does not indentify the song.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu.
2) The Player presses the BACK button, and no song info appears.

Expected Results:
When the Player presses the BACK button, informational text for the current song must appear.

column7: Video/Graphic - Career Mode: Benching a character does not properly display that the character is not on the team
column8:
Summary:
In the Team Manager menu, benching a character does not properly display that the character is not on the team

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Career Menu,
2) The Player selects Team Manager.
3) The Player pulls the Left Trigger to bench a character, and the highlighted characters takes a small step back.

Expected Results:
A benched character must have a greater visual difference in their presentation to indicate to the Player which characters are benched or active.

column7: Video/Graphic - Menu System - Character Selection: Characters disappear when the scrolling through the selections
column8:
Summary:
In the Character Selection Menu, the characters disappear when the Player scrolls through the selection both left and right.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu,
2) The Player selects New Game.
3) The Character Selection screen appears.
4) The Player scrolls left/right and the characters disappear while navigating between characters.

Expected Results:
Characters must not dissapear when scrolling through the characters.

column7: TCR 029 - Menu System: The game informs the Player their saved game is corrupt after they select Continue without a Storage Device present or selected.
column8:
Summary:
The game informs the Player their saved game is corrupt after they select Continue without a Storage Device present or selected.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the New Game Menu, with a Gamer Profile signed in and a Storage Device present that contains a saved game.
2) The Player selects Load Game.
3) The Load Game menu appears.
4) The Player presses the Y (Select Storage Device) button.
5) The Select a Device Blade appears.
6) The Player presses the B (Back) button.
7) The Player select Cancel.
8) The Main Menu appears.
9) The Player presses the B (Back) button.
10) The Player selects Yes.
11) The New Game Menu appears.
12) The Player selects Continue, and the following message appears:

"Saved game appears to be damaged and cannot be used."

Expected Results:
Remove this option.

When an error prevents a game from performing a task dictated by the player or expected under normal gameplay, the game must display a user-friendly message that addresses the error. The game must transparently handle software errors that are not relevant to gameplay. This is a violation of TCR 029.

Notes:
1) The game has already recieved confirmation that unsaved progress will be lost when leaving the Main Menu, the Continue option is not necessary.
column9:
[Steve Myers (AMP TRG Lead) -- 09/21/2008 07:25:08 PM]
Additional note:
In the 9.20.08 X360 build, when selected, the Player is informed their saved data is corrupt, causing a TCR 029 issue. This issue has been updated to reflect this change.

column7: Text - Tournament Bracket: Team list contains overlapping text.
column8:
Summary:
In Career Mode, Tournament Bracket, the team name, "Camp Pendelton Beginner Walk Ons", overlaps the amount of points that team has accumulated for the tournament.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) From the Main Menu select Career Mode
2) Select Play Tournament
3) Enter a tournament with, "Camp Pendelton Beginner Walk Ons" as one of the listed opposing teams
4) Complete the first match
5) Observe that the Tournament Bracket menu, appearing with the list of team scores, has the text for the team name, "Camp Pendelton Beginner Walk Ons" overlapping the score.

Expected Results:
Text must not overlap.
